Entry Level Full-Time, Fixed-term position for 24 months. Band 5 - $76K per annum, plus superannuation and a monthly RDO. Hybrid working arrangements available. Free on-site parking.  Manningham offers challenging and rewarding employment opportunities to innovative, passionate, and driven people. We have a positive and friendly working environment and are committed to fostering a customer focused, delivery led culture. We offer our employees a range of benefits including flexible work options, opportunities for career development, health and wellbeing initiatives, and an active Social Club.  The opportunity  Working as part of the Business Enablement service unit, the Graduate Performance Analyst is a full-time, entry-level position centred around supporting the data management, monitoring, and reporting requirements across Manningham Councils Customer Service, Planning and Performance and Enabling Projects teams.  Key activities of this role include:  supporting data analysis, with an emphasis on governance reporting and Council Service Plan preparation and planning. supporting data management and cleansing practices for variety of Business and Project functions. providing analysis and support to service units for CRM transactions, issue analysis, resolution and maintenance – particularly in non-compliant cases. assisting with Power BI integration and report enhancements across strategic and service planning, to support Service Unit and directorate reporting activities. supporting data visualisation and reporting for ease of use and consumption in how decisions are made.  As a Manningham Council graduate you can expect:  experiences in real roles and projects, doing meaningful work. learning and development support to build the foundational capabilities and skills for a successful career. guidance from a network of mentors across our Service Units. invaluable exposure to Local Government services.  Click here to view the position description.  About you  You have completed a tertiary degree in Information Management, Information Systems, Data Science or another relevant field, within the last 2 years. You are seeking an entry-level pathway into the workforce, looking to create a foundation for a career in data management and analysis. You have demonstrated experience in Power BI, Excel and MS Dynamics for custom report creation and generation. You are a problem solver, able to resolve complex operational and service delivery issues to meet the needs of stakeholders. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and a comprehensive report writing skills. You possess well developed organisational skills to plan, prioritise and organise work to meet performance objectives and targets. You have an understanding of developing and re-engineering data models and dashboards. You are a team player with a willingness to contribute and collaborate well with others.  Why join us?  We are committed to delivering the best workplace experience for our people.  This means that we live our values (Working Together, Excellence, Accountable, Respectful, Empowered) every day. We understand the value of a safe and inclusive workplace culture, which is why we are committed to gender and intersectional equality. Our Employee Code of Conduct, Reconciliation Action Plan and Gender Equality Action Plan hold us accountable as we continue to build on positive change at Manningham.  We are embracing new technology and improving our customers’ experiences.  It’s a very exciting time to be working at Manningham. Working here is often challenging where no day is the same. You will have the opportunity to take ownership of your work, have your ideas heard and your achievements acknowledged.  We are constantly transforming our organisation to best support the needs of our local community.  We are looking for a new game changer to join the team. A high performing individual who wants to shape positive and inclusive outcomes for our community. You’ll have the opportunity to take ownership of your work while developing and testing new ideas within a culture of learning to deliver excellent outcomes for Manningham.  How to apply:  Your application for this position should be addressed to Stephen Keam, Program Manager, and can be submitted via the link below.  Applications close at 11:00pm AEDT on 10 December 2023.  If you have any questions about the position, please contact Stephen Keam on (03) 9840 9307. For all other enquiries contact Human Resources via email at hr@manningham.vic.gov.au  Council recognises the benefits of a diverse workforce for its employees and customers.  To ensure equity of access to employment opportunities, Council encourages applications from underrepresented groups including people who are from an Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background, people from different ages, abilities, gender identities, sexual orientation and cultural backgrounds.  Manningham Council have a number of policies and practices to help support our staff, including a Working from Home policy, flexible work practices and an IT infrastructure to support various communication methods when working remotely.  If you require any additional support or adjustments regarding interview arrangements, please advise the contact listed above in advance.  Manningham Council is a child safe organisation and, as such, applicants may be required to hold a Working with Children Check.Show moreReport

job_title: Business Analyst - Cappitech Trade and Transaction Regulatory Reporting
job_description: S&P Global Market Intelligence  The Role: Business Analyst - Cappitech Trade and Transaction Regulatory Reporting  The Team: We are over 14,000 analysts, data scientists and specialists armed with real-time technology and data, working together to uncover deeper sources of information. The unique insights we provide help the industries and markets that drive our economies operate more efficiently, outpace competition and secure long-term success. Our global insights impact nearly every major sector - from aerospace to automotive. We empower our customers by isolating cause and effect, risk and opportunity in new ways so they can make well-informed decisions with greater confidence. This is a force we call The New Intelligence.  The Impact: We are looking for self-driven individuals with great problem solving and analytical skills with knowledge in financial services. You will be responsible for providing day-to-day customer support for all services supported within the Global Regulatory Reporting Solution’s suite of products.  Responsibilities: We’re looking for a Business Analyst within the Global Regulatory Reporting Solutions Division who can do the following:  Assist in requirements gathering and business analysis in regulatory reporting Collaborate with technology, operations, sales, and business development to deliver regulatory reporting solutions Translate regulatory requirements into business requirements and functional specifications Able to work with QA and Development during testing to ensure implementation meets design and requirements Oversee Sanity and Component testing of new features during the development phase & review of Test Plans Act as a liaison between the client and the delivery team to define and validate client requirements for regulatory reporting solutions Partnering with developers and testers in designing and delivery solutions Maintain strong partnership with internal and external stakeholders  What We’re Looking For: University graduate or equivalent Minimum 5 years industry experience as a Business Analyst or Project Manager Financial market awareness in financial technology, multi-asset derivatives pre and post trade processing and services Ability to multi-task and consistently meet deadlines under pressure Self-directed and highly motivated Strong analytical ability to understand and solve problems Strong with interpersonal skills Excellent at oral and written communication A team player Someone with the ability to work under pressure  S&P Global Grade ( relevant for internal applicants only ): 9  The Location: Singapore or Sydney  About Company Statement: S&P Global delivers essential intelligence that powers decision making. We provide the world’s leading organizations with the right data, connected technologies and expertise they need to move ahead. As part of our team, you’ll help solve complex challenges that equip businesses, governments and individuals with the knowledge to adapt to a changing economic landscape.  S&P Global Market Intelligence partners with customers to broaden their perspective and operate with confidence by bringing them leading data sources and technologies that embed insight in their daily work.  #LI-CC2  -----------------------------------------------------------  Equal Opportunity Employer S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Posted 10/11/2023 Job Number 21142 Full/Part Full Time Posting End Date 08/12/2023 About the Role We are currently recruiting for a Data and Optimisation Analyst, to support the Clinical Resource Funding Manager in optimising clinical funding claims through monitoring of clinical data and Resident Funding Classification. You will be responsible for supporting the Funding Support – Admissions and Reassessments team by analysing clinical data to identify changes in resident care needs. 3-6 month fixed term contract Benefits Range of discounts on Bupa products – Healthcare, Optical, Dental ‘People First’ wellness program that can be accessed by all employees. Bupa Online Leadership Development, available on demand. Clinical learning opportunities and more, through online and face to face training. Employee Networks for you to get involved in an area you are passionate about, have your voice heard and be you at Bupa. Duties Be the subject matter expert for the review of the Australian National Aged Care Classification (AN-ACC) claims against the AN-ACC funding on the Payment Statements. Responsible for identifying any variances between claims and funds received and taking action to rectify accordingly Identify and monitor the triggers for reassessment of residents and manage the analysis of clinical data. Where reassessment is feasible, provide guidance to the Funding Support – Admission and Reassessment team and ensure action is taken Monitor and document new classifications received through My Aged Care for reporting to and guiding key stakeholders in operations and workforce management Independently analyse reports and Lee Care to identify both residents with changing care needs resulting in AN-ACC reassessment, and residents approaching key milestone criteria under the AN-ACC reassessment rules Liaise with Admission and Reassessment team to provide confirmation of new resident admissions Monitor and analyse AN-ACC Classes against care minutes, especially around impact form reassessments Maintain Epicor database for admissions and reassessments Skills & Experience Knowledge of the Australian National Aged Care Classification (AN-ACC) tool (Essential) Previous experience with data analysis and manipulation (at least 2 years’ experience) Strong computer skills including dashboard management Analytical skills (for Payment Statements and report analysis) Registration with the Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (essential) Experience in clinical care management with sound knowledge and experience Ability to use key systems and government funding portals Strong Organisation skills and excellent time management Auditing experience Change management experience Proven written and communication skills Advanced clinical assessment skills Culture We all share the same purpose at Bupa Aged Care. Helping people live longer, healthier, happier lives and making a better world. We take pride in delivering high-quality care with a personal touch. Bupa champions a unique agile culture, one that adapts to your needs as a member of our team. Our focus is not limited to our residents but also your wellbeing and career growth. We aim to support you with tools you need to achieve a fulfilling career. How to Apply Click Apply to be taken to our online application process. As part of your application, you will be asked to complete pre-employment checks. To learn more about working at Bupa please visit our website: https://careers.bupa.com.au Bupa are committed to providing equal opportunity and access to employment and career pathways to First Nations peoples across Australia. About the job Data Analyst JD for Data Insights & Analytics Analyst role: As a Data Insights & Analytics Analyst, you are an important contributor to analysing business problems and recommending solutions which drive data decision making within our organisation.  You will also be working closely with Data Engineering & Data Science teammates and the Product Owner on identifying and documenting technical and business requirements to facilitate the development of new data solutions. To be successful in this role, you will ideally be experienced in working with Data warehouse solutions for a large organisation coupled with Business Analyst skills.  You will be responsible for: Probe, source and manipulate large data sets to resolve issues or develop a solution to enable business decisions Defining business Problems, assist with the development of hypothesis, undertake relevant reporting, summarise insights and make recommendations for actions.  Investigating and analysing large datasets to help resolve business problems or develop a solution to enable business decisions.  Visualising data using Power BI, and creating dashboards that integrate data from multiple source systems to analyse, track and report on different Metrics.  Identify stakeholder pain points, provide insights reporting and root cause analysis to support Product Owners.  Breaking down the business requirements in epics and user stories, elaborating and handing over to the technical team for development.  Supporting the technical team with their queries.    To be successful in this role, you need to have:  Knowledge in business requirements gathering, data profiling, and data analysis.  Good knowledge of SQL to extract, join and transform data.  Data visualisation including working with an enterprise data visualisation platform such as Tableau or Power BI.  Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.  A proactive and self-motivated approach with customer / stakeholder centric mindset.  Exposure to workday data and People Analytics will be a plus.  Relevant Tertiary qualification or equivalent experience on computer science or data science.  Familiarity of Agile working model.  Experience in agile tools such as Jira, Confluence etcShow moreReport

Our team work with leading brands in our region to bring data & analytics to life! Act as pivot point between IT and trade team to achieve all KPIs set by the business. Company Description Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive. When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement. Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.  Job Description Sr Data Analyst, Managed Services - 1 year fixed-term Melbourne (Australia) About the role: Do you want to be a part of Visa’s fastest growing team in Australia and New Zealand? Do you enjoy delivering and getting things done? Do you want to make positive impacts for customers and accelerate the pace of innovation in the payments industry? If so, Visa Managed Services (VMS) is the team for you. The VMS team is all about delivery, implementation, and execution. We create squads of delivery consultants to embed within our clients’ organizations to help them deliver better results, faster.’ If you're a Data Analyst who loves data, create insights, solve challenging business problems and want to use your skills for the greater good… then we have the perfect role for you! Why join us: This role will support a key strategic client in Australia helping them deliver on their bank-wide, large-scale simplification agenda. Visa Managed Services is our fastest growing team in Australia and New Zealand – we’ve grown 10x in less than 2 years – and always have fun projects on the horizon to sink our teeth into We get to work with incredible people every day. We’re a team of intrapreneurs who work hard, have fun, and get stuff done. We are a people business where the people are our product. As a result, all our people leaders are 100% dedicated to ensuring a positive employee experience. We attract top talent and are manically focused on developing and retaining that talent at Visa. We are committed to building a diverse team with an inclusive culture that reflects the communities we work in We’re a global company and VMS is a global focus area for Visa. Once established in our Australia team, you’ll have the opportunity to explore roles focused on scaling our VMS business around the world. We support flexible working options and industry leading compensation & benefits. Join us and make a difference today. What you will be doing: Ideally based in Melbourne but with hybrid work options, you will develop and maintain dashboards to understand the performance of various portfolio optimisation initiatives. Your responsibilities will include transforming data for use in creation, maintenance, and automation of the dashboards. You will work closely with the Data Delivery Lead, Product Consultant and Client Portfolio lead to build dashboards, generate insights, solve business problems using customer and transactional data. In this role you will: Explore our clients’ data infrastructure and systems, analyse various datasets, perform data analysis, finding patterns and generating valuable insights to support critical business initiatives and present them back to the business teams. Build dashboards to visualize insights and understand behaviour of customers or understand performance of various portfolio optimisation initiatives. Perform ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions. Producing written communication, visualizations and presentations for leadership and other key stakeholders. What you will bring: Key competencies: Solution-mindset – Applying creative problem-solving techniques and championing a client-first approach to customer insights when opportunities and challenges arise to meet specific business objectives. Active Contributor to Team Success – Strong team orientation with a collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style. Able to work effectively in a matrixed organization. Tenacity – Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with the ability to progress multiple priorities concurrently. Building Strategic Work Relationships - Excellent client engagement and relationship management skills with a collaborative approach to stakeholder management Driving Execution – Motivated by delivery and with a high attention to detail. What you will need to be successful: Proficient in SQL as an intermediate to advanced level. Experience of working on data platforms like Teradata or GCP is highly preferred. Experience in data visualisation is required, Tableau or QlikSense is highly preferred. Experience in analytics programming languages (e.g., Python) is highly preferred. Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint and the ability to effectively communicate a story through data (visualisations, storytelling) Experience with GitHub and Confluence is highly preferred. Adept at data crunching, and passionate about unearthing significant patterns and meaningful insights. An eye for accuracy, the ability to self-manage multiple data sets and data requests, and flexibility to respond quickly. You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At Visa a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you. What will also help: High performance delivery focus with a high attention to detail Strong communication skills to make complex concepts accessible for business stakeholders. Ability to influence and collaborate at all levels without relying on hierarchy. Strong team orientation with a collaborative, diplomatic, flexible style and able to work effectively across multiple teams. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Outcome orientated, persistence to challenge the status quo and deliver customer results. A Growth mindset, constantly striving to learn and develop. Excellent client engagement and relationship management skills with a collaborative approach to stakeholder management Innovation minded with high problem-solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor. Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with the ability to progress multiple priorities concurrently. Why Work with us: We are known for offering industry-leading compensation. We have state of the art offices in Melbourne, Sydney, and Auckland We provide world class benefits including: Mental health and wellbeing resources to all employees Generous annual leave plus carers leave, parental leave, baby bonding leave, and pregnancy loss leave, among others Paid volunteering leave & employee referral program cash awards. Ability to work from another location for up to 1 month each year. Global company with global opportunities. We can share endless stories of how we’ve supported our employees to accelerate their career progression and pursue opportunities in other geographies around the world. This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.  Qualifications Proficient in SQL as an intermediate to advanced level.Experience of working on data platforms like Teradata or GCP is highly preferred.Experience in data visualisation is required, Tableau or QlikSense is highly preferred.Experience in analytics programming languages (e.g., Python) is highly preferred.Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint and the ability to effectively communicate a story through data (visualisations, storytelling)Experience with GitHub and Confluence is highly preferred.Adept at data crunching, and passionate about unearthing significant patterns and meaningful insights.An eye for accuracy, the ability to self-manage multiple data sets and data requests, and flexibility to respond quickly. Additional Information Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.Show moreReport

ABOUT CAPTIFY Captify is the leading Search Intelligence Platform for the open web and the largest independent holder of first-party search data outside of Google, connecting the real-time searches from over 2 billion devices globally. Its Search Intelligence technology powers omnichannel programmatic advertising and real-time insights for the world’s biggest brands, such as Disney, Unilever, eBay, Mercedes-Benz, Microsoft, Nestlé, GSK, Uber, Mars, P&G, Sony and Toyota—without reliance on third-party cookies. Captify brings brands more customers, publishers greater yield and consumers the most relevant digital experiences.  OUR CULTURE AND VALUES Here at Captify we are proud of our culture - It’s contagious. Pass it on. Step inside any of our global offices and one thing that is blissfully obvious is that while we’re putting blood, sweat and tears into disrupting the Search game, we’re having a seriously good time doing it. We’ve travelled the world together, enjoyed Captify Festivals, parties and our famous events across every market. We always take time to stop to celebrate milestones and wins. We champion diversity and inclusion. Our 'BeTheChange' programme and internal D&I Taskforce brings our teams together to challenge, learn and build a more equal Captify. We live by our core values:  Building this together Give a shit Fail fast to succeed faster Unlimited potential  Find out more about our culture here: https://careers.captify.co.uk/ OVERVIEW Our advertising insights functions partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build strong businesses and brands. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age by leveraging our unique Search Intelligence technology. Captify is looking for a Media Insights Analyst at the start of their career to support the delivery of market leading, high-quality media insights and data visualisations. Prior experience working within Media Agency, Market Research Agency, Consulting or AdTech in a similar role is desirable and an understanding of the digital advertising ecosystem and digital advertising data sets is required. The role will require considerable cross functional engagement, we believe in collaboration, one of our core values being to “build this together” therefore expect to work with every part of our business. With exciting projects, technologies and services in the pipeline now is a great time to be part of our journey. ABOUT YOU You'll have a very strong attention to detail, high standards of internal communication, numerical analysis, team collaboration and multi-tasking. Most importantly of all, the ability to fail fast and learn even faster is crucial in this role. We want you to take personal pride in your work and be determined to improve at all times. As a result of the above, this role has a high learning curve for the right candidate, as such you will need to be able to handle fast-paced change. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES What you’ll be doing:  Leverage a large digital dataset to provide advertisers and media agencies with best in class market, brand, product or ad campaign insights Work closely and consultatively with Sales/Client Strategy teams to define client insight requirements and manage pipeline of projects Effectively manage workloads and delivery of projects within a fast-paced environment Maintain a consistency of high level of quality to all projects, across analysis, commentary and visualisation Participate in the planning and design of new reporting and analysis products for internal and external use. Communicate research findings to technical and non-‐technical audiences internally and externally Help to build a dynamic and thriving insight community globally  REQUIREMENTS What you need to be successful:   A degree in Psychology, Business, Data Science, Social Science or Statistics or a related field 1-2 years of experience working with advertising or digital data Strong conceptual, problem solving, analytical skills Strong attention to detail and paired with a great sense of curiosity Have some knowledge of statistical techniques such as clustering, regression, attribution, and significance testing or related coursework in statistics or digital analytics Demonstrate capabilities to communicate with a range of stakeholders: influencing and working effectively with technical and non-technical audiences - asking intelligent questions and able to translate analysis into compelling stories - making complex data analysis clear and impactful Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint software  YOU WILL ENJOY  25 days holiday + bank holidays + your birthday + volunteer day Regular shut down days, including the festive period Access to SPILL - instant therapy support Access to Mental Health First Aiders Sport and wellbeing activities Financial wellbeing support Work from home and flexible/core working hours Work from any Captify office in the world Capti-Family Benefits Free snacks, breakfast & lunch once a week Pet-friendly office  EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES You are welcome at Captify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what your search history says about you. At Captify, equality is at the core of our culture and we are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. We don’t want you to fit in with our culture, we want you to add to our culture. For candidates, view our EU HR Candidate Privacy Notice here.Show moreReport

Help us deliver like never before Australia Post is delivering like never before. From the vehicles that we drive, to the small businesses that make our communities thrive. We’re delivering for the environment, for our communities, for our customers and for our people. We’re moving forward and we want you to come along for the ride. About the opportunity The Group Sustainability Office acts as a Centre of Excellence that delivers sustainable commercial outcomes, accountability, and transparency for Australia Post by optimising the social, environmental & economic impacts of our operations. The Sustainability Analyst (12 Month Fixed Term Contract) will support the execution of the 2025 Sustainability Roadmap by assisting with the analysis and reporting of environmental sustainability data. The Sustainability Analyst will work closely with the Sustainability Manager (Energy & Carbon) and the Sustainability Manager (Waste, Resources and Circularity), supporting them with the collection and analysis of data, and the submission of detailed sustainability reports. You’ll be responsible for: Support in deriving actionable insights, that contribute to better environmental outcomes for Australia Post, including through regular reporting. Support continuous process improvement based on data and best practice insights. Develop presentations and reports based on the input received and insights developed. Play a role as the key contact point, and subject matter expert for the Digital Carbon Platform, and continuously improve the quality of the input and reporting. Support energy, carbon and waste/recycling data analysis and monthly reporting – including processing, validating, and reviewing of complex environmental and asset datasets, including through our new environmental reporting platform, waste reporting tool, and Carbon Calculator. Support external customer reporting, including through providing insights and reports to contract customers on carbon profiles. About you You will have a passion for dealing with complex data, developing processes and providing analysis of trends specifically for the environmental reporting requirements of Australia Post. You will be able to support the organisation with new legislative reporting requirements and communicate the impact to a range of stakeholders with less technical understanding. What are we looking for? Strong analytical skills and high level of business acumen Sustainability analytics and reporting experience Comprehensive understanding of Corporate Responsibility/Sustainability reporting. Extensive experience with Microsoft Office Suite (with Advanced Excel and knowledge of SQL) Experience with technology applications including: GCP, Looker, and Power BI. Experience in working with complex datasets efficiently and effectively. Proven ability for problem-solving, and simplifying complex problems and processes Experience with and understanding of sustainability and compliance reporting – experience processing energy, carbon and waste data will be highly regarded. How we’ll deliver for you Join one of the most culturally and linguistically diverse workforces in Australia, where we’re all ages, genders and come from all walks of life. We deliver on our values of Trust, Inclusivity, Empowerment and Safety every day. They’re the TIES that bind our team together. Immerse yourself in the AP Way – where every single team member partakes in a learning module to help understand the vital role we play in delivering on our strategy and purpose. We’re delivering together At Australia Post, we acknowledge the Traditional Custodians of the land on which we operate, live and gather as employees. We believe our business should reflect the diverse communities we operate in and are proud to be an inclusive workplace for people from all walks of life. We encourage applications from people of all ages, genders and backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, People with Disability, LGBTQIA+ and Refugees. We are also the largest organisation in Australia to successfully achieve Disability Confident Recruiter status and are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment process and workplace for those living with a disability. If you have any questions, please contact our Diversity & Inclusion team on inclusivecareers@auspost.com.au One last thing Research shows that women and people of colour are less likely to apply for roles if they don't meet every qualification. If after reading this, you’re not sure you tick every single criteria box, but have the passion to get behind our purpose, the determination to face a challenge and a willingness to grow and learn, we think you should click that apply button anyway. We're passionate about building a diverse and inclusive team, and love hearing from people like you.Show moreReport

By accompanying our core member and employer administration with a full range of value-added services, we offer the most comprehensive superannuation administration solution on the market. job_title: Junior Data Analyst and Administration Support
job_description: Introduction: At Lite n' Easy our goal is to create a healthier Australia by changing the way Australians eat. We make it easy for people to eat well, whether they want to lose weight or simply stay healthy. As a quality driven food company, all of our creative energies go into making our meals as delicious as they are healthy.  Description: Our focus on quality and exceeding our customer's needs means that as a business we are continuously growing and as a result, we are looking for Full Time Junior Data Analyst and Administration Support to join our team in our Banyo, Brisbane location. Here are some of the fantastic benefits we offer when you join our great team:  Free and secure onsite parking Free access to our onsite wellbeing centre - free gym with equipment as good as your local gym, personal trainer, classes from Zumba, Circuit and Yoga Free onsite doctor weekly, medical checks including, flu vaccinations, skin checks and health checks Excellent discount on our food products for yourself and a family member, canteen with our food products You can shoot some hoops or play some table tennis on your break Free ongoing professional training opportunities - Certificate 3 in Food Processing and other accredited training and internal training to develop your personal skills Themed events - Melbourne Cup celebrations, Easter Coffee Cart, Family fun days at a theme park for yourself and family, Christmas Gift Card, after 1 year of service Christmas Clothing item, after 3 years of service Christmas ham or fruit box!  Reporting to the Operational Excellence Data Analyst, your day-to-day duties will involve:  Analysing data Ability to interpret data, analyse results and provide ongoing reports Ability to analyse and advise on new process improvements opportunities in data capture, analysis and reporting General administration and office support Providing support to the purchasing officer and assisting when required Assisting with implementing and communicating new processes Keeping a positive workplace culture Helping to ensure efficiency and effectiveness within the business  Key Skills and Experience: Exceptional time management and organisational skills with the ability to prioritise and work on multiple projects at once Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build positive relationships with all key stakeholders Ability to learn about Lite n’ Easy operations, products, services, systems and processes Resourceful – ability to source information utilising available technology and resources Motivated and enthusiastic with a genuine passion for learning, development and continuous improvement Proficient on MS Office and desktop computer programs Flexible to work on a variety of tasks across all our shifts to meet business requirements  If this sounds like you and you are up for the challenge, please click the Apply Now Button and submit your application.  Please note: You must be a permanent resident or citizen to apply.Show moreReport

Who we are: At Torrens University Australia, making a difference is in our DNA. As a Certified B Corporation, we belong to a global community of future-focused companies using business as a force for good. We believe in the transformative power of education to change lives, families, communities – and the world. That’s why we’re on a mission to increase access to higher education, so learners from all walks of life can chase their dreams.  Just like our students, our employees are a diverse group who want to make an impact. When you join us, we give you the freedom to be bold, creative and courageous – with flexible working arrangements that allow you to bring your best. We’ve built a culture that celebrates community, collaboration and innovation, where people love what they do.  What’s the job? This is an exciting new opportunity within Torrens University Australia, we’re looking to hire a Commercial Data Analyst and Trainer. We are actively seeking a proficient Commercial Data Analyst and Trainer to join our organization. This role holds a critical place within our company, as it primarily involves the analysis of customer service and sales data to identify trends. Subsequently, the role involves leveraging these insights to enhance the skills and knowledge of our customer service and sales teams by providing guidance on both their strengths and areas for performance improvement. What does the ideal candidate look like? You should possess a true passion for data, coupled with a robust foundation in data analytics systems like Power BI. Moreover, your enthusiasm should shine through as you piece together data and other insights to discern areas for enhancement, gauge performance metrics, and uncover potential avenues for development within our CX teams. Whilst the recruitment process will be beginning this year, we would expecting the successful candidates to start in January 2024. Since this position will have a hybrid setup, we are searching for someone that is based in Sydney or Adelaide. Day-to-day accountabilities: Analyse customer service and sales data to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for improvement. Design, develop and update training materials and modules related to customer service & sales techniques, product knowledge and communication skills. Conduct training sessions for customer service and sales teams, both in-person and virtually. Monitor the performance of customer service and sales teams through key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics. Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify process inefficiencies and propose solutions to enhance overall customer service and sales operations. Act in line with Torrens Global Education (TGE)’s Code of Conduct and all policies and procedures, and any relevant external legislative requirements. Who you are: Educational Background: A Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (with a Master's degree being a preference) is important as it demonstrates a strong foundation in the relevant disciplines, which can be valuable when analyzing and interpreting business data. Proven Data Analysis Experience: Proven experience in data analysis, especially in the customer service and sales domain, is vital as it ensures that the candidate can dive into our specific data needs and challenges with confidence and competence. Proficiency in Data Analysis Tools: Strong proficiency in data analysis tools like Excel, SQL, or data visualization software (Power Bi) ) is essential as these tools are commonly used for extracting insights from data. Understanding of Sales Processes: Having a deep understanding of the sales processes, customer interactions, challenges and dynamics involved in this field. This knowledge can be highly beneficial when analyzing sales data and identifying opportunities for improvement. Communication and Presentation Skills: Exceptional communication and presentation skills are crucial because the candidate will need to convey complex data-driven information in a clear and concise manner, facilitating understanding and decision-making within the organization. Detail-Oriented and Organized: Being detail-oriented and organized is important as it enables the candidate to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously. Given the multifaceted nature of the role, this skill set ensures efficiency and effectiveness in managing data analysis and training programs. Why join us? Bold, modern and agile, we’re Australia’s fastest-growing university, going from 164 students in 2014 to 40,000+ alumni across 115+ countries and 1900+ staff today. In 2020, Australian Financial Review named us one of the country’s most innovative companies. As we continue to establish ourselves as a truly global university, we never lose sight of our student-centric approach. Supported by teams of passionate people, you’ll find endless opportunities for professional development and career progression. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, age, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples for all positions.  What we offer: We support your personal passions, development and wellbeing, to make your working life a more rewarding experience. At Torrens University Australia , you’ll benefit from: Study free in a course/degree related to your positionFlexible working conditions, allowing you to work remotely and from a campus near you - Access to internal opportunities - Be supported to learn, grow and move across the organisation  Hiring process We aim to provide you with the necessary information you need at each stage of this process to put your best self forward. If you want to know more, or need assistance or accommodation during the recruiting phase, please contact our Recruitment Team at maur.bell@torrens.edu.au  To learn more about what makes Torrens University Australia a great place to work, visit https://www.torrens.edu.au/blog.  We’d love to hear from you. Applications close: 3rd December 2023 Job reference: R22103 If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete our application process, please contact our Human Resources Department at yourcareer@torrens.edu.auShow moreReport

Flexible hybrid work environment Williamstown base 5 weeks annual leave Salary Packaging & monthly ADOs  We are seeking to appoint a highly professional, self-motivated individual with well-developed data management and analysis skills to join a high-performing multidisciplinary team of business intelligence and analytic specialists at Western Health. The ideal candidate, with experience in public health industry preferred but not essential, will be enthusiastic and motivated with strong interpersonal skills to build productive relationships with staff at various levels of the organisation.  To be Successful in this Role you will have:  Relevant tertiary qualification and/or proven success in a similar role Developed skills in the extraction, analysis and reporting of data, with a high level of attention to detail Excellent computer skills including well developed knowledge of MS Office products The ability to manage competing demands with a structured approach to problem resolution Strong interpersonal and communication skills  Duties:  Manage mandatory reporting processes to ensure deadlines are met and data is of high standard for all allocated datasets (VINAH or VAED) Develop and maintain required processes and initiatives to ensure data errors are prevented from occurring and are kept at a minimal level Develop and maintain a sustainable reconciliation process for responsible datasets, ensuring accuracy and consistency of data between Western Health and the DH Provide guidance to relevant business areas and staff on the reporting requirements, business rules and data quality issues  About Us  Our workforce of over 11,000 employees are driven by our values of ‘Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Excellence and Safety’ (CARES). We value our people and provide them the opportunity to grow and develop. Our teams are friendly and supportive, ensuring we deliver a safe, person-centred and connected patient experience.  Western Health is in a period of rapid growth. Our services comprise of four acute public hospitals: Footscray Hospital, Sunshine Hospital (including Joan Kirner Women's and Children's), Williamstown Hospital and Bacchus Marsh & Melton Hospital. We also operate Sunbury Day Hospital, Hazeldean, Grant Lodge Residential Aged Care, as well as community health centres in Melton, Caroline Springs and Bacchus Marsh and a range of community-based services. We care for a diverse community of more than 1 million people with complex care needs ranging from neonates to geriatrics.  Our employees enjoy a wide range of benefits such as:  Professional development support Career advancement opportunities Salary packaging including novated vehicle leasing Work-life balance  Western Health is an equal opportunity employer committed to attracting and retaining diversity in our workforce. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.  Western Health is committed to providing a safe environment for the children and young people who are involved in our services, sites and operations. We follow and abide by all legislative requirements to keep children and young people safe.  All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory Police Record Check, an Immunisation status clearance and (if applicable) a Working with Children’s Check.  Western Health do not accept unsolicited resumes/applications from Recruitment Agencies.Show moreReport

Recognition @ Latitude: Education support, Better giving programme with charity partners, Latitude matches dollar for dollar, Community partner days -Ardoch volunteers supporting children in numeracy and literacy  Annual salary reviews Flexibility @ Latitude: Flexible work arrangements - balance work and personal responsibilities, Hybrid set up - work from home & the office, 3 Days paid volunteer leave annually, paid community service leave, paid compassionate / bereavement leave Let's talk about the role. Reporting to the Senior Portfolio Manager, the Portfolio Analyst is responsible for supporting the Portfolio management team in designing and executing the customer engagement strategy to optimise the risk and returns of the cards portfolio. The role will support the Senior Portfolio Manager in designing, managing, monitoring and optimising the direct portfolio stimulation and growth campaigns for credit card products to drive spend, receivables and customer engagement growth. In this role, you’ll: Track key portfolio metrics to measure the success of program through creation and management of customer engagement performance dashboard Effectively use customer research, data and insights for customer segmentation, building propensity models and other targeting strategies Support the process to create portfolio management strategies to maximize portfolio growth across all customer contact and communication points Support the Portfolio Management team to Design, execute and monitor always-on customer management programs including: Early months of book/Onboarding Ongoing customer engagement to grow spend and build balance Re-activation of dormant customers Proactive and reactive retention Work with the Analytics and Insights team to use data to target customers using personalisation methodologies Undertake a value driven approach to monitor program performance at a campaign and offer level and make necessary adjustments via a robust test and learn approach Assist Marketing team to deploy Segmentation and Propensity models across campaigns and offer execution Drive new initiatives to automate processes and operations, enhance functions to improve overall efficiency and effectiveness of the customer engagement program Let’s talk about you: 1-3 years working experience in a fin services industry. Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, including Excel, SQL, and statistical analysis software Experience with marketing automation platforms such as Responsys, Salesforce or similar would be a bonus Experienced with Oracle Exadata or Snowflake- desirable or willing to learn Experience with open source tools, such as R or Python - desirable or willing to learn Experience with reporting building and data visualisation, using BI tool such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau or Qlik a bonus Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Attention to detail and strong problem-solving abilities. Sound like you? That's a good sign! In return for your energy and ideas, we offer a flexible working environment and great compensation. We always support a safe, healthy, engaging, and productive working environment for all employees and workers, whether that be in your home and office, or a combination of both. Be a part of leading customer-centric data analytics projects. Enjoy hybrid working and say YES to more of life's BIG, little moments. Drive high impact company improvements through customer insights & analytics  Our Customer Loyalty team at MFG not only knows our Customers but are passionate about using this data to create an exceptional customer experience. Within our Customer Loyalty team, we are driving exciting initiatives for our customers through mapping and data that provides future learnings of our customers buying behaviour and journey analytics. Our ongoing commitment and investment in developing our knowledge bank and customer insights has led to an opportunity for an experienced Customer Data Analyst to join our Customer Loyalty and CRM team. More about the role; Before we talk about the role; did you know that we have hybrid working (2 days from home - 3 days in the office), we have monthly town hall meetings, table tennis table, free gym, free coffee (really good coffee), life leave (more leave for when you need it), Development Dollars (more investment in you!) an amazing culture - lots of catch ups (usually with cake) and an open, light, collaborative and supportive work place. Well that is only the beginning..... back to this amazing opportunity. Reporting to our Head of Loyalty and CRM this role is all about our customers! From customer lifecycle metrics through to forecasting trends and future buying behaviour, this role focuses on our customers and the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights from data. Your experience working with high-volume customer data, will lean into developing dashboards around customer-centric data as well as developing our CDP and loyalty platforms. If you are passionate about data analysis and have a love for footwear, then this is the opportunity you have been waiting for. What your day would look like; If you have a keen eye for detail, a knack for uncovering insights, and a drive to make data-driven, customer-centric decisions then read on! As the Customer Data Analyst you will be responsible for;   Analyse customer data to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for growth Conduct indepth analysis of customer behaviour, preferences and purchasing habits Analysing and interpreting customer-related data to derive insights to assist with making informed business decisions for MFG Assisting with data strategy planning to interpret insights and modelling to assist with customer segmentation improvements Develop and maintain customer segmentation models to optimize marketing strategies and loyalty initiatives. Prepare and present key findings and recommendations to stakeholders Developing and monitoring CRM reporting. Leading data governance to ensure best practice in line with Australian and marketing standards.  More about You   We are looking for Customer Data Analyst with experience from a large-scale retail or FMCG environment, with a D2C edge! You will have proven experience in data mining, modelling and visualisation Tertiary qualifications or a background in statistics, maths, economics, or data science 3+ years' experience in CRM or Customer data analytic roles. Ideally, experience in retail/multi-brand environment advantageous. Intermediate understanding of databases (e.g SQL Server, Oracle and SAP (Emarsys)). Experience of reporting & data visualisation tools (e.g. Business Objects, PowerBI and Tableau). A keen understanding of website scripts (e.g. XML, Javascript, JSON). Understanding of ETL framework. You will execute the data governance program vision, promote the role of governance, and develop frameworks to support data governance best practices. In this role you will: Work collaboratively with the business and external agencies to interpret and understand data availability, data ecosystems, data management, and process improvement Plan and develop meaningful and relevant business unit KPIs for the establishment of a data governance practice Implement best practice frameworks and identify opportunities to utilise new and emerging capabilities Support the direction and establishment of a data stewardship capability into broader business platforms across the organisation Define and improve processes for managing data along its lifecycle Design, implement, and manage data-related solutions, utilising various cloud platforms and other technologies About you What you will bring to the role: Experience in a combination of areas related to analytics, data governance, data management, data quality and developing frameworks for organisations Tools: Data Governance platforms, Data platforms, Database Management & Warehouses, Quantitative and qualitative analytical skills Understand the lifecycle of data management from ingestion, usage, and delivery of insights through the use of data by being a conduit to technical and business teams Understand data architectures and frameworks to support data governance initiatives Strong communication and strategic skills to educate, enable, translate and coach best practices in the organisation You must hold (or be willing to obtain) a current Police Check and Working with Children Check What’s to love? Tickets to the Australian Open and Rod Laver Superbox Career development with a range of formal education and on the job training opportunities Health and wellbeing activities through our Thrive program. Onsite gym and tennis facilities. Flexible working practices Free car parking Salary packaging and a range of discounts from our sponsorship partners. Do you want to make bold impacts with some of our largest and most visible Retail brands on Amazon? Are you a passionate, customer-obsessed leader with a desire to influence how we drive business growth? You may be a great fit for the Amazon Vendor Services (AVS) team!  AVS works directly with a selection of the most strategic Retail vendors (supplier partners) to improve the value, selection and convenience across their Amazon business. Our team creates and innovates across brands, processes and people to grow business results and improve Vendor engagement and satisfaction.  We are seeking highly motivated Brand Analysts, who will act as Strategic Account Managers, owning the client-facing relationship with these supply partners and serve in an e-commerce capacity to drive their success, including growing revenue, improving operational efficiencies, executing initiatives and driving traffic and conversion. In this role, you will influence building and executing joint business plans with your Vendor, and collaborating with them to explore innovative merchandising, operational, and selection improvement opportunities.  The ideal candidate for this role should possess strong analytical, account management and/or vendor management skills. They should be able to deliver on commitments, manage workflows in a fast-paced work environment and actively participate in contributing to continuous improvement initiatives. Above all, they should demonstrate a high level of ownership and ability to navigate ambiguity. If you are interested in growing Amazon’s top brands, then we’re interested in you!  Key job responsibilities Commencing in January or July 2024 (or earlier if available), as a Brand Analyst you will gain experience and a wide range of responsibilities, including;  Identify, action, and/or provide advice on how to improve business input metrics that drive growth and improve end customer experience in collaboration with other Amazon programs and teams. Execute tactical support requests for Vendor, such as issue troubleshooting, data reporting, supply chain and catalogue management. Following up and escalating as appropriate to get these resolved in a timely manner. Demonstrate excellent time-management skills and the ability to work independently while using centralized resources sand procedures. Build strong relationship with the Vendor; be a trusted advisor and the central contact for their issues, questions, requests, escalations, and concerns. Liaise with other internal departments as necessary to resolve Vendor issues and questions quickly and with high quality. Teach Vendors how to be more successful on Amazon through training them on Amazon tools and policies and educating them on relevant growth opportunities in Amazon’s ecosystem of products. Collaborating and exploring innovative ways to identify and execute new product selection, brand management, promotional strategies, operational efficiencies and reporting analysis for your vendors. Working with varied stakeholders across AVS and wider Amazon teams such as Vendor and Category Managers, Instock, Finance, Operations, Marketing to drive best possible outcomes for your strategic vendors and customers. Leading planning and performance sessions with your strategic vendors, and act as their main point of contact at Amazon.  To achieve success in this role, you will possess:  A natural appetite for learning and the ability to pick up new skills quickly Strong analytical, relationship management and organizational skills A focus on identifying problems and creating solutions! Exceptional communication skills and a proven track record of building positive working relationships. Drive to deliver results in an ambiguous environment, being exceptionally detail orientated while looking around corners and thinking bigger about how we create a compelling customer offer.  A day in the life You will learn and use a wide range of skills working across major functional areas:  Vendor management: growing selection of products available to Amazon customers, driving traffic and conversion initiatives, promotion planning, identifying and resolving vendor-related issues In-stock management: inventory planning and sales forecasting, tracking purchase orders through to delivery, managing inventory sell-through, working with vendors on PO automation Content management: improving product detail page content, developing and executing marketing and merchandising plans, improving customer experience onsite  View more information and our Day in the Life of Brand Specialist videos here: https://www.amazon.jobs/en/landing_pages/jumprightin?cmpid=SATWCS0164T  About the team What does my onboarding program look like?  The initial onboarding program (AVS Academy) consists of an Orientation week, where graduates meet and network with senior leaders, get hands on experience at our Fulfillment Centre, learn more around our Day 1 culture and deep dive our Leadership Principles. The second week consists of an AVS Functional Training curriculum, where graduates gain technical experience required for the Brand Analyst role. The functional training week is structured around our key AVS pillars; Business Advice, Selection, Operational Excellence, Conversion and Traffic. AVS Academy is designed to develop our pipeline of future leaders, by exposing them to various learning and development opportunities.  We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:  Sydney, NSW, AUS  Prior experience in Retail, Consulting or Finance, managing multiple stakeholders or working in data analytics (Excel, SQL, Tableau) is beneficial but not essential. Having strong account or client relationship management skills is also desired. Job Description Location: Melbourne | Northern Metropolitan Job type: Full time Organisation: Austin Health Salary: Salary not specified Occupation: Administration/Secretarial, Human Resources, Legal, Occupational Health and Safety Reference: 49981 Austin Health is the major provider of tertiary health services, health professional education and research across 3 campuses in the northeast of Melbourne and state-wide. Austin Health is world-renowned for its research and specialist work in cancer, liver transplantation, spinal cord injuries, neurology, endocrinology, mental health and rehabilitation. An exciting opportunity currently exists for an enthusiastic and highly experienced Data Analyst to join our Performance Reporting and Decision Support Department. The Performance Reporting and Decision Support (PRDS) department is responsible for five key areas: Clinical Reporting & Analytics Corporate Reporting Health Information Services (HIS) Data Warehouse Management & Research Analytics Health Information, Reporting & Analytical Projects Clinical Reporting covers all analytical and reporting services for Austin Health in relation to clinical operations. Corporate Reporting oversees clinical costing, funding analytics and corporate reporting. The PRDS division is also responsible for the Austin data warehouses and provision of data to the organisation. HIS consists of medical record scanning, casemix/coding services, submissions of external mandatory activity reporting, corporate records management, morbidity data collection and release of patient information including Freedom of Information. The PRDS division has a staffing of approximately 70 EFT located over three sites. Key responsibilities will include: This role is responsible for supporting Austin Health with their reporting and analytical needs. The Data Analyst will be customer focused and actively engage with all levels of clinical and non-clinical staff. The role will require a detailed understanding of systems, data and information relevant to each clinical or operational area supported and be comfortable providing the business with pro-active, value added insights. You will work with the organisation to deliver key reports and insights to assist in improving effectiveness and efficiency and to assist the organisation to deliver efficient and safe patient care. A client-focused approach is essential to this role and a willingness to engage that involves getting out amongst the business and being a part of their discussions and strategic planning. Working collaboratively within a team of analysts and business partners is essential. To be successful in this role you must demonstrate: Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to liaise at all levels of the organisation Analytical & problem-solving skills with good attention to detail Strong SQL programming skills with demonstrated experience in building complex queries Strong Power BI skills with demonstrated experience in developing meaningful and useful paginated reports and Power BI reports. Strong knowledge with using business intelligence tools and concepts Experience in working with large complex data sets Understanding of data governance Knowledge of Public Health data Experience in health sector reporting Ability to work independently and within a team environment Good organisational, time management, written and verbal skills Tertiary qualifications and/or extensive experience in an appropriate health or business field Desirable but not essential: Tertiary qualifications in Business, Information Technology, Statistics and/or Data Science Experience in using R and/or Python for undertaking data analysis Previous experience in the public health sector Work with us! Your reward is to work in a collaborative environment which will provide you with opportunities for ongoing training and development. Your benefits will include salary packaging, and employee assistance program. All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory National Police Check conducted by Austin Health and if required, a Working With Children Check. Austin Health is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged.Show moreReport

Team Finance Country Sydney, Australia Schedule Full-time On-site/Remote Hybrid Join the team redefining how the world experiences design. Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora,你好, hallo, vítejte! Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point. Where and how you can work Our flagship campus is in Sydney. We also have a campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane, Perth and Adelaide. But you have choice in where and how you work. That means if you want to do your thing in the office (if you're near one), at home or a bit of both, it's up to you. What you’d be doing in this role As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that's all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you'll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve. About the team The Canva Financial Planning & Analysis team provides reliable and accurate information that guides the business towards achieving our financial plan every quarter. We deliver reporting to all our stakeholders that helps drive accountability on hitting our plan. As the Canva business grows, there is a continuous need to understand the impact of our expenses on profitability. Being able to predict these accurately will help Canva in making better-informed decisions. Reporting to the FP&A Profitability Manager this role will be an integral part of the Corporate FP&A team and will be responsible for leading the development of all Opex forecasts, forecast consolidation, running month-end variance analysis and providing key financial insights to Finance leadership. What you'll do Gather information and context from various Finance Business Partners, business updates, and internal resources to familiarise yourself with the key drivers of our below gross margin cost drivers. Leverage multiple data sources to deliver high-quality forecasts and insights. Develop robust and flexible financial models that can handle rapid change, turn around information quickly, and support strategic decision making. Continuously evaluate opportunities for enhancement of developed models in order to maximise effectiveness (e.g. identifying where, why, and when a forecast is missed, and what we can do to improve our accuracy). Development of models and analyses in both Excel and our upcoming Planning tool. We’d love it if you have the following Qualified CA or equivalent, experience in an FP&A, modelling or data analysis role in a fast growing and dynamic environment Highly proficient excel skills, with a big focus on modelling, demonstrated experience in developing business models from scratch The ability to think beyond numbers and combine data with strategy and financial insights Detail-oriented, well organised and understand the importance of data integrity Ability to understand and apply new concepts quickly A track record of taking ownership and excellent collaboration skills An open and flexible mindset showing adaptability with a self-starter attitude and initiative Work alongside the FP&A Systems team to support the build of a Planning tool for Canva FP&A Any experience in a Planning tool (such as Anaplan or Pigment) would be ideal but not a must-have requirement. What's in it for you? Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a stack of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work. Here's a taste of what's on offer: Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info. Other stuff to know We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process. Please note that interviews are conducted virtually. *Closing Date: 12 pm Friday 17 November   face2face reference: 593421  Location: Canberra ACT  Hours: full-time  Entry requirements: Australian Citizen + Baseline Clearance Required  Remuneration: $55.00 to $70.00 per hour plus superannuation    About the role: Our Australian Government client is looking for a Data Analyst (APS5/APS6 equivalent) to support two risk management and insurance projects. The first project is to improve the pricing strategy of an insurance fund and develop a new premium allocation model. Deliverables include integrating claims and premium data to produce loss ratio analysis, analysing premium allocation proxies to find statistical trends and scenario analysis in Excel to determine impact of changes. The second project is to design and implement data governance frameworks and supporting policies to align with the department’s broader data governance framework. Deliverables include developing an inventory of data assets, improving data quality and accessibility and working with data owners to facilitate change when required.  Duties In this role you will work with data related to the following: Historical claims data (claims system exported to Excel). Historical premiums data (premium allocation models in Excel and pdf invoices). Improving and analysing PowerBI dashboards. Property asset schedules (Excel). Claims and premium data have historically not been linked. Data integration across silos is required. Data cleaning and standardisation will be required for certain datasets.  Required experience/skills Proficient in excel and PowerBI Data preparation, statistical analysis and visualisation Experience designing and implementing data governance frameworks Ability to work collaboratively on projects to deliver timely outcomes Ability to work independently to achieve results, using data analysis to inform policy and improve systems Experience using data analysis to inform policy or decision making will be highly regarded  If this sounds like the role for you, and you'd like to learn more, apply now. f2f Recruitment team will be happy to assist you. A new adventure awaits…  At Zurich we’re on a journey to lighting the way to a brighter future… a brighter future for you – focused on your career, your wellbeing, and your community – as well as our customers and the planet.  We take pride in uniting our people within an energized culture that empowers everyone to focus on what matters most to our customers and each other. This is an exciting time to be at Zurich as we empower our people to fuel innovation and collaborate across diverse teams. At Zurich we encourage everyone to be curious, courageous, and responsible as we seek out new opportunities to delight our customers. We know we can achieve great things when we put our mind to it.   Let’s create a brighter future together, let’s make a difference Work is something you do, not only somewhere you go. The way we work continues to evolve and at Zurich we are committed to creating ways of working that ensure you are helping to create a brighter future.  As the Actuarial Analyst within our General Insurance Pricing & Analytics team, you will help to improve the underwriting profit and growth objectives of Zurich's Motor Fleet. You will do this by assisting in the provision of pricing and underwriting advice, as well as providing management information on portfolio performance.  You will carry out detailed pricing investigations on our motor fleet products and produce and distribute detailed monitoring of the claims experience, to help identify more profitable segments of each portfolio. You will identify poor data quality and reconciliation issues and assist in the continuous improvement of our systems to improve the quality of data.  Please note this is a 12-month contract opportunity.   Important to your success – let’s grow together Experience within a pricing role, ideally within General Insurance. Degree qualified in Actuarial Studies, or other related degree. High analytical skills, with the ability to gather and interpret information from different sources. Strong excel skills and familiarity with analytics software such as SAS, Radar, or R. You will be an excellent communicator, both written and verbal, and have the ability to build relationships with peers and stakeholders.  Belong. Zurich is here to support you There are many reasons why Zurich is the right choice for you, but here are just a few – grow, and thrive in your career (we support and encourage it); work with global, diverse, and inclusive teams; explore your passions, fuel innovation, drive equity, collaborate and make a positive difference beyond your role; access programs to stay healthy and feel healthier; Flexwork@Zurich; become an activist in your community with the support of Z Zurich Foundation; award winning training programs; state-of-the-art Green Star rated office in North Sydney; we plant a tree for every new employee – one of many local initiatives driving our contribution to ambitious global sustainability targets.  We could go on, but the main point is that Zurich is a place that you can truly belong and thrive!  Zurich is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair and accessible for all candidates. If you require any special accommodations to participate in our recruitment process, we encourage you to let us know at the time of your application. $88,175 - $100,724 (plus Super) Russell - ACT  The Role Investment Portfolio Management Branch is seeking a motivated individual to fill a Data Analyst position. The position will support the Director Portfolio Performance Measurement with the enhancement and sustainment of the CapabilityOne System.  CapabilityOne is an Information Communication Technology (ICT) system that manages information related to the One Defence Capability System and the Defence Integrated Investment Program. Under broad direction, the successful applicants will manage and lead work priorities and strategies to meet business outcomes through engagement with stakeholders across Defence. The role is expected to support an environment that promotes creativity and innovation.  The following are the key duties for the role:  Identify and undertake analysis to define, structure, solve and provide advice on complex data problems, including gathering and exploring data and meta-data from a variety of sources; Understand and utilise analytical tools and techniques to define, structure and solve complex problems; Responsible for the ethical use of data and interpreting and complying with legislation, Defence policy and regulatory frameworks including data management requirements; and Build and sustain strong relationships and negotiate with customers and key stakeholders to deliver tailored recommendations.   About our Team Investment Portfolio Management Branch supports the highest-level decision makers in Defence and government by providing independent analysis and advice to deliver a more capable Australian Defence Force (ADF). We directly support the Vice Chief of the Defence Force in his role as Chair of the Investment Committee and we are an influential voice with the ability to shape and assure outcomes on the big investment decisions for the ADF.  CapabilityOne is used to produce reports and dashboards to inform decisions by users and senior executives. As CapabilityOne enhances and continues to capture data, it will have the ability to produce a wider variety of data products with the intention to deliver advanced analytics in the future.  Our Ideal Candidate The short answer: people with integrity, curiosity, resilience, a willingness to learn, the ability to work effectively in a dynamic team, within a high tempo environment and a wish to deliver better Defence outcomes. Do not worry about experience - if you have already worked in a related field then you will know what this work entails.  Investment Portfolio Management Branch is unique, so we welcome new starters who have demonstrated high-level stakeholder engagement (including cross-agency), strong analytical and critical thinking skills, good written and oral communication, sound professional judgement and a desire to learn about the Defence capability system. About the Role As the Data Quality Analyst, you will play a critical role in improving AusNet’s outage data quality and associated regulatory performance, primarily through data validations and implementation of process uplifts. Leveraging your strong understanding of data validation, you will conduct detailed analysis of outage data and business processes, to correct issues immediately and to identify opportunities for systemic improvement.
