job_title: I.T. Graduate Opportunity - Business Technology / Systems Development / Data Analysis
job_description: Ranked #2 on Deloitte’s Tech Fast 50 list, Removify is a young, fast-growing company primed for another big year of growth. We are expanding our unique online content removal services both in Australia and globally, which means incredible opportunities to join our award-winning Tech Team. This role is all about your attitude and your aptitude, not your experience! You are: a smart cookie, hungry to learn a passionate problem-solver a humble team player, happy to help on whatever the team needs at any given moment eager to work on tasks that make a real difference, not just get a cool company listed on your resume Your background will be: Technical - you're probably a graduate of an IT course like Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Systems or similar Data-savvy: we are a very data-driven company, so you'll need to know your way around relational databases (MySQL) and have a real interest in data analysis You may or may not be able to write code - either is fine. This role is more about your ability to learn and solve business problems with different tools and applications; you won't be sitting and writing code all day. Any past experience with task/project management would be a huge bonus, but not required  What you will be working on: Learning new business tools and platforms, creating automations, data analytics, dashboards & more Supporting our software development team with ad-hoc tasks related to releases Assisting in the development of technical documentation for users of our technology Internal “Tech Support” for our other departments  Why choose us? If you love problem-solving and learning new tools and applications in an environment where everything you do makes a direct impact on the company's success, this is for you. With Removify, you can learn and gain experience working with the technical team as well as frequently working with our other departments to solve problems. It's an intimate team environment where everyone helps each other - you're not going to be the newbie that nobody knows is there, you'll be straight in helping to make things happen. This isn't a corporate environment where you will do the same boring thing all day, every day. This is a dynamic company where new things come up to work on every day. High performers who want to make a difference will never run out of things to do! About Removify Removify is a content removal company, working closely with businesses and individuals to take down harmful online content.  The internet can be an unfair place, but we are here to help level the playing field. We offer comprehensive services to get negative, false or misleading content taken down across countless websites and restore your reputation.  We are a fresh, fast-growing company with a global network. Founded by two Aussie entrepreneurs, we perform fast and effective content removal strategies to ensure our mission is accomplished for each client.Show moreReport

Company Description Who we are: FinClear was established in 2015, with offices now in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. We are an independent, Australian owned and developed technology and financial services business, specializing in providing trading, execution, clearing and technology solutions to wholesale intermediaries, FinTech’s, wealth managers and financial planners. At FinClear - Technology and progress are in our DNA. Our Financial Markets infrastructure deals with massive amounts of data and huge volumes of transactions that are executed in real-time to a vast audience. But unlike others, we own our core regulatory and technology infrastructure enabling us to move quickly and build solutions to give our clients the competitive advantage. We’ve tripled in size since mid-2021 and plan to continue growing with more platforms and services being rapidly developed. That’s where you come in.  Job Description This is an excellent opportunity for a Data Analyst looking to: Join a growing organization Discover a Full Time permanent Opportunity $65,000 - $75,000 plus super The Systems Analyst is part of the Data team whose purpose is to unlock the power of data for both clients and internal stakeholders. They play a key role in identifying, analyzing and providing insights across a range of subjects that adds value to the business. Working within a team of 3 this role is part of a larger cross functional Technology team of 60 and growing. You can expect to leverage your skills working on some exciting projects across our I broker and Summit applications collaborating with other teams across execution, operations, technology, finance, compliance and more. Key responsibilities include but are not limited to: Preparing, analysing and reporting results from various projects and BAU work. Using data analytics and visualisation tools, such as Microsoft SQL, PowerBI / Tableau Identifying and interpreting trends and patterns in complex datasets while also assessing and improving data quality. Supporting financial statement and performance audits, general audit planning processes and developing models to validate financial and system datasets. Promote and educate the use of data across the business.  Qualifications Required: Skills working with data analytics and visualization tools A strong understanding of data and its application Excellent verbal and written communication skills Background in clearing & settlement. Bonus points for: SQL and/or python skills Experience working with Tableu Having done a similar position Additional Information What are the ingredients to our secret sauce? That’s our people and the technology solutions we create, as the business grows, we are also evolving our benefits to one that our people love! Benefits: A team that is invested in the success of FinClear and a generous ESOP for all our employees 16 Weeks of gender neutral paid parental leave A flexible work environment - we have fantastic new offices where we come to collaborate and have those face-to-face meetings with some days at home An inclusive and diverse working environment for all Prioritise mental health with all our staff having free access to our EAP programme including 1:1 session with qualified coaches and psychologists E-Vehicles – Salary Sacrifice Ready to apply? If this sounds like something you might be interested in, submit your application by selecting “I'm Interested” or "Apply". Alternatively : To refer a friend, select "Refer a friend" For More information about FinClear, visit our Careers page https://finclear.com.au/careers Any additional queries Email : careers@finclear.com.au Please note : Rights to legally work in Australia is a must to be considered for the immediate opportunities at FinClear, (sponsorship options are currently not an option)Show moreReport

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR About the Team  ILS works as part of the Engineering Department to deliver the best products and services to our customers from Technical Supportability through to instructional design and delivery. This is a rare chance to join a collaborative team of logisticians, engineers, technical specialists and analysts.  About the Role Reporting to the Logistic Support Analyst Team Lead you will be engaged in reviewing requirements, management of Engineering data and design of Support products.  There will be opportunities to enhance and develop your ILS experience through training and mentoring activities.  The role of the Logistics Support Analyst is varied and you can expect to be involved in the analysis, design and support of a varied range of activities including:  Participating in engineering meetings and activities to influence design to ensure ILS supportability outcomes are incorporated; Contributing to assessments of availability, reliability, maintainability and testability; Populating and maintaining a Logistic Support Analysis Record (LSAR) database; Conducting maintenance task analysis; Conducting level of repair analysis (LORA); Determining Support and Test Equipment, Packaging, Handling, Transport and Storage requirements; Aligning repair and replacement part requirements; Development of provisioning and repair part identification lists; Supporting development of lifecycle costing data; Managing, reviewing and distributing codification data (CDATA); Assisting the development of technical data lists; and Preparing integrated logistics plans.  WHAT QUALIFICATIONS YOU SHOULD HAVE What are we looking for?  Rheinmetall seeks applicants who exemplify our Company’s values of Safety, Partnering, Openness, Respect and Trust (SPORT). This creates a workplace environment where employees value each other, live up to their promises and communicate openly.  The experience and skillset best suited to this role includes:  Proven experience in Logistics Support Analysis (LSA) in an Integrated Logistics Support team in Defence; Strong analysis capabilities of complex technical systems; Demonstrates a methodical approach to problem definition and resolution; Demonstrated knowledge of LSA activities (LSAR, LORA, CDATA and so forth); Proficient in MS Office in particular Word and Excel; Ability to work in multi-disciplinary teams and communicate with a range internal and external stakeholders; and Must hold or be eligible to obtain an Australian Government Security Clearance (must hold Australian Citizenship).  WHAT WE OFFER YOU Work as part of a team with real purpose in what we do; Attractive remuneration packages with salary sacrificing and novated leases; Access to exclusive employee discounts with over 400 retailers in Australia to help cost of living; On-site subsidised café with themed days and multiple dietary options; Long weekends every second week with a 9 day working fortnight; Flexible working practices; Opportunity to work on major projects within our Vehicle Systems (Logistic, Tactical Wheeled, Tactical Tracked), Electronic Solutions, Weapon & Ammunition Divisions); Generous internal incentive and referral program; Genuine career development and progression opportunities; Extensive Employee Assistance Program to support overall health and wellbeing; and We are proud to be recognised as an Endorsed Employer for All Women by WORK180.  CONTACT INFORMATION RDA Talent Acquisition Team Recruitment.Australia(at)rheinmetall.com.au #LI-DNI   Applications will close on 18th November 2023 ADDITIONAL INFORMATION A Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian Citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.  International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.  Further information regarding clearance is available at: https://www.defence.gov.au/security/clearances  We know that when people from diverse backgrounds and different points of view work together, we create the most value – for our clients, our people and our community. If you don’t think you quite meet all of the requirements of the position, we’d still love to hear from you.  If you would like to express your interest in this role, please speak to your Line/Direct manager before applying.Show moreReport

Req ID: 53526 Department: Risk Compliance - I.AM Amplified Division: Risk Location: Melbourne About the role  At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We’re making this happen by improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our customers so they can achieve incredible things– whether they’re buying a home, building a business or saving for things big or small.  ANZ is on a mission to build a better, simpler bank, so we are transforming the way we manage non-financial risk (NFR). This highly visible, enterprise-wide transformation program impacts a significant portion of ANZ systems, process and customer base.  The Business Analyst is critical to making this happen and will:   Develop or contribute to key stakeholder engagement, facilitation and development of templates and deliverables to support CPS230 compliance across Australia Retail and Australia Commercial Divisions Organize and facilitate workshops for the identification of critical operations, dependencies, disruption scenarios, tolerances and BCP data points. Document outcomes of workshops, data analysis and review, development of relevant supporting procedures and frameworks and stakeholder engagement across the organisation. Assist in development of critical operations methodology, supporting procedures and templates Synthesis of relevant information into requirements to support the deliverables of the program Assist with the implementation of operational changes required to support CPS230 Work across business units, divisions and enablement functions to identify opportunities for efficiencies which can be applied across the Group Support in the facilitation of guidance and awareness sessions to business representatives on the CPS 230 Standard and operational resilience methodology and purpose including the framework, policy and procedures. Partner with the Critical Processes and Operations Lead, Process Engineers, Business Analysts and other people in your squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of user stories  Role Location: Melbourne  Schedule: Full Time  Role Type: 12 Months Fixed Term  About the role  At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We’re making this happen by improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our customers so they can achieve incredible things– whether they’re buying a home, building a business or saving for things big or small.  ANZ is on a mission to build a better, simpler bank, so we are transforming the way we manage non-financial risk (NFR). This highly visible, enterprise-wide transformation program impacts a significant portion of ANZ systems, process and customer base.  The Business Analyst is critical to making this happen and will:   Develop or contribute to key stakeholder engagement, facilitation and development of templates and deliverables to support CPS230 compliance across Australia Retail and Australia Commercial Divisions Organize and facilitate workshops for the identification of critical operations, dependencies, disruption scenarios, tolerances and BCP data points. Document outcomes of workshops, data analysis and review, development of relevant supporting procedures and frameworks and stakeholder engagement across the organisation. Assist in development of critical operations methodology, supporting procedures and templates Synthesis of relevant information into requirements to support the deliverables of the program Assist with the implementation of operational changes required to support CPS230 Work across business units, divisions and enablement functions to identify opportunities for efficiencies which can be applied across the Group Support in the facilitation of guidance and awareness sessions to business representatives on the CPS 230 Standard and operational resilience methodology and purpose including the framework, policy and procedures. Partner with the Critical Processes and Operations Lead, Process Engineers, Business Analysts and other people in your squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of user stories  Role Location: Melbourne  Schedule: Full Time  Role Type: 12 Months Secondment  What will you bring?  To grow and be successful in the role, you will ideally bring the following:   Extensive experience in a similar role Working knowledge of CPS230, business continuity and operational resilience practices Maturity in the following competencies. Solution Analysis and Validation Business Analysis Planning and Monitoring Process Modelling, Customer Journey mapping and Human Centred Design Requirements Elicitation and Documentation Requirements Management Benefits Management Demonstrated ability to undertake qualitative, quantitative and desktop research to uncover actionable insights that can improve solutions and identify new opportunities. Demonstrated customer service (internal or external) experience. Demonstrated understanding of working in a team environment with shared objectives Excellent verbal and written skills Outcome oriented and effective team player Good attention to detail and process oriented Considered and structured in working style  You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.  So, why join us?  There’s something special about being part of ANZ. From the moment you join us, you’re part of a team working towards a common goal: improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers.  But it’s not just our customers who’ll feel your impact. You’ll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you’ll have the resources and community you need to take the next big step in your career, towards even bigger things in the future.  We offer a range of benefits tailored to the countries in which we operate including Health and Wellbeing programs and flexible working arrangements.  You’ll also enjoy working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. We encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.  To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.careers.anz.com. Ebiquity’s purpose is simple. We help brand owners increase returns from their media investments and improve business performance. Ebiquity operates two practices: Media and Analytics & Tech. We help our clients bring efficiency, effectiveness and transparency into their online and offline media buying and provide recommendations that accelerate implementation and optimize assets. As a Senior Insights Analyst, you play an essential role within the ANZ Insights division by supporting the local and at times global insights team analyze client’s media data using media performance reports processed and visualized in client solutions dashboards. A critical part of the Senior Analyst’s role would be to ensure that the data is accurate and ready to use across all media channels. Your primary job duties:  Work with Insights team and other related staff members to analyse the data and identify relevant trends using data Become an expert of Ebiquity’s reporting and analysis tool, GMP365®, across all media channels Support insight delivery for specific clients and accounts across all media channels Create and deliver standard report across all media channels Support consultants providing meaningful information Close cooperation with Activation and Engagement team members  Your skills:  Possess analytical and written skills and uses the data to tell a story and to create and deliver standard reports and to help clients understand the data and turn it into insights that can drive the business forward Good understanding of leveraging relevant supporting tools to manage client deliverables Possess excellent numerical skills Understands media fundamentals and applies logic and media knowledge to formatting and analysing data Builds and maintains relationships with internal and external stakeholders 2+ years of relevant work experience with background in digital media buying or media performance Understanding of digital channels such as Programmatic, Paid Social, Paid search and Direct publisher platforms and ability to work with post campaign reports Understanding of Digital Ad Verification tools Hands-on data Visualization experience such as PowerBI and Tableau and ability to use these tools in your day-to-day functioning Strong understanding of metrics, including Media and Quantitative business measures Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills and understanding of other Microsoft Office tools An eye for detail - Ability to spot errors in data to ensure final data is error free Ability to multi-task between different live clients Ability to work in a high paced global work environment   The opportunity to be part of the exciting Insights team within Ebiquity, world leader in media investment analysis. We provide you with everything you need to develop at an unprecedented pace. Our positions for new joiners are very different from most, as we treat everyone as full team members and engage them on actual client projects from the beginning. An opportunity to make a significant contribution to the global media buying landscape and work with some of the largest advertisers in the world Hybrid working model with WFH and office days each week Office located in the heart of Sydney’s CBD with Wynard, Martin Place and Town Hall train stations just moments away Friendly colleagues who are always willing to help And more! About the job Established in 2002, SuperRatings is Australia’s first and most respected Superannuation research company. We exist to give Funds, members, the superannuation industry, journalists and commentators a deeper understanding of how the industry is tracking and why and how individual funds and products perform the way they do. We have the most in-depth data in the industry and we can say with confidence, there is no other provider that delivers the same depth of information that we do.  We are currently seeking an Insights Analyst to join our SuperRatings team on a Permanent, full-time basis. As a member of the SuperRatings Insights team, the role is structured to provide a range of in-depth insights to SuperRatings clients and the industry more broadly.  Responsibilities Responsibility for the coordination and delivery of in-depth analysis of SuperRatings existing data (whilst also considering opportunities for new data sets) in order to prepare reports, media releases and assist with the preparation and delivery of accumulation and pension benchmark reports on an annual basis. Specifically, in consultation with the Insights Manager, the role is expected to undertake the following:  Data Analysis and Insights: Review and synthesise data collected by SuperRatings to identify key trends across the industry in order to provide in-depth insights that can be delivered to both clients and the broader market. This may include, but is not limited to, market reviews, overall opinion and outlook, and analysis of investment structures and performance. Analyse relevant data and prepare monthly media releases for each key audience for distribution to clients and media outlets to build SuperRatings brand as a thought leader. Identify key industry trends emanating from SuperRatings data gathering to draft ‘Top 3’s’ for both the accumulation and pension benchmark reports, which are prepared on an annual basis. Support SuperRatings’ focus on driving deeper and faster insights into our data, to make it easier for our clients to engage with us and our research. Assist in the preparation and analysis of data to support any retainer activity that SuperRatings may undertake with clients. Use a variety of sources including PDS, Annual Reports, ARFI and internal data systems to deliver key reports for distribution to clients. Manage, coordinate and produce ad-hoc reports and data requests. Prepare presentations and papers to the Trustee Boards and Steering Committees in respect of our superannuation clients. Analyse data to ascertain appropriateness, testing assumptions, identifying trends and abnormalities. Investigate the impact of changes to legislation/regulation on the functioning of existing products   Communication: Be responsible for managing and prioritising own workflow and multi-tasking deliverables, including that of more junior staff, to ensure more senior members of the team have appropriate time to review prior to the final delivery to the client. Support delivery of key market trends and high-quality strategic insights to superannuation clients. Provide ideas and solutions into the overall process for each engagement and research project. Where appropriate, present the outcomes of any analysis of key trends to the broader SuperRatings clients and team to assist them in understanding the key concepts of the research undertaken. Prepare meeting papers/agendas/action items for internal and external meetings. Attend, contribute to and record key points from internal and external meetings, particularly annual rating review meetings with superannuation funds. Be aware of and communicate to other employees and to the business, opportunities for improvement in processes, practices and procedures.   Support broader business objectives: Suggest and assess the viability of potential new products in line with business growth objectives. Assist with the design and development of new products approved by the business. Assist with testing of new products/enhanced functionality to ensure they are meeting product requirements. Provide training and support to internal staff on new products and enhancements to existing products where appropriate. Research and conduct at least one internal technical training session each year. Be actively involved in team meetings and company activities. Provide appropriate support for other team members and other company employees to achieve the team business goals.   Skills and Experience: 3-5 years’ experience in the superannuation industry. Broad understanding of all areas of superannuation, encompassing compliance with relevant legislation (SIS Act, SG Act, Corporations Act and the Income Tax Legislation), Regulator views (APRA, ASIC) and market practice. Specialist knowledge and experience in a number of areas. Demonstrated high level of problem solving and analytical skills with a positive ‘can do’ attitude. Proven ability to grasp technical concepts and translate these for our clients and as part of our service offering. Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with a variety of people as well as build strong working relationships. Excellent communication skills, both oral and written and an ability to work under pressure. An ability to work independently and understand appropriate accountability. Strong attention to detail. Demonstration of initiative, creativity and follow-through. Strong time management and prioritisation skills to meet deadlines and coordinate responsibilities. High level of energy and enthusiasm.   Essential qualifications: An under-graduate degree in business or finance discipline. MS Word (intermediate). MS PowerPoint (intermediate). MS Excel (intermediate to advanced). MS Outlook   Highly regarded qualifications: RG146 compliant. Post graduate qualifications such as FINSIA, DFP, CIMA, MBA.   To apply - Aus Citizens & Permanent residents only If you are interested in this exciting opportunity with SuperRatings, please click apply and upload your CV. All applications are strictly confidential.Show moreReport

Posted 08/11/2023 Job Number 25888 Full/Part Full Time Posting End Date 23/11/2023 The Opportunity As part of the critical in-flight Remediation program, this role will partner closely with the Remediation Program Manager and Workstream Project managers to conduct the investigation and discovery work associated with an ongoing remediation program. Understanding the scale, scope and size of any impacted customer cohort, along with the understanding of system or conduct failures is critical to delivery of rectification and remediation efforts. The role will require cross-functional coordination with multiple business process owners, technology, operations and data teams, to deliver at pace and drive quick remediation outcomes for our impacted customers. The role requires strong business, process and data analysis skills, with a clear focus on customer service, risk management and process efficiency. Experience in analysis of complex, end-to-end health insurance processes, and remediation projects is essential. The role will be required to work on multiple concurrent pieces of work within the program. Good communication skills, the ability to work autonomously and collaboratively, and a drive to deliver work to completion will make for a strong candidate. This is a full-time fixed term contract position initially, based in our Melbourne or Sydney office. Bupa offers hybrid working arrangements and you can work from the office or from home. How will I help? You will add value by: Working closely with the Remediation Project Team and/or Business Process Owner(s) to investigate the potential remediation matter and conduct preliminary discovery activities to assist in prioritising the matter in the remediation pipeline. Ensuring adequate business analysis is done to establish scope and validate root causes of the process, system or conduct failure, to clearly define the remediation problem to be addressed. Supporting remediation project managers as they ‘stand up’ required remediation projects, eg: providing relevant business analysis to support development of investment business cases proposals, etc. Planning, running and managing requirements gathering workshops. Why work at Bupa? We keep our people smiling by helping them improve their lives in and outside of the office. We’re a welcoming lot, no matter who you are or where you’ve come from. We welcome all talents and backgrounds and embrace our differences, so you can bring your true self to work. We support our people to be the best version of themselves, physically and mentally. With a healthy work/life balance, leadership support, reduced private health cover, study leave, volunteering options and a commitment to promoting from within. Our employees can access wide range of benefits: from our own products (incl. health insurance discounts) to many other products and services via our partnerships program (like Apple, Samsung, JB Hi-Fi, plus gym and spa discounts to name a few). We reward our people and celebrate their success, provide initiatives that develop careers and look after our people’s health, wellbeing and futures. What do I need? The role requires strong business, process and data analysis skills, with a clear focus on customer service, risk management and process efficiency. Experience in analysis of complex, end-to-end health insurance processes, and remediation projects is essential. The role will be required to work on multiple concurrent projects. About Bupa Asia Pacific Bupa is an international healthcare group which has been committed to a purpose of helping people live longer, healthier, happier lives and making a better world for more than 70 years. Bupa Asia Pacific operates in Australia, New Zealand and Hong Kong, supporting about 6.5 million customers through a broad range of health and care services including health insurance, aged care, dental, medical, optical and hearing services. Employing more than 20,000 people in the region, we believe that we can make a real difference to the lives of customers through our values, purpose and the way that we deliver personalised care. Since 2002, we have reinvested approximately $6 billion in the region, with the Bupa Foundation investing more than $34 million to support 130+ health and care projects. job_title: Platform Investment Analyst - Managed Portfolios Reporting
job_description: If you live in Australia or New Zealand, you’ve likely heard of AMP. But at a time when society is changing, we are too. We’re now a nimbler business with new leadership and thinking. For us, these are exciting times. There’s a real potential for big thinkers to help us redefine what financial services could be. And turn our legacy into something even more positive and powerful for the future. Help people create their tomorrow, while you create yours We help people with their banking, super, retirement and finances. Through upturns, downturns, recessions, and major life transitions. Every day, we help people see and make more of their financial potential, so that they can create their tomorrow. And we’ve been doing it for over 170 years. If we do our job well, we genuinely add to the prosperity of our country and its people. How you’ll make an impact The primary focus of the role is to own and deliver reporting, dashboards and data analytics as it relates to managed portfolios. This role requires the applicant to be able to manage time and deliver to tight deadlines while collating content and data via various sources, managing internal and external stakeholders including senior management. This role will specifically focus on areas to ensure a contemporary, competitive platform and managed portfolio menu including; Own and deliver weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting on managed portfolios for investment managers, advisers and other key stakeholders Provide project management support as it relates to managed portfolios Support in the development of disclosure documents as it relates to managed portfolios Support managed portfolio investment operations with questions regarding appropriate management of managed portfolios Support changes and setup of managed portfolios (manage questionnaires, fund fee analysis, portfolio setup in systems and downstream tools etc.) Support in responding to queries from advice practices on partnered managed portfolios Support performance calculations and data analytics for managed portfolios Troubleshooting of queries related to managed portfolio performance calculation and the North system What you will bring to the team Ideally, you will bring the following experiences to this role: Demonstrated experience in the Australian Wealth Management market (2+ years) across Platforms, Investments, managed portfolios and/or advice Experience in stakeholder management including Fund Managers and internal; project teams Strong understanding of data, analytics and reporting requirements Ability to work with complex spreadsheets and SQL to deliver enhanced dashboards and reports Experience with managed portfolios or extensive reporting is favourable Sound understanding/ knowledge of financial instruments and products Advanced excel skills including Power BI Strong database (SQL), data mining and data analysis experience Good understanding of the competitive market for investments offered by other Platforms You’ll thrive here if… If you can adapt from BAU to the ambiguous with ease, you’ll do well here. Change is never easy, so bring your commitment, grit and growth mindset. Because we run lean, you’ll be expected to jump in and deliver across a variety of areas. Meaning, you’ll be closer to the action and executive decisions that influence where we go next. If you’re someone that can hold their own, you’ll find AMP quite liberating. Why we think you’ll love working at AMP Doing what we’ve always done is not an option, so your clever ideas will get airtime here. You’ll be encouraged to speak up and try new things. If they don’t work, we move on – better for it. We know there’s no one way of doing things. So, you won’t have to sacrifice who you are or how you work to fit in here. We’re inclusive and flexible in many of the ways you’d expect. And in some of the ways you wouldn’t. As long as your health and wellbeing come first - at home and at work. In fact, most of what makes AMP such a welcoming, enjoyable place to work are our people. Wherever you go, you’ll find moments to connect, feel valued and do meaningful work. Whether it’s through our first-class leaders who are invested in you and your success. Through year-round opportunities to volunteer, fundraise and give back to the community. Or in the everyday challenges you face as we work together to strengthen this great organisation. Challenges that will stretch you, amplify your potential and compound the impact you have.  We believe in the power of inclusion and diversity We’re dedicated to fostering inclusion, diversity, and a warm feeling of belonging at AMP. It sparks creativity, ignites innovation, and turns up the dial on the quality of our decisions and performance. This not only makes our workplace more engaged, but also leads to better connections with our customers. We're your allies in the search for the perfect fit - when you apply, let us know how we can support you to put your best self forward during our selection process. We're also committed to enhancing employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, so we enthusiastically encourage candidates from these backgrounds to apply and explore our Reconciliation Plan on our website> (insert link) Ready to create your tomorrow? If you’re someone who sees opportunity where others see challenge, come and work with us in smart, progressive ways as we transform an iconic Australian brand for the future. And, through a series of career-defining moments, create your own tomorrow. Don’t procrastinate! We review applications when we get them, and if we discover the ideal candidate, we may close the role earlier than the advertised close date. Looking forward to meeting you.Show moreReport

Category: Government / Municipal Experience: Between 3 and 5 Years Work city: Canberra Created: 13.11.2023 All Aspects Recruitment & HR Services are currently seeking a Data Analyst for a temporary role based in Canberra ACT.  APS 5/APS 6 equivalent Temporary assignment for approx. 6 months  Duties include – The department is seeking a Data Analyst to support two projects:  The first project is to improve pricing strategy of insurance fund and develop a new premium allocation model. Deliverables include integrating claims and premium data to produce loss ratio analysis, analysing premium allocation proxies to find statistical trends and scenario analysis in excel to determine impact of changes. The second project is to design and implement data governance frameworks and supporting policies to align with the department’s broader data governance framework. Deliverables include developing an inventory of data assets, improving data quality and accessibility, and working with data owners to facilitate change when required.  The data that proposed personnel will work with includes:  Historical claims data (claims system exported to excel). Historical premiums data (premium allocation models in excel and pdf invoices). Improving and analysing PowerBI dashboards. Property asset schedules (excel). Claims and premium data have historically not been linked. Data integration across silos is required. Data cleaning and standardisation will be required for certain datasets.  Requirements – Proficient in excel and PowerBI Data preparation, statistical analysis, and visualisation. Experience designing and implementing data governance frameworks. Ability to work collaboratively on projects to deliver timely outcomes. Ability to work independently to achieve results, using data analysis to inform policy and improve systems. Experience using data analysis to inform policy or decision making will be highly regarded.  For more information or to apply please submit your resume to qldjobs@aarecruit.com.au with the subject “Data Analyst”Show moreReport

Job Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst Department: Data Analytics Location: Metro Manila or Melbourne  Job Summary: We are seeking a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our Data Analytics team. Gather and understand business requirements for data reporting and analysis to meet stakeholders' needs. Collaborate with data analysts and data scientists to access, prepare, and transform data for reporting. Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and track business metrics to measure success and identify areas for improvement. Behaviors: Successful BI Analysts should exhibit the following behaviors: Strong business acumen and a deep understanding of the organization's goals and processes. Effective communication skills to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams, translating data into actionable insights. Attention to detail in designing and presenting data visualizations that are clear and impactful. Curiosity to explore data for actionable insights, continuously seeking ways to improve reporting. Adaptability to evolving reporting requirements and the ability to pivot as needed. Collaboration with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide meaningful solutions. Effective time management to meet report delivery deadlines consistently. Technical Skills: The ideal candidate will have proficiency in the following technical skills: Expertise in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or similar platforms for report and dashboard creation. Data visualization and dashboard design to effectively present data insights. Proficiency in SQL for data querying and retrieval from various data sources. Data cleaning and transformation techniques to ensure data accuracy and reliability. Basic data analysis and statistical skills to uncover meaningful patterns. Knowledge of database systems for efficient data access. Understanding of data security and access controls within BI tools to safeguard sensitive information.Show moreReport

JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.  Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.  Shaping the future of real estate for a better world At JLL, we see a Brighter Way forward for our clients, our people, our planet, and our communities. With over 200 years of real estate experience, we are, and always have been, in continual pursuit of brighter ways of working.  We bring to life see a Brighter Way in all that we do by seeking better, smarter, more innovative ways of working. We approach our work in a warmer, more optimistic, and inclusive way. JLL is a global leader in helping clients envision where people will live, work, play, shop, and eat.  What this opportunity involves: The Business Intelligence Analyst’s primary purpose is to support the Work Dynamics accounts business in a client-dedicated role. The analyst will operate in the Work Dynamics Client Operations Enablement Business. With guidance from BI specialists and managers across the region, the analyst will further develop and assess their skills utilising the gamified learning pathways. This role will develop innovative analytical solutions that support the account to improve quality, reduce risk, optimise cost and cut carbon.  The Client Operations Enablement Business has a well-established commitment to continuous learning and innovation and as such the job holder will be expected to embrace the Tableau and Alteryx external communities, to ensure their skills are constantly evolving and they embrace new analytical techniques and functionality within our core BI products.  As the use of data and analytics matures, so will the tools and platforms the firm uses for Business Intelligence. The analyst will be expected to support the development of analytical Proof of Concepts to demonstrate the potential return on investment and then to transform Proof of Concepts into sustainable processes that can be adopted by the account and can be shared across JLL. This will be done as part of the wider Work Dynamics platform ensuring any developed solutions are documented and embedded within the operating framework of the team, including leveraging governed data architecture models.  About the role: The person will be accountable for building effective analytical products and being able to transform transactional data into meaningful business insights to help people see and understand data.  The ideal candidate will be a highly skilled individual, being able to demonstrate concepts for data Giang and analytics, from design thinking through to creative solutions.  In addition, the ideal candidate will demonstrate an ability to embrace new techniques and technology, taking a high-level business requirement and working in partnership with external experts to develop solutions from conceptual models, through to actual proof of concepts and finally sustainable business as usual solutions.  They will be required to work at pace, using agile working methodology that enables an iterative approach to project delivery.  Whilst a strong technical knowledge is essential it is equally important the candidate can be integrated alongside existing staff, both sharing their knowledge with, and learning from, other analysts and specialists on the account and wider across the JLL analytics community.  The candidate will support the account’s vision that;  Data is Governed: Analytical solutions should be based upon data that is defined and documented based upon business rules and consistent ways of working. When solutions are placed into production the underlying data should be transformed to ensure it complies with the account’s Data Architecture strategy; data being defined and structured once through relational models, but then used multiple times through published Tableau Data Sources.  Data is Accessible: Solutions should be accessible to the business users, ensuring the benefits of analytics are realized and a measurable return on investment achieved. Analytics developed by the analyst should be implemented in cooperation with the business partnering or integration teams who will be responsible for supporting the business users to identify actionable business insights from the data.  Operational processes are efficient: Through the knowledge and expertise of the analyst the efficiency of the account’s analytics should be maximized, ensuring dashboards and analytics are developed using industry-leading techniques and constantly referencing best practices identified through the BI community. Solution approaches and underlying design processes must be available across all members of the WD BI and performance teams for peer review and future troubleshooting  Innovative Analytical Techniques are enabled: The use of analytics should always be seeking innovative and new techniques that drive increased efficiency and savings through the effective utilisation of data.  The outcome of the Business Intelligence Analyst should be informed business decisions and planning, based on insightful analytics. Every deliverable of the role should be able to demonstrate a measurable return on investment and improved outcomes for the client.  Sound like the job you are looking for? Before you apply it’s also worth knowing what we are looking for: A BI expert with knowledge of data visualisation and analytical techniques. Global experience and best practices to integrate business processes and ensure effective utilization of data. Proven examples of having utilized Tableau and Alteryx to develop innovative solutions to complex requirements. Demonstrates an ability to learn new techniques and tools, as and when identified, for example, predictive modelling. Communication - Excellent presentation skills (verbal and written), Strong understanding of analytic/statistical concepts with the ability to explain them to others. Strategic Thinking - Ability to think broadly, adopt a shared vision, and embrace change as an opportunity. Description  Founded by deep AI and data science experts, Data Science Group (DSG) is a global leader in AI technologies, specializing in cutting-edge AI technology solutions as well as AI governance, auditing, monitoring, and performance management solutions. Headquartered in Tel Aviv, Israel, our roots lie deep in the tech business culture of innovation and research, and its translation to tangible business value.  The DSG Australia team is a group of AI and transformation specialists passionate about supporting large businesses through their journey of innovating, scaling, and transforming with AI.  We are continually fuelled by the opportunities to solve some of the most complex issues challenging businesses today as they venture into the ever-evolving age of AI.  As a Data Science and Analytics Consultant at DSG Australia, you will work with clients to design their AI processes and governance procedures, develop innovative solutions to complex business challenges, provide strategic guidance on leveraging data and machine learning technologies to drive business outcomes, and design and implement data-driven solutions. You will be responsible for delivering successful outcomes while maintaining strong relationships with clients and stakeholders.  As DSG Australia grows its footprint in Australia and APAC, this is a great opportunity for you as a data scientist to join a fast-growing start-up and broaden your skills and professional experience. This includes leveraging data to drive growth and competitive advantage while reducing operational risk through disciplined AI processes and governance procedures. Lead end-to-end data science and analytics projects, including problem definition, data preparation modelling, and deployment. Build predictive models, conduct statistical analysis, and design experiments to derive insights and inform business decisions. Stay up-to-date with the latest data science techniques and tools and proactively identify opportunities to apply them to client projects. Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure successful delivery of data-driven solutions. At least five years of experience in data science, machine learning, and statistical modelling. Strong programming skills in Python. Experience with databases and SQL or other data storage technologies. Experience in delivering ML models into production environments. Proven ability to lead data science projects and deliver successful outcomes for clients. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Deep understanding of corporate AI processes and governance procedures. Passionate about the potential of AI and its business implications. A growth mindset in your approach to your work and career. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Located in Melbourne and eligible to work in Australia. Benefits  If you are a highly skilled and experienced data scientist professional with a track record of delivering data-driven solutions to complex business problems and a passion for providing strategic guidance to clients, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. We offer competitive compensation packages, flexible work practices, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and a focus on our people’s well-being to drive innovation and entrepreneurship. Demonstrated clear communication skills both written and oral to finance and non-finance audiences. Ability to work independently and take accountability. Analytical mindset with an ability to think broadly and to appropriately question and challenge current assumptions and to make improvements to finance processes and solutions. Our world is rapidly changing and the greatest challenge for our country, industry, and community is the transition to a low-carbon economy. Ampcontrol want to be at the forefront of this transition, create change and support our customers, all by tackling the challenges they will face so that they can remain competitive and prosper. To achieve our new vision, we are realistic that we also need to transform our business and the way we work. By doing so we will accelerate transformational activities so that Ampcontrol is positioned to support our customers in the global energy transition as rapidly as possible and at scale. EMPLOYEE BENEFITS: Flexible work arrangements; WFH, compressed work week or 9-day Fortnight Paid parental leave. Salary packaging. Purchased leave. Private Health Care discounts. Wellbeing programs and discounts. Education assistance and personal career development. ABOUT THE ROLE: Ampcontrol is embarking on an exciting journey to enhance our existing data analytics and reporting platform to better serve our business. Joining as a part of an established, high-performing Digital team, you will have the opportunity to help shape the future of our data analytics and reporting function. This is a permanent full-time opportunity based in Tomago, NSW. We are looking for a motivated Data Analyst to support Ampcontrol in harnessing our data to drive informed decision-making. Working within our Digital team as an integral part of our existing analytics and reporting function, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining management dashboards and ad hoc reports for the wider Ampcontrol group. This role will see you use your data analysis skills to drive improvements and efficiencies in our reporting capabilities and contribute to overall data governance for our solutions. ABOUT YOU: Our ideal candidate will be able to interpret business requirements and develop technical specifications to contribute to overall deliverables. You will be excited by the design and development of high-end reporting solutions, with a passion for connecting the dots between data and end-user requirements. If you have any of the following skills or experience, we encourage you to apply: Experience with developing technical BI solutions, preferably Power BI Python/R for data analysis/wrangling (e.g. pandas or tidyverse packages) SQL database management experience/training Data warehousing – including transformation and modelling of data at enterprise scale Visualisation and interaction design experience Experience managing the report development lifecycle, from requirements gathering to development, testing and maintenance Development of reporting solutions technical design documentation  WHY AMPCONTROL? For over 50 years Ampcontrol has achieved and celebrated a growing workforce across the world. Amongst the technological firsts, awards, impressive growth and global reach, our focus on our customers and a philosophy of solving problems that others can’t, has meant our solutions redefine industry expectations. At Ampcontrol, we are united by the principles of safety, people, innovation, customer and performance. Our people and values make our business better and are at the heart of everything we do. We are committed to investing in our people and provide a supportive, healthy and safe working environment for all our employees. If you believe you have the right skills, experience and passion for succeeding in this role, please submit your cover letter and resume for consideration via the link. VideoShow moreReport

Our client, a large QLD Government department, is seeking to engage an experienced Project Data/Business Analyst to assist in the analysis of system data to prepare forecasts and modeling reports for a major project. About the Role   The Project Business/Data Analyst performs the analysis of system data to prepare forecasts and modelling reports to the Program Team members. This role will extract data from multiple sources, research to validate, and ensure contextual accuracy of data represented that supports as-intended Program delivery.  The data outputs will provide insights that will help the Team to address business problems and make evidenced-based recommendations to mitigate and/or remove barriers that may hinder the success of the program.  In this role you will:  Perform the analysis of system data to prepare forecasts and modelling reports. Aggregate data and analyse trends. Use your domain experience and knowledge to reasonably interpret / infer outcomes, noting some data / sources may require a level of perceptive analysis. Undertake statistical analysis of data relating to relevant aspects of projects, operations, and activities. Undertake analysis and development of reports and enhancements under general direction. Prepare business cases, reports, submissions, briefings, and correspondence. Lead the development of audience-relevant data visuals: dashboards, reports, graphics, and similar. Assist Projects with the development of high-level reporting documents such as Operational Forecasts, Workforce requirements, strategic dashboards (up to executive level), and similar. Be able to competently talk to the data - context, interpretation logic, describing any assumptions and/or limitations - as this relates to the collation and final presentation of data. Establish and maintain collaborative networks with business and other stakeholders. Consult with stakeholders and coordinate collection of data from several sources.  Role Fit  The essential requirements for this role are:  Demonstratable experience and ability to analyse, interpret and solve difficult data problems, engaging team and management input to produce accurate and timely solutions. Evidenced application of sound research and analytical skills for investigating issues and analyzing business data associated with corrections, as this supports ongoing improvement in the service delivery for Program outcomes. Experience and understanding of program data analytics, forecasting, and modelling methodologies. Exceptional document and version control, ensuring current / contextual data is provided for reporting and decisionmaking purposes. Skills and experience in the preparation of reports and complex written documentation within a structured framework. Demonstrated organisational skills including the ability to work autonomously to establish priorities and meet deadlines. Proven high level negotiation and liaison skills to achieve corporate outcomes, complimented by the ability to effectively liaise with a range of internal and external stakeholders who may have competing interests on sensitive and complex outcomes. Capability to work under pressure, meet tight deadlines and work in a team environment. Demonstrated experience in the interpretation and application of legislation, policy and procedures in an operational environment as this applies to data analytical activities. Knowledge of risk management frameworks.  Further details:  8 Hours/day - 40 Hour working week.  The successful candidate will be required to complete a Criminal History Check. job_title: Project Management Office and Change Analyst | Operational Risk
job_description: Join the Risk Management Groups Operations Risk team an be a part of a program responsible for delivering organisation-wide change across frameworks, processes, people, technology and data.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  You will be responsible for the day-to-day project management office and change management operations and will support the program’s leadership team. This includes managing project schedules and sprint plans, risk, assumption, issue and dependency tracking, project governance, assurance, and managing budgets and forecasts to ensure project outcomes are achieved.  You will assist with change impact assessments and plans, stakeholder engagement plans and tracking, and support the development of communication materials. When required, you will also provide general support across workstreams, including preparation of subject matter material.  What you offer  Highly-organised and flexible self-starter, keen to continue to grow your experience and knowledge in projects, change and risk management Some experience in Project Management Office and Change Management knowledge is nice to have Good understanding and experience in operational risk and resilience Extensive experience using Microsoft PowerPoint, Word and relevant project management tools (e.g. Excel, JIRA, Microsoft Project etc) Financial services or consulting experience is highly desirable.  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing  About the Risk Management Group  In our Risk Management Group, you will be part of an independent, and centralised function, responsible for independent and objective review and challenge, oversight, monitoring and reporting in relation to Macquarie’s material risks. Our divisions include behavioural risk, compliance, credit, financial crime risk, internal audit, market risk, operational risk and governance, prudential risk, and Risk Management Group central.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.  If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.  Job no: RMG-974973 Work type: Permanent - Full time Location: Sydney Category: Junior, Compliance, Legal & Regulatory, Projects, Improvements & Change, Risk Management Group: Risk Management Group Division: Operational Risk Recruiter: Annaleise Hudson Opening Date: 15/10/2023Show moreReport

Want a high flying career working for the worlds largest air services provider? Join our high performance National Workforce Planning team as a Reporting and Modelling Analyst in a fixed-term (12 months) position based in Melbourne or Sydney. More about this role This position is responsible for the data analysis and reporting of workforce planning and management with core focus of optimising our labour requirements for our national catering business. The role will provide standard and scenario-based reporting including costing models and forecasts for the business versus budget targets. So, what does a day in the life of a Reporting and Modelling Analyst look like? Working closely with the Business Unit Managers and the National Workforce Planning team to ensure that all KPIs are being met. The RMA will provide short term and long term planning solutions, review labour trends on previous workforce plans and provide recommendations on how we can improve the efficiency of the business. The RMA will achieve this through collecting and evaluating data, extracting statistical and analytical data from our systems. In a nutshell, your main responsibilities are: In depth analysis and evaluation of data sets to create reports Using Power BI and Excel to create data models for scenario based Build, develop and implement forecasts and capacity management plans Review of rostering processes, compare pre and post roster publications against completed rosters to identify trends, recommend changes for cost reduction Build and manage business dashboards for WFP Utilise our various WFP software tools for reporting including Groundstar, Human Force and Time Target. Gather feedback from resourcing teams to meet requirements for each business unit in terms of rostering correct operational coverage, staffing ratios and leave planning Develop modelling systems to support the Analytics team in decision making What do you need to be successful in securing this role? Five years demonstrated success in a similar role. Experience in volume data analysis and scheduling/forecasting metrics Tertiary qualifications in Business Analytics, Supply Chain, WFP or related discipline. Exposure to Business Intelligence, Reporting and Dashboards Experience using Power BI for complex modelling and forecasting Experience in Advanced Excel modelling and reporting (SQL and Dbase query) Ability to communicate with all levels of stakeholders Aviation or Food Manufacturing knowledge / experience preferable but not essential. Highly analytical and numerical aptitude with strong problem solving skills Mature reasoning and approach to complex tasks What’s in it for you? Competitive pay rates and penalties. Daily staff meals provided. 5 weeks Annual Leave. Discounts at hundreds of retailers, discounted health insurance and wellbeing resources including online exercise classes. We provide you with training and support to set you up for success in your new role. Your prospective employer: Part of the Emirates Group, we are Australia’s largest inflight catering and retail partner, food manufacturing and retail, travel retail technology, and airport lounge management. Chosen by many of the world’s top airlines, we operate 16 catering facilities across 10 cities, employ over 4,000 people, produce over 64 million meals, and service over 250 thousand flights each year. About Calytrix Calytrix Technologies is an Australian company specialising in the delivery of software, systems, and training support services to the Australian and international defence community. Calytrix has more than a decade of experience designing and delivering complex training events having delivered over 125 training activities involving military, government agencies, OGOs, UN agencies and emergency responders. Calytrix has been intimately involved with ADF training since 2007 and remains an integral component of the HQ JOC joint and collective training capability. As part of our expanding role supporting the ADF we are increasing our simulation support capabilities to the ADF's new Core Simulation Capability (CSimC). This group, operating within the Joint Capability Training Branch will be responsible for delivering simulation services to make the Joint Collective Training environment as real and accessible as possible. Calytrix has over 60 employees, maintaining offices in Canberra, Perth and Orlando, Florida. Approximately 50% of our workforce are ex Defence members. About Your Position: Data Analyst Calytrix is seeking Data Analysts who will be responsible for the capture and collation of requirements used to develop simulation training solutions in support ADF Joint Collective Training (JCT) activities. These positions will be available from January 2021 and are offered as full-time roles. Working in the Joint Collective Training Branch (J7-JCTB) of Headquarters Joint Operations Command (HQJOC), the Data Analyst will work closely with the JCTB Joint Collective Training Directorate technical and plans teams to capture and interpret training and technical requirements which are used as part of broader technical solutions to deliver training outcomes for simulation enable collective training activities. In this capacity the Data Analyst will: Design and utilise data monitoring systems to proactively provide efficiencies in service delivery. Design and utilise data monitoring techniques with exercise data to provide input to required reporting, continual service improvement and customer feedback. Develop and implement data collection plans used to support training after action reviews. Contribute to the design of simulation enabled training solutions to support process analysis, system design and requirements definition to meet agreed training objectives. Develop high level requirements and work with project teams to have these translated to more detailed specifications. Develop acceptance criteria and support testing activities. Contribute to and assist in authoring solutions to one or more projects or releases. Engage relevant internal and external organisations to obtain applicable source data in support of requirements definition. About You Successful candidiates will have: Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst with a Defence background Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc) Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Experience with developing queries, report writing and presenting findings. Some knowledge of Defence training processes and/or simulation systems would be desirable. A minimum Baseline Security Clearance (NV1 preferred) with an ability to upgrade to NV2. The ability to travel within Australia and overseas in support of training planning and execution activities. Why Calytrix Supporting military training using simulation is an exciting and expanding field of endeavour. As a member of the Calytrix team, you will be working with a close-knit group of ex-military planning specialists and technical professionals to deliver robust and effective simulation solutions to support ADF training. Calytrix is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce and encourages individuals from all backgrounds and all abilities to apply and consider becoming a part of our diverse and inclusive workforce. If this sounds like the job for you, please apply to jobs@calytrix.com by sending a covering letter and brief resume addressing the skills and experience listed above.Show moreReport

job_description: Rare opportunity to be part of an organisation working as part of nation-building energy projects High performing, diverse, inclusive, and supportive team Working a 9-day fortnight and 15.5% superannuation contribution  We are looking for an experienced, collaborative & driven professional, with a passion for and background in a range of data quality monitoring and reporting services in Health Safety and Environment (HSE) As the subject matter expert in the understanding of the underlying data structures used to manage HSE information, you will identify, and ensure data integrity and accuracy for a range of replicable analytics and dashboard reporting to optimise Transgrid’s use of HSE data to inform critical strategic decisions.With a background in Business intelligence and systems database administration you will have a business reporting analysis background with strong Power BI experience from a user lens. Experience in assisting to develop and deliver HSE & People reporting solutions and providing insightful commentary for business stakeholders. Advanced knowledge of reporting and analytical services and data integration and presentation. Ability to draw correlation between data sets, analyse and provide insights and trend statistics. job_title: HR Data and Compliance Consultant/Analyst - HR Compliance and Governance - Sydney
job_description: About ByteDance: Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.  Why Join Us Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible. Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us.  About the Team: HR Compliance and Governance focuses on various legal and external regulatory requirements for human resources, such as cross-border travel compliance, cooperation with employee representative bodies, and the setup of new hiring entities. Our main goals are to ensure the company complies with local laws and regulations related to labor and employment during global business development, and to help the company solve compliance and governance issues related to "people and organization."  This role will play a pivotal part in projects related to HR data, with a specific focus on ensuring ByteDance complies with legal and regulatory requirements. You will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting HR data to advise management on decisions that impact external reporting and regulatory compliance. You will partner with functional stakeholders across the company to provide accurate and timely analysis to enable key management decisions and external compliance. You will work with APAC and AMS colleagues on a day-to-day level and engage with stakeholders across the business globally. The role will also intersect with key HR initiatives in APAC, offering significant opportunities for growth.  Responsibilities:  Understand business context deeply through research, interviews, data analysis and other methods to understand and produce feasible recommendations and advisory aligned with HR management principles and external reporting requirements; Investigate and thoroughly understand client needs as a trusted advisor, offering tailored recommendations on the external usage of data; Collect, clean, and analyze HR data, ensuring data accuracy and consistency; Develop and optimize request processes and policies; Collaborate closely with interdepartment stakeholders and cross-functional partners, such as legal, communications, public policy, tax, and data teams to ensure alignment and bring initiatives to completion; Support the development and planning of HR strategies through analysis and research; transform insights into operational initiatives. Advantageous to have 3+ years experience in a top-tier consulting firm, enterprise or internet company; prior experience in a data role tied to people analytics, business analytics, or consulting background preferred; Preferable to major in management, statistics, economics, data science, data analytics, human resource management, industrial psychology, organizational psychology, financial management, accounting, or a related field; Excellent learning capabilities, sound business judgment and a demonstrated, hypothesis-driven problem-solving orientation with an exceptional ability to create clarity; proven capacity to ascertain the nature of problems as well as the reasonings behind them; Outstanding critical thinking and project management skills with a top-notch track record of effectively managing expectations across different time zones and cultures; Comfortable working under demanding deadlines and producing key executive deliverables; excellent written and oral communication skills; Strong comfort with ambiguity, and superb adaptability; be willing to work hard and efficiently in a fast-paced, cross-cultural environment.  ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.  In the spirit of reconciliation, ByteDance acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their Elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.Show moreReport
