Risk and Compliance Analyst | Sydney NSW We have a vacancy for a Risk & Compliance Analyst within our Commercial Division. Reporting into the Head of Risk & Compliance, the primary purpose of this Line 1 role is to assist in managing the implementation and execution of the risk and compliance management framework, partnering with the business to ensure that current and emerging risks are appropriately identified, assessed and monitored. The role will perform data/information analysis to assist with providing meaningful information on current and emerging risks to business.  You'll be responsible for: Support facilitation of workshops with cross divisional/business unit stakeholders to provide insights on root cause(s), accountable business owner, risk rating, remediation actions and control improvements to support the timely closure of incidents & issues. Preparing ongoing and ad-hoc risk and compliance reporting (monthly R&C report, Quarterly Risk Declaration, Annual Risk Management Declaration) Preparing and supporting the delivery of Risk and Compliance communication plans, liaising with SMEs to faciliate ongoing training and awareness sessions to improve risk maturity and risk culture. Providing analysis of thematic risk and compliance incident, issues and complaints. Supporting to maintain risk and compliance data quality in ORGS (Risk Management) system.  Important to your success: Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline. 1-2 years of experience as a risk and compliance analyst or business analyst, returning to workforce or wanting to move into a risk and compliance role. Ability to plan and prioritise effectively, organise tasks and manage competing tasks. Analytical capability to interpret a range of data, identify patterns and trends. Willingness to learn and grow in the role. Teamplayer  What's on offer? Access on-demand lifelong learning and take control of your career development. Learn through being supported and encouraged to take on new challenges that will help you to develop new skills Be part of a team that’s open-minded, supportive, approachable and genuinely focused on customer outcomes We understand about work-life balance, we are always willing to discuss flexible & remote working options with our employees. Allianz is an accredited FlexReady employer. Access a range of benefits, such as discounts at retailers, travel firms, health insurers, gyms and financial institutions, alongside a significant discount on Allianz insurance products.  About us Allianz is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us. We do this through delivering a great customer experience that is the result of appreciating each other every single day, showing heart by really listening and seeing things from the perspective of others by always asking, "how can I help?". Allianz is committed to enabling a culture where inclusion is embedded, everyone belongs and new ideas are embraced. We welcome and value talent from all backgrounds, experiences and ways of working Please advise us if you require any reasonable adjustments to fully participate in the recruitment process or perform the requirements of the role. Let’s care for tomorrow. For a career with plenty of room to grow. Care to join us? www.allianz.com.au/careers  #LI-ALLIANZAU   . A great place to work When you join Capricorn, you become a part of something bigger than a typical company, because as a co-operative we exist to improve the lives of our Members by supporting them in building stronger businesses – not the other way around. We are purpose-led and are committed to empowering our community to thrive. Our community includes our employees, and we know what is important to them, because we asked! And here's our commitments to you: Provide a diverse and inclusive workplace – because we know how important it is for everyone to be treated fairly and with respect. Give you flexibility – it's important to recognise we are all unique and need to create work life balance. Offer paid parental leave – that supports both parent's leave and their transition back to work. Create a fun environment – our social calendar is full up with a range of different virtual and face-to-face events to keep us connected. Work perks – that our employees actually use, such as a fantastic reward and recognition program, wellness program, additional leave purchase and so much more! The role and what we are looking for Reporting to the Platform Manager – Data, this position is a key component of the SAS Server and Upgrade Project, which includes migrating the current Capricorn Risk Division legacy reporting to an alternative solution in line with the current Data Strategy. The Functional Data Business Analyst will work with the business stakeholders to understand and document the business rules and requirements relating to the current outputs from the existing SAS server. They will also work with technology stakeholders to help design a replacement solution. This position is a 6-month max term contract. Key responsibilities of the role include: Work closely with technology and business SMEs to undertake analysis of current outputs from the legacy solution. Conduct stakeholder and SME workshops to elicit business requirements. Develop and review business and functional requirements and draft specifications for the development and enhancement of business systems and processes. Assist in the design of and re-engineer business solutions that meet business needs and align with the strategic direction. Assist Solutions Architects and Developers in formulating the technical design for business requirements. Work closely with business stakeholders to analyse business processes to design solutions using changes to ways of obtaining required information using solutions decided by the project team. Provide training and support to SMEs in the new ways of obtaining Risk data. Work with the business stakeholders to ensure that the data in the new solution is accurate and fit for purpose. A minimum five years of business analysis experience in a medium to large organisation with exposure to Insurance systems Experience in contemporary Business Analyst practices, technology and systems relating to information, communications, and quality management, including process modelling techniques and tools. High level of IT literacy in and a thorough understanding of IT systems and underlying technical architecture We're looking for candidates with the following skills and experience Qualifications A relevant tertiary qualification in a technology or business-related discipline is preferable Who are we? Capricorn is a member-based financial services organisation which exists to improve the lives of over 25,000 Members across Australia and New Zealand by supporting them in building stronger automotive businesses. We provide products and services including trade credit, risk protection, equipment finance, trade events, travel services, fuel cards and more. Last financial year Member purchases exceeded $2.93 billion and Member returns exceeded $72.5 million. The next steps If you think you are the right person for this role and you believe in a Member first culture, then please apply now. Applications will be reviewed as they arrive, so it is better to apply sooner rather than later. If you need any assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact HR at 1800 327 437. For further information and detail on Capricorn, please visit our website at www.capricorn.coop/careers (http://www.capricorn.coop/careers).Show moreReport

job_title: Data Business Analyst - Financial Crime Compliance
job_description: About the Role The Financial Crime Compliance team are currently looking to two dynamic and forward thinking Data BAs to our Financial Crime prevention program to continue with delivery across multiple work streams. We are seeking dedicated and innovative Data BAs to join the team, to play a vital role in strengthening the Financial Crime control environment.  The Key workstreams are Risk Assessment Regulatory Reporting. Reporting into one of our Senior Partners, within each stream of work the key responsibilities will include (but not limited to):  Leveraging domain knowledge and analytical experience to uplift financial crime capabilities across the Group Improving the quality and effectiveness of systems, processes and controls across the Group to ensure compliance Sourcing of new data and the impact of data changes Providing meaningful and actionable insights through MI reporting Achieving the Compliance Purpose and Ways of Working  About you Due to the volume of work - we have two vacancies we are looking to fill. Ideally you will meet the following:  Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and identify meaningful insights  Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate technical information clearly and effectively to mix of stakeholders.  Knowledge of best practice analytics and reporting  Knowledge and experience in financial institutions is preferred.  Skills to analyse and manipulate raw data and present data in a meaningful and coherent way  Proven ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.  Experience in project tracking tools including JIRA and Confluence preferred  Organsation skills to ensure all artefacts are appropriately stored and traceable  About Us Bank of Queensland Group is a truly unique group of challenger brands with a purpose – to provide a genuine alternative to Australian financial services for customers and employees.  Our family of brands (Bank of Queensland (BOQ), ME Bank, Virgin Money Australia, BOQ Specialist), each come with their own defined customer audience and brand personality, but share one goal – to build social capital through banking. That’s creating trust with customers, exploring staff potential and believing that tiny gestures and big ideas can change the world for communities.  BOQ Group’s inclusive vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.  Since 2021 BOQ Group is recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA).  In 2023, we successfully implemented an innovative Reconciliation Plan, driving positive change and promoting inclusivity across the BOQ group. About usLittle Learners Love Literacy® is a small and growing education publishing company in Surrey Hills with a warehouse site in Nunawading. Little Learners Love Literacy’s mission is to provide teachers and parents with the tools they need to teach children to read, write and spell with confidence.About the roleWe are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to work with the CEO to ensure proper operations and analyses of our business for its future success. To be successful in this role you will be a highly motivated, experienced, and organised individual with an eye for detail, a passion for numbers and an ability to work with a range of stakeholders. The Business Analyst will bring greater efficiency to the business, support the CEO to solve organisational problems, and lead implementation of continuous improvements to workflows, systems and procedures.Tasks include:Assisting the development of plans to make efficient use of our organisations' resources, including setting business operations KPIs in collaboration with the CEO; monitoring and reporting on business performance against those KPIs; providing constructive advice for continuous improvements.Identify opportunities for and implement improvements that will contribute to the further efficiency and success of the business by collecting and analysing data to identify, evaluate and implement recommended options.Prepare and recommend proposals to revise methods and procedures, alter workflows and resolve organisational problems.Oversee the implementation of solutions / approved recommendations, issuing revised instructions and procedure manuals, and drafting other documentation, and ensuring that our organisation has the necessary resources and support to successful change.Stakeholder management - work with key internal and external stakeholder relationships. Schedule regular meetings with key stakeholders to discuss the data reports and related matters.Focus on operations from supply chain to fulfilment by analysing and reporting on inventory and fulfilment costs; coordinating regular inventory audits; evaluating suppliers’ quotes and negotiating unit costs etc.Support key customer accounts by directing them towards more efficient organisation and developing solutions to improve their experience working with Learning Logic.Managing supplier relationships, contracts, rates and procedures.Manage business systems to get the best from the businesses chosen suite of tools, recommending upgrades and/or migrations to better alternatives as necessary.Maintaining records - recording and analysing organisations' workflow charts, records, reports, SOPs, health and safety compliance.Line management of all operations staff based at the Nunawading site.About you:Experience working in previous Business Analyst roles, especially in a warehouse environment/industry.Team player with a positive attitude and the ability to work collaboratively.Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills.Experience in managing and supporting a small team to meet targets.A good level of general IT skills.Effective organisation skills and time management skills. Able to prioritize conflicting demands when they present themselves.Strong problem-solving skills and high attention to detail.Benefits:Permanent position. Full time role during standard working hours, Mon-Fri.Opportunity to learn a variety of skills that come with a small business and at times will be called upon to do new and different tasks.Work with a fun, friendly and motivated team who uphold high standards.Work for a business that is 100% focused on children’s education and supporting their teachers, parents and tutors to make a difference.Modern working space with onsite parking.If you are an experienced Business Analyst looking for your next challenge and meet the required criteria please apply today!Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $95,000.00 – $110,000.00 per yearApplication Question(s):What is the notice period you require to give to your current employer?Experience:Business analysis: 2 years (Preferred)Work Authorisation:Australia (Preferred)Work Location: In personApplication Deadline: 28/11/2023Show moreReport

Company Description Nine is Australia’s largest locally owned media company – the home of Australia’s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Sport, Lifestyle, and Entertainment. We pride ourselves on creating the best content, accessed by consumers when and how they want – across Publishing, Broadcasting and Digital. Nine’s assets include the 9Network, major mastheads such as The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Australian Financial Review, radio stations 2GB, 3AW, 4BC and 6PR, digital properties such as nine.com.au, 9Now, 9Honey, Pedestrian.TV, Drive, subscription video platform Stan and a majority investment in Domain Group. Our Purpose: We shape culture by sparking conversations, challenging perspectives, and entertaining our communities. We bring people together by celebrating the big occasions and connecting the everyday moments. Australia belongs here. We bring our purpose to life via three shared values: We walk the talk, turn over every stone and keep it human.  Job Description Our Vendor Management team leads the commercial negotiations with our technology vendors and broader 3rd parties to achieve the best value and broader business outcomes for the Group. They support the ongoing contract management and performance improvement through the contract lifecycle working closely with our technology leaders, product owners, business stakeholders and project managers across all parts of our business to achieve outcomes. This role is responsible for implementing strategies to maximise value and reduce risk in our IT sourcing and contracting, and for improving our contract-related reporting and analysis processes to enable informed decision-making, compliance monitoring, and performance optimization. Contract Management for a portfolio of IT contracts Collaborate with business, legal and finance teams to understand and clarify their requirements Leading contract negotiations, including terms and conditions, pricing and service level agreements. Ensure contracts are properly executed, reviewed and renewed as required. Contract Reporting and analysis Develop and execute a comprehensive reporting strategy and monitor contract portfolio performance metrics Present contract lifecycle data and insights and assist with renewals and renegotiations Analyse and present data to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities Create dashboards and visualizations to provide real-time insights into contract portfolio performance Prepare and present regular contract-related reports to various stakeholders, translating complex data into actionable insights and recommendations  Qualifications Expertise in IT procurement, market analysis, contract negotiation, as well as in data analysis and reporting will be essential in this role. Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Data Analytics, or related field Proven experience in IT procurement category management preferably in a large corporate environment Proficiency in data visualization tools e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Microsoft Excel, and contract management software (SQL is desirable but not essential) Knowledge and experience in Media technology products, services and industry trends (desirable not essential) Prior experience in contract reporting, portfolio management, legal operations, or business analysis is beneficial (desirable not essential) Additional Information Life at Nine Nine is a people business. Being part of the team means you’ll be in a culture that promotes creativity and innovation, diversity and inclusion, is open to feedback, rewards impact and ensures everyone is heard. Importantly, you'll receive the following: Career development and quality training Up to 16 weeks paid primary carer’s parental leave Discounts on lifestyle, entertainment, and leisure memberships, including health insurance, dental and gym Discounts on products and services with corporate partners Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: At Nine, we are committed to fostering a workforce that embraces all aspects of diversity and inclusion and where practices are equitable to ensure our people experience a sense of belonging. From day one, you'll be encouraged to bring your whole self to work and will be supported to perform at your best. Should you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures. Disclaimer: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.  #LI-HybridShow moreReport

About the Role  We are looking for a dedicated data analyst to join our Financial Crime Operations (FCO) business unit as an AML Systems and Data Analyst. The primary purpose of this role is to safeguard BOQ Group against financial crimes by implementing, advancing and optimising our financial crime detection systems encompassing AML, Counter Terrorism Financing (CTF), Transaction Monitoring, Politically Exposed Persons and Sanctions Screening. You will provide financial crime data and analytics insights to assist in identification, management and mitigation of financial crime risk in coordination with the broader FCO team and the Financial Crime Risk Strategy.  If you possess strong analytical skills and have a keen eye for detecting financial irregularities, we want to hear from you!   Key Responsibilities  Support the development, implementation, maintenance and enhancement of Financial Crime Risk detection systems and data environment. Contribute to the development, review and update of process and system documentation. Contribute to the design of technical data mapping from source to target including transformation rules. Contribute to data governance processes and procedures, including business rule definition and documentation. Produce regular data analytics deliverables in relation to Financial Crime Risk, including exploratory data analytics, and end-of-month management information reporting. Assist with financial crime projects and implementation of operational changes following regulatory change. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to investigate financial crime prevention methods. Assist with related Financial Crime Operations and/or other business projects with a Financial Crime Risk impact, as required. Liaise with both operational and technology functions across the BOQ Group where required to complete inquiries. Adhere to regulatory obligations and internal policies/procedures. Keep abreast of new technologies in relation to data analytics and emerging AML/CTF trends.  About you We are seeking a passionate individual with a keen sense of curiosity and a proactive approach to problem solving. As the successful candidate for this role, we would like to see a foundation in data analytics and an interest in financial crime.  The following attributes will help you succeed in this role:  Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Finance, Computer Science, or a related field. Proficiency in programming languages and data analytics tools (SQL, R, Python, Power BI), proficiency in SQL skills is preferred. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to work independently or in a team environment.  The following attributes are highly desirable:  Additional training/qualifications in Data Science and Financial Crime Risk e.g. Association of Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialists (ACAMS). Experience working with Financial Crime systems - detection/transaction monitoring, screening and case management. Experience in overseeing and implementing AML/CTF or Sanctions systems and controls such as transaction monitoring and sanctions screening processes. Experience in data infrastructure design and development. Sydney IT & Telecomms Data / Records Management Large NSW Government Organisation Sydney CBD location and WFH Contract to end June 2024 - excellent Day rates PURPOSE: Support the implementation and maturing of Data Governance capabilities across the NSW Government Organisation, and extend the use of Data Management tools that manage metadata, data lineage and data quality, and be part of the transformation and uplift of Data Governance.  RESPONSIBILITIES: Work with Data Owners, Data Stewards, subject matter experts and management stakeholders to implement and maintain Data Governance policies, systems, processes, and controls, and ensure alignment to Data Governance framework and strategies. Review proposals for change, make recommendations, and provide specialist advice on Data Governance policies, systems, processes, and controls, and their implementation using existing Data Management tools. Measure, monitor, and report on performance indicators and compliance to standards, policies, and procedures. Collate, collect, and examine records, analyse evidence, and draft all or part of formal compliance reports for Data Governance forums. Work with the rest of the Data Management team in the capture and organisation of knowledge assets and the oversight of the Data Management lifecycle.  EXPERIENCE: Experience working with large-scale Data Governance programs and Frameworks and with developing, implementing, and ensuring compliance with policy, standards, and processes. Experience in risk and issue management, organizational change management, process management and stakeholder management Experience in developing performance metrics and indicators. Company Description ALDI. Good Different. With roots dating back to 1913, ALDI is proud to make a real difference to people across the world by offering top quality products for low prices. ALDI first entered the Australian grocery market in 2001 and has since grown to have almost 600 stores and 8 distribution centres in 6 states. If you’ve ever shopped at ALDI you know we are not your average supermarket. We’re also not your average employer. ALDI is a place where you’ll find good people, good purpose and a good opportunities. So you can work with a great team, feel great for making a real difference for everyday Australians and have a rewarding career. It’s that simple. ALDI Good Different.  Job Description Grow your career with a global retailer as an Analyst within our Data Analytics team at ALDI Australia, based in Minchinbury. This is a full-time permanent position. This pivotal role will see you immersing yourself in the captivating world of data at ALDI, a place where every number tells a story. As a part of our Data Analytics team, you'll be instrumental in using data-driven methods to transform vast amounts of raw data into valuable insights that guide our decision-making. From machine learning to statistical modelling, you'll employ advanced techniques to dissect and understand complex data sets. And it's not just about analysis - it's about communication too. Through data visualisation, you'll transform intricate data into a form that's easily understandable, enabling informed decision-making across various sectors of our business. Our pursuit of data-driven insights is about more than just numbers. It's about ensuring our business practices align with the needs and wants of our customers. Whether it's optimising our supply chain or enhancing our product offerings, your work will have a direct impact on the people who matter most - our customers. What does the role look like? Extracting and analysing large data sets Develop data driven decisions and solutions to complex forecasting problems Develop processes and structure for automating data sourcing and reporting Visualise data by creating and maintaining meaningful reports and dashboards Consolidate multiple data sources and analysing patterns, trends, anomalies, and root causes Identify opportunities for improvement within the entire supply chain and providing actionable insights  Qualifications What do we need from you? 2 years’ experience in Analytics with a Supply Chain, Logistics, FMCG or Retail background is highly desirable Advanced analytical skills, including the ability to apply time series forecasting, data mining and cleansing methodologies Demonstrated ability to apply analytical methods to supply chain challenges and objectives Advanced Excel and SQL proficiency essential Python or R-Script experience is preferred Experience in SAP forecasting modules or PowerBI is desirable Strong communication skills and ability to relay analytical findings Additional Information What’s in it for you? Transparent tiered salary range of $129,300 - $147,500 including super Opportunity to problem solve real business challenges Enjoy 5 weeks annual leave for pursuing your passions outside of work Enjoy the flexibility of hybrid work - up to 2 days work from home a week Be part of a company with purpose - we’re committed to sustainability for our planet, positively impacting our communities, supporting our farmers and suppliers and giving our customers a richer life for less. Support during life’s most important moments including paid parental leave, superannuation on parental leave, up to 5 days paid compassionate leave, natural disaster leave, emergency services leave etc An Employee Assistance Program that you and your immediate family can use which is 100% free and confidential Take advantage of complimentary access to free on-site physiotherapy to treat non-work related aches, pains or niggles Access to wellness programs such as discounted gym memberships, discounted health insurance and more Opportunities to contribute to companywide projects, move laterally into other roles in the business and embark on international assignments Working with a retailer who has been recognised as an Employer of Choice (as voted in 2023, 2022, 2021, 2020, 2019 and 2018)Show moreReport

We’re powered by purpose Mable is an online platform connecting Australians looking for disability and aged care support to independent support workers. Since 2014, we’ve been helping our community live their kind of independence, and today we’re one of Australia's largest and fastest growing healthtech platforms. We have been recognised in AFR’s Fast 100 list, Deloitte’s Tech Fast 50, and won the Australian Growth & Australian Technology Growth Company of the Year Award in 2020! So don’t miss your opportunity to join a thriving scale-up and deliver change to Australia’s care and support sector. As a Senior Analyst, Data & Insights at Mable you will use data and analytical techniques to identify and understand our business and product challenges, communicate your insights to multiple business stakeholders, partner with cross-functional teams, and develop recommendations and prototypes to solve these challenges. You will be at the heart of a fast-paced, high growth environment where you will help drive real-world impact. While two days will be the same, some examples of what you might do are: Work as a data lead in our Product Squads to opportunities to improve our product, assess the impact of new product features and measure the impact of features that have been released Analyse the results of split (treatment/control) tests to determine which new operational processes are effective, ensuring we're always refining our approach Deep dive into data to unearth trends and validate hypotheses, ensuring we're always a step ahead Identify with data not only what is happening, but why it is happening and what it means Create interactive dashboards and reports to track business performance and inform decision making Analyse the results of split (treatment/control) tests to determine which new product features are most are effective, ensuring we're always refining our approach Communicate data insights in a relatable manner to all stakeholders, regardless of their tech proficiency Develop and test rapid prototypes for data science services, teaming up with Data Engineers to perfect the end product Ensure that all data analysis adheres to the Mable privacy and security policies What are we looking for? 3+ years of data analysis experience developing actionable insights Experience using Tableau or another data visualisation tool to create data visualisations and dashboards Ability to communicate your insights and technical concepts to a non-technical audience, both verbally and in written formInitiative and ownership to deliver work with autonomy Collaboration skills to partner effectively with multiple stakeholders A “solutions mindset” of natural curiosity and a strong motivation to solve problems, no matter how complicated or ambiguous they might be Comfort with ambiguity, a fast-paced environment, and rapid business growth Above all else, a “can-do” attitude is the most important qualification! What else would make a difference? Experience analysing split (treatment/control) tests, including statistical analysis R, python or SQL skills Experience with machine learning Our Values We’re Switched On \uD83D\uDCA1 We know our customers because we listen and want to learn. We engage within the community and the sector and always act on insights. We’re Bold \uD83D\uDCE3 We’re ambitious and embrace creativity to solve challenges. We’re here to reshape the industry and back big ideas. We’re One \uD83E\uDD1D We channel our passion into a positive environment. We welcome diversity and collaborate to make the most of our different skills and ways of thinking. We’re Impactful \uD83C\uDF1F We work hard to deliver change. We innovate and move fast to make a difference in the sector and people’s lives. Our Benefits  Power your career ️ Learn from industry experts, experienced leaders, and on-the-job opportunities. Work away \uD83C\uDF0E Get a creative boost working overseas for 4 weeks in a rolling 12-month period. Access parental leave \uD83D\uDC76 Get 14 weeks of paid leave for primary carers and 6 weeks of paid leave for secondary carers plus superannuation. Work with flexibility \uD83C\uDFE0 We’re a hybrid workplace. Collaborate at home or in the office - whatever works for you and your team. Take a floating public holiday \uD83E\uDEF6\uD83C\uDFFE Acknowledge a significant day your way with family and friends. Be rewarded \uD83C\uDFC6 Celebrate wins and recognise great performance with an easy and accessible Reward and Recognition program. Location: Hybrid – World Square, CBD and WFH Commencement Date: Immediate Start (or by negotiation) Closing Date: Monday, 20 November 2023 Capacity: Permanent, Full-time  About Sydney Catholic Schools  In joining Sydney Catholic Schools (SCS), you will be part of the largest Catholic education community in NSW, with a unified vision and shared resources, encompassing over 145 schools and more than 72,000 students.  SCS is recognised for outstanding student achievement, with 9 schools in the top 100 of the HSC rankings and 17 schools placing in the top 150. We focus on enabling a quality preschool to post-school learning journey for every child, supported by a team of dedicated educators and caregivers.  About the role  The Business Intelligence Analyst will primarily be involved in drawing insights on customer journey data, using strong SQL skills to source data from Azure/SQL/EDW/Adobe/Google Analytics and deploy insights for the business using PowerBI, SSRS, and YellowFin reporting services.  The main deliverable for this role is analysing data and looking at business needs as well as insights, and working with stakeholders to support the business.  As a Business Intelligence Analyst, your main responsibilities will include:  building data reporting dashboards and reports collecting and interpreting data, analysing results and reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business collaborating with other teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs ensuring SCS has the data and insights it needs to make informed decisions to address customer and business problems ensuring that insights are built-in to the discovery and delivery of digital products advocating data-driven decision-making to stakeholders across the SCS enterprise working with leadership teams to determine the viability of digital initiatives through data providing insights and recommendations on areas of opportunity for digital initiatives providing recommendations on success criteria for digital initiatives and implementing measures for effective mitigation of risks providing clear, effective and professional best practice level advice and support to SCS Networks, schools, central office and the leadership team being required to be contactable and available to perform work outside normal working hours promoting and implementing Sydney Catholic Schools’ mission and vision To know and love Christ through learning and Thriving Catholic communities through excellent teaching and learning promoting and abiding by Sydney Catholic Schools’ values of empathy, curiosity, excellence, collaboration and truth.  What we offer:  attractive remuneration and salary packaging benefits of up to $15,900 each year generous leave provisions including 17.5% annual leave loading extensive professional and leadership development opportunities student fee discount – up to 25% discount for parents of SCS students health and wellbeing resources, including voice care programs, advice on nutrition and free annual flu shots.  The Person  To be successful, you will have attained;  australian tertiary qualifications equivalent to AQF level 7 (Bachelor’s degree) in Australia Tertiary qualifications equivalent of AQF level 7 (Bachelor degree) in computer science, Business, Digital Marketing, Media or Statistics demonstrated high level of experience with cloud platforms (AWS or Azure) as well as extensive experience working with programming languages such as Python and R previous demonstration of facilitating business solutions using rich datasets confidence in key stakeholder engagement and making informed business decisions demonstrated three years minimum experience in a data analytics related role demonstrated track record in designing and building scalable data models, cleaning and transforming data, and enabling advanced analytic capabilities that provide meaningful business value through easy-to-comprehend data visualizations demonstrated history of collaboration with roles such as data analysts, business intelligence analysts, data scientists or data engineers demonstrated skills as an analytical thinker who can gather data, break problems down into their parts and propose solutions proven ability to build dashboards and reporting tools using PowerBI, Tableau, Yellowfin and Adobe Analytics experienced in data-driven decision making and striving to ensure that it is employed in all stages of the product life cycle demonstrated ability to drive best practice and define new data analysis processes experienced conducting basic modelling to understand patterns, trends, opportunities and risks that can be fed into the product life cycle demonstrated ability to communicate complex ideas in a simple manner demonstrated ability to collaborate, contribute and create effective teamwork across organisational boundaries a current driver’s licence.  Application process   To support your application, you will be required to provide the following:  your current resume cover letter.  If you encounter technical issues or for any general enquiries please contact the People & Culture Services team on (02) 9568 8297 (8am-5pm Mon-Fri). Primary Location Western Australia Organization Information and Technology Group Zero 60-hour weeks, no weekends – Have your time back with family & friends  Join a deeply knowledgeable S4 team you can lean on for support and development  Initial 12-month contract opportunity until November 2024   About the role:  Nobody signs up for projects that are designed to fail. The challenge usually lies when you’re a few months in and you can see the writing on the wall. One way of testing whether a program will succeed is to look at who’s heading it up.  That person’s somebody with over 20 years IT, programme management, and organisational change experience, who’s delivered a series of successful SAP programs. This program will be no different in terms of how it’s set up to succeed, however you won’t be burning the candle.  You’ll mostly work 40 hours a week over the course of this program. No late night emails. No Saturdays and Sundays. Sure, there’ll be the occasional couple of hours needed, but that won’t be the norm.  Steven’s building a team that’ll deliver a SAP to ERP program over the next 2-3 years. You’ll be based in Leederville, a lively suburb, 5 minutes from Perth’s CBD. There are plenty of places to eat and hang out, and you’re only 5-minutes away from the nearest train station   What the role will involve:   We are looking for an Analyst to work within the Program team on a contract basis until November 2024. You will be responsible for design, test and reconciliation of data part of the Program’s end-to-end data migration lifecycle. As part of the wider team, you will provide specialist advice to the project through the identification of risks and issues to the project, assist with defect resolution and reconciliation plans. You will have a good understanding of how data drives the development of applications and business requirements through appropriate design principles, methodologies, and tools. You will bring strong management and technical data analysis to the team with a strong delivery focus, and a track record of leveraging experience from similar programs/projects of work.   Key skills and experience:   Your ability to build and drive positive and collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders will be important in this role. You will have the capability to communicate and influence others and have a flexible working approach.  You will have experience as an SAP Data Analyst, preferably in at least two S/4HANA implementation, with significant focus on Data Extraction from source systems, transformation, reconciliation and data quality (data cleansing) checks and tracking/reporting.  You will have experience working on large scale transformation programs with multiple vendors, in waterfall, agile, hybrid agile delivery practices. Along with your strong technical knowledge and experience in Data Services and SQL to build and perform data extraction a good understanding of ETL development and defect resolution within a project environment would be highly regarded.   Applications close 15th November 2023   Please note: As part of the recruitment process you may be required to complete Pre-Employment screening which may include a medical, qualification check, police clearance and Australian working rights check. We reserve the right to withdraw this ad prior to the closing date.  Our commitment to a diverse and inclusive workplace:  Diversity and inclusion are more than words. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. This is not just a purpose statement, it does drive action here. One such action is to ensure our employees are paid fairly regardless of gender. We do this by having what we call our “best and final offer approach” to salary. This means that our salary offer will be firm (with no negotiation) because our offer is based solely on the value of the role you are employed to perform. Do you want your work to make a difference for NSW?  Together, we create thriving environments, communities and economies.   Data Analyst Software Engineer with the Natural Resources Access Regulator Permanent full time, Parramatta and various NSW locations available Clerk Grade 7/8 with salary relative to experience, and ranges from $106,025 to $117,363 + super   NRAR enforces the NSW water laws and offers guidance and education to help water users comply. We strive to be an efficient and effective regulator that celebrates and reflects the diversity of the community we serve. Working with NRAR provides a chance to make sure water is used lawfully so that all communities and the environment get a fair share.   The Data Analyst Software Engineer provides advice on software/technological/data designs, builds software/data solutions, provides statistical information and analysis to support evidence-based decision making in regulation and compliance.   About You   As our Data Analyst Software Engineer, you will provide advice and guidance to internal clients on programmatical, statistical and intelligence matters in support of the agency’s role as Natural Resources Access Regulator to enable better, faster, automated data and software for informed decision making for our customers.  You will design statistical outputs to contribute to the production of regular statistical and reporting products for public dissemination and provide data and analysis to support intelligence team performance and workflow management.  You will have experience with full stack development, design, unit test and maintenance of high volume, highly scalable software, the analyst will work extensively with SQL Server and Oracle databases, including an understanding of Time Based and SQL Database design and operation in Oracle. Proficiency in programming languages including: Python; Javascript; HTML; SQL etc.   Want to know more about us? Watch what we do via our YouTube Channel Natural Resources Access Regulator (NRAR) - YouTube   For more information read the full Role Description: Data Analyst Software Engineer   For more information hit Apply to visit the iworkfor.nsw.gov.au website.   About Us  The Department of Planning and Environment’s (DPE) vision is to create thriving environments, communities and economies for the people of New South Wales. We strive to be a high-performing, world-class public service organisation that celebrates and reflects the full diversity of the community we serve and seeks to embed Aboriginal cultural awareness and knowledge throughout the department.  The Natural Resources Access Regulator (NRAR) Act 2017 enacted by the NSW Parliament in November 2017 provides for the establishment of a new independent water regulator in NSW focused on establishing best practice water regulation underpinned by ethics, good governance and stakeholder engagement to deliver effective and reliable water regulation for the people of NSW.   To Apply  If excited by the information above, we look forward to receiving your application, including a copy of your resume and cover letter expressing your interest and suitability for the role. Applications close Sunday 19 November 2023 at 11:55PM.   Should you require further information about the role please contact Martin Stuart via martin.stuart@nrar.nsw.gov.au. job_description: Job Description Location: Melbourne | CBD Job type: Full time Organisation: Victorian Legal Services Board and Commissioner Salary: $116,552 - $127,621 Occupation: Technology Reference: VG/1754290 Flexibility – Culture – Well-being – Partnership – Purpose Can you tell me more about what you do at VLSB+C?  Great question! We're really proud of the work we do. We are the regulator of the Victorian legal profession. We license lawyers and oversee service standards and conduct. This includes handling complaints about lawyers, investigating poor conduct and overseeing management of trust accounts. We are also the stewards of the public purpose and fidelity funds and administer these to support legal regulation and access to justice in Victoria.  We are a modern best practice regulator, using data and insights to help identify where our actions can have the greatest impact on ensuring ethical and professional legal practice by Victorian lawyers. We are passionate about maintaining and protecting the rule of law by ensuring the integrity of the legal profession.  What role are you recruiting for? Help us become the #1 in Property Data. Experience Hybrid working arrangements in a flexible environment. Permanent role which can be based in either Richmond or Sydney. We're REA REA Group is not your average digital business. From humble beginnings in a garage in Melbourne’s east in 1995, we have grown into a leading global digital business, specialising in property.  With bold and ambitious goals, we are changing the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help with every step - whether that's finding or financing your next home.  Our people are the key to our success. At the heart of everything we do, is a thriving culture centred around high performance and care. We are purpose driven and collaborative, which drives innovation and our ability to make a real impact. As such, we’re proud to be named in Australia’s “Top 5” Best Workplaces two years in a row, as well as being recognised as a Best Workplace for Women. Where the team fits in REA is evolving how it leverages data and technology to deliver benefits for customers. After the acquisition of PropTrack in May-18, and following large growth in recent years, we are now looking for an experienced Business Analyst to help build the systems and applications of B2B API and web application solutions for the banking sector. PropTrack provides property data and technical platform solutions to customers in the financial and government sectors. The Engineering Team within PropTrack works together to deliver solutions to our internal and external customers. It is the core delivery centre for developing solutions to meet customer priorities and align with PropTrack’s technology strategy. What the role is all about We are looking for a Business Analyst who is passionate about agile solution delivery. You will be working collaboratively with our external clients and internal product and technical team members to help deliver and support PropTrack’s B2B API and web application solutions for the banking sector. The Business Analyst Supports the teams in the following ways: Understanding complex business landscapes and clearly articulating business needs from a varied group of stakeholders; Translating business requirements into clear, concise, testable and accurate user stories & process flows; Liaising with major-bank and internal stakeholders (Clients, Product Owners, Delivery Leads, Developers and Quality Analysts) documenting and diagramming business requirements and processes to assist with understanding functional requirements; Generation of requirement and solution design documents, business process diagrams, data dictionaries, requirement analysis maps, user stories and use cases, interface specification documents, functional and non-functional specification documents; Ensuring that requirements are understood through story kick offs and constant communication using a variety of analysis and documentation techniques including the application of visualisation techniques to underpin joint understanding of processes and data; Working closely with stakeholders to understand and advise on how the requirements are implemented; Communicating any requirement dependencies, issues or risks identified through the analysis process; Contributing to the team’s understanding and prioritisation during planning meetings and retrospectives; Contributing to Showcases; Participating in estimation sessions by describing the requirements and clarifying any questions raised; Addressing any requirement questions or issues that arise during the delivery process; Using your analytical skills to support production issues; Facilitating and participating in team standups, retrospectives & iteration planning sessions; Communicating constantly with key stakeholders, team mates and other people throughout the company; Contributing to the REA BA Guild; Who we’re looking for 5+ years’ experience as a BA in digital product delivery Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to run workshops and to communicate effectively with Product Owners, Delivery Leads, Developers, External Clients and other stakeholders across the organisation Creative problem solver with a keen technical aptitude, able to quickly grasp concepts and add new insights Technical fluency, able to understand and document technical requirements Ability to author high-quality customer-facing project documents Work productively in a fast paced and agile environment Experience with XML and JSON API solutions Experience with data analysis, SQL, MSSQL Server and/or BigQuery database technologies Experience with both waterfall and agile project methodologies Significant exposure to release/testing/change management workflows Business Analysis Certification (e.g. CBAP, PBA or similar) or equivalent industry experience Prior experience in mortgage or lending will be a plus The REA experience The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously. We offer: A hybrid and flexible approach to working - https://rea.to/hybrid-working Flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers Programs to support mental, emotional, financial and physical health & wellbeing Our Because We Care program offers employees volunteering leave, community grants, matched payroll giving and our Community Café donates 100% of revenue to charity. Hack Days so you can bring your big ideas to life Performance recognition programs because hard work should never go unnoticed Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We believe teams with diverse ideas and experiences are more creative, more eﬀective and fuel disruptive thinking - be it cultural and ethnic backgrounds, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other identity or lived experience. We know diverse teams are critical to maintaining our success and driving new business opportunities. Identify and lead process improvement initiatives trough process redesign, automation (scripting) optimizing the efficiency and accuracy of financial reporting.  YOU’LL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS AND QUALITIES:  Previous years of work experience in data analysis & modelling Advanced proficiency in Excel is a must Completed studies in analytical fields (Finance, Engineering, Math, Data analytics) Proficiency in SQL and experience in database management, including data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes. AT BRP, WHEN WE TALK ABOUT BENEFITS, WE GO ALL IN.  Let’s start with a strong foundation — You want it, we have it:   Annual bonus: we work hard, and we know it. This yearly thank you is our way to fuel your dreams. Generous paid time away: winding down is as important as creating the future of recreational products. Life and Salary Continuous Insurance: this program is here for you, whatever happens, so you can focus on what matters. Employee Purchase Program: what we build is amazing, freeing, revolutionary, and you're first in line for the experience.  What about some feel good extras:  PWC License: BRP paid, yearly PWC license. Ride Days/ Access to PWC Units: unwind and enjoy our Sea-Doo, with the team or with friends and family Social Club: together, we create moments to remember. Wellbeing line of credit: we appreciate your health and well being.  WELCOME TO BRP  We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey.Show moreReport

VPS4 Project Analyst - Fixed Term/Full Time - until 30/06/2026 Our goal is to make every interaction with the VSBA a positive one for our customers, colleagues and key partners regardless of our individual role or team. All VSBA staff have a shared responsibility to meet the same service standards outlined in the VSBA Customer Service Charter. The Project Analyst operates as part of the team responsible for inputting all land and building data (usually received as architectural drawings) from over 1,800 school campus sites, comprising an asset portfolio of approximately $20bn. The data is used for a range of program and project related purposes including those relating to relocatable movements, financial reporting, school funding for cleaning, maintenance and essential safety works. The Project Analyst will contribute to the development of strategies and systems designed to facilitate the effective analysis and use of school asset data.  Key responsibilities of the Project Analyst role include:  Providing information, research, advice and consultancy services for internal projects Analysing and assessing issues, identifying and recommending options through the application of appropriate research techniques and methodologies Implementing and maintaining data analytics, best practices and workflow efficiencies Contributing to the preparation of the team's core documents including the Business Plan, Risk Register, Stakeholder Engagement Plan and other bulletins and dashboards Providing data-analysis to inform a range of documentation (including reports, briefing notes, project proposals, correspondence and submissions for a range of stakeholders Identifying and proposing solutions to issues that arise and support the delivery of outcomes in a timely and effective manner.  The IAU team is responsible for conducting a high volume of work within tight timelines, and communicating with stakeholders on a regular basis. In addition to having proven specialist technical expertise in the data analytics field, the successful candidate will be able to demonstrate their capabilities in relation to building and maintaining effective stakeholder relationships, work planning and organisational skills. The executive team in Strategy & Planning Branch in the VSBA are committed to growing our staff, and the successful candidate will have the support they need to deliver and expand on their current skill set. Applications must include a resume and a cover letter that responds to each of the Key Selection Criteria (no more than 3 pages). job_title: IT Business Analyst - Data Services Program
job_description: Posted 09 November 2023 SalaryCompetitive Daily Rate | WFH Benefits LocationBrisbane CBD Job type Contract DisciplineBI + Data Analytics Reference263658 Job description Role Overview: Paxus are partnering with a large corporate client who are currently undertaking an enterprise Data and Analytics capability uplift program. This program is focused on building foundational components within a new AWS cloud platform and will oversee the transition from an on-premise solution to an enterprise cloud setting.  As a Business Analyst - you will play a vital role in bridging the gap between business stakeholders and the technical teams. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including cyber security experts, system engineers, developers, and business stakeholders, to analyse requirements, design solutions, and ensure successful implementation of integrations. Qualifications and Skills: Analytical Skills: Ability to analyse complex data sets, identify trends, and derive meaningful insights. Data Visualization: Proficiency in using tools like Tableau or Power BI to create visually appealing and easy-to-understand dashboards. SQL Knowledge: A good understanding of SQL is crucial for querying databases and extracting the required data. Statistical Knowledge: Basic statistical knowledge helps in interpreting data trends and making data-driven decisions. Business Acumen: Understanding of the business domain and industry to align data analysis with business goals. Communication Skills: Clear and effective communication is essential for translating data findings into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders. Problem-Solving: The ability to identify business problems, propose effective solutions, and implement them using data-driven approaches. Data Modeling: Understanding how to create data models to represent business processes and information requirements. Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with BI tools, data warehouses, and ETL processes to work efficiently with large datasets. Attention to Detail: Precision in handling data and ensuring accuracy in analysis is crucial for reliable results. Adaptability: The field of Business Intelligence is dynamic; being adaptable helps in keeping up with technological advancements and changing business needs. Team Collaboration: Working closely with data engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders requires good collaboration and interpersonal skills. To be considered for the role or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Daniel Keyte on 07 33395613 or email: [email protected] and quote the above job reference number. Paxus values diversity and welcomes applications from Indigenous Australians, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people living with a disability. If you require an adjustment to the recruitment process please contact me on the above contact details.Show moreReport

Key Responsibilities:  Data Analysis and Stakeholder Engagement: Leverage your analytical mind to research and analyse data, identifying emerging issues and actively participating in the development of workers' compensation regulator reporting. Your expertise in data analysis will play a pivotal role in regular and ad-hoc reporting. Stakeholder Collaboration: Engage and liaise with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders to shape the development, implementation, and review of workers' compensation regulator and internal business units' management strategies. Technical Guidance: Provide sound technical advice and guidance to internal and external stakeholders, helping them interpret findings and understand the key drivers behind the data. Strategic Documentation: Research and prepare recommendations, briefings, correspondence, reports, presentations, and policy papers. Your proven communication skills will ensure these documents are logical and concise, making them ready for the consideration of top-level management, including the General Manager, Director-General, the Minister, and other senior public and private sector managers. Data Research and Analysis: Manage and undertake a diverse range of qualitative and quantitative statistical and data research and analysis projects. This includes comprehensive research, data preparation, and the organisation of resources, ensuring deadlines are met. Data Management: Take charge of the monthly submission of workers' compensation data and efficiently address related queries.  How you will be assessed: We'll assess your suitability for this role by looking at what you've done previously - the knowledge, skills and experience you've built, your potential for development and your personal qualities.  We'll consider: *  Tertiary qualifications with relevance to data analysis or related studies is desirable. Demonstrated quantitative research skills, including research, analytical, conceptual and problem solving skills for investigating issues and analysing trends. Demonstrated experience in statistical reporting and presenting results. Experience using SAS or similar database extraction application and programming language (such as SQL). Good communication and interpersonal skills, including demonstrated ability in interpreting results, preparing briefs, reports and presentations, as well as liaison and consultation skills. Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills.  Why Join Us? By joining our team, you'll have the unique opportunity to merge analytical insights with effective stakeholder management, influencing the future of workers' compensation regulation. You will work in a dynamic environment that values both data-driven decisions and impactful communication.  How to Apply: If you are a professional with a passion for stakeholder engagement and data analytics, we would love to hear from you.  To apply, provide:  your current resume, including the names and contact details of two (2) referees with a thorough knowledge of your competencies for this role. One of the referees should be your current or immediate past supervisor provide a short statement (no more than two (2) pages) demonstrating your ability to undertake the responsibilities and the requirements of the role as outlined in 'How you will be assessed'.  Join us in our mission to transform data into actionable insights and contribute to a safer and more informed workers' compensation landscape. Applications to remain current for 12 months. job_title: Data Analyst - Cyber Security, Enterprise Identity
job_description: About the Role Here at BOQ Group we have been busy working behind the scenes building out our Purpose, our Values, and our Strategic Pillars to help us achieve an exciting future-state through the transformation of digital banking.  We are strengthening, simplifying, optimising, and digitising, whilst ensuring our foundations are in place. With foundation comes strength, and we are building strong and stable teams to work across our multi-branded business. There is so much opportunity to contribute to our overarching frameworks, contribute to our Risk uplift and be paramount in supporting our transformation into a digital bank.  We have a new opportunity available for a Data Analyst - Cyber Security, Enterprise Identity to join our amazing team! In this role, you will be responsible for cleaning, analysing, interpreting, and displaying large amounts of disparate and complex data, using different approaches and modern business intelligence tools, including Power Automate.  This position will also be responsible for defining and executing the end-to-end-processes involved in creating and managing sophisticated User Access Review (UAR) campaigns in an accurate, effective, and timely manner. You will work quite extensively with the Business and IT application owners to scope and run their UAR campaigns. About you Ideally, you will bring the following experiences to this role:  Strong analytical experience in using modern data analysis tools and techniques to identify, analyse, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets for the issue diagnosis. High proficiency in Excel, SharePoint, Power Automate, PowerBI for data cleansing and dataset preparation and presentation. Experience in preparing reports for management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, relationship management and teaming skills, including the ability to develop productive working relationships. Knowledge of User Access Review principles and ability to apply them is highly desirable.  Working for us is fun and fast-paced, and we are seeking top talent to take us where we want to go. BOQ Group people are easy to spot. They're smart, energetic, full of ideas and passionate about what they do. If this sounds like you and you're looking to join a multi-brand transforming the face of digital banking, then we would love to chat! About Us Bank of Queensland Group is a truly unique group of challenger brands with a purpose – to provide a genuine alternative to Australian financial services for customers and employees.  Our family of brands (Bank of Queensland (BOQ), ME Bank, Virgin Money Australia, BOQ Specialist), each come with their own defined customer audience and brand personality, but share one goal – to build social capital through banking. That’s creating trust with customers, exploring staff potential and believing that tiny gestures and big ideas can change the world for communities.  BOQ Group’s inclusive vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.  Since 2021 BOQ Group is recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA).  In 2023, we successfully implemented an innovative Reconciliation Plan, driving positive change and promoting inclusivity across the BOQ group. Our Perks Flexible working arrangementsDiscounted financial productsSalary sacrificing optionsPaid parental leave with no minimumPaid volunteer daysPurchase annual leaveDiscounted private health insurance planEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)Access to employee network groups focused on First Nations Reconciliation, LGBTQIA+, Multicultural, Gender, Early Careers and accessibility BOQ Group is a member of Pride in Diversity and a participating organisation in the Australian Workplace Equality Index How to Apply To apply for this role please follow the links or apply via our Careers Page.  The Bank of Queensland is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.  We celebrate, value and include people of all backgrounds, gender and expressions, sexualities, cultures, bodies and abilities. When you apply, you are welcome to tell us the pronouns you use and please let us know any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.  If you are successful for a role with the Bank of Queensland, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include, but are not limited to: identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, bankruptcy checks.  Please no agency applications.  Job Reference: BOQ03106Show moreReport

If you live in Australia or New Zealand, you’ve likely heard of AMP. But at a time when society is changing, we are too. We’re now a nimbler business with new leadership and thinking. For us, these are exciting times. There’s a real potential for big thinkers to help us redefine what financial services could be. And turn our legacy into something even more positive and powerful for the future. Help people create their tomorrow, while you create yours We help people with their banking, super, retirement and finances. Through upturns, downturns, recessions, and major life transitions. Every day, we help people see and make more of their financial potential, so that they can create their tomorrow. And we’ve been doing it for over 170 years. If we do our job well, we genuinely add to the prosperity of our country and its people. How you’ll make an impact The Credit Risk Analyst and Insights supports the Bank management in (i) providing specialised and aggregated reporting on the Bank’s credit risk (internal and regulatory reporting), with continual emphasis on automation, self-service and interactive and real-time reporting, (ii) providing actionable insights into new business inflow, client payment, repayment and discharge behaviour, arrears, cure and losses, and (iii) working with business and finance teams on loan loss provisioning processes. Credit Risk Analyst provides the following core deliverables: Undertake analysis, modelling and reporting on mortgage credit risk as directed Take ownership of data and reporting by providing meaningful insights in line with credit risk events and emerging trends. Discuss these issues with Credit Insights and Analytics team, and with relevant people in Home Lending ‘tribe’ to assess, quantify, and manage credit risk Utilise analytics techniques – using Excel, coding, automation, and visualisation tools – as directed to assess future risk, opportunities, and translate results into meaningful solutions to enhance decision making. Prepare key reporting for Bank Credit Risk Committee Group, Board updates, and regulatory reporting Liaise with stakeholders to prepare the Bank Credit Risk Committee pack and take minutes in the meeting as the secretary What you will bring to the team Ideally, you will bring the following experiences to this role: A bachelor’s degree (or higher) in a quantitative discipline like finance, economics, mathematics, statistics Relevant experience (at least two years’ experience) in a financial risk management context Proficiency in Excel and Power BI. Some coding experience (Python or R) preferred Ability to maintain stakeholder relationships at a range of levels Understanding of the financial services industry In addition to the above capabilities, the successful candidate should also be able to demonstrate the following: Analytical skills and the ability to think laterally and strategically. Attention to detail and the ability to take ownership of reporting and projects from start to finish Understanding of Banking functions and associated risks such as capital, liquidity and market risks Ability to constructively challenge, consult and advise, whilst maintaining excellent relationships and the respect of teammates and stakeholder Strong organisational skills with the zeal to automate and enhance reporting to real-time, interactive and self-service, and reduce key-person dependencies in key processes Strong communication and interpersonal skills, to inform or influence audiences You’ll thrive here if… If you can adapt from BAU to the ambiguous with ease, you’ll do well here. Change is never easy, so bring your commitment, grit and growth mindset. Because we run lean, you’ll be expected to jump in and deliver across a variety of areas. Meaning, you’ll be closer to the action and executive decisions that influence where we go next. If you’re someone that can hold their own, you’ll find AMP quite liberating. Why we think you’ll love working at AMP Doing what we’ve always done is not an option, so your clever ideas will get airtime here. You’ll be encouraged to speak up and try new things. If they don’t work, we move on – better for it. We know there’s no one way of doing things. So, you won’t have to sacrifice who you are or how you work to fit in here. We’re inclusive and flexible in many of the ways you’d expect. And in some of the ways you wouldn’t. As long as your health and wellbeing come first - at home and at work. In fact, most of what makes AMP such a welcoming, enjoyable place to work are our people. Wherever you go, you’ll find moments to connect, feel valued and do meaningful work.Show moreReport

Exciting role in our National Reliability team Role flexible to be based at our bakeries in NSW, VIC, SA or QLD Flexible Hybrid Working environment – WFH & from site  Are you looking to come off the tools and play an integral part in providing insights and be a part of our ongoing National Reliability strategy? We have an exciting opportunity for a National Reliability Analyst to join the Tip Top team.
