company: The Law Society of New South Wales3.1 ★
job_description: BI Reporting Developer Full time role with a hybrid working model Join a high performing, collaborative and friendly team Located in the heart of Sydney's CBD (Martin Place) The Law Society of NSW is Australia's largest and most influential membership association for solicitors. We're not all lawyers, but we work together to support the legal profession and ensure a just society for all.  We are currently looking for a BI Reporting Developer to join our Information Management team.  About the role  The Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting Developer focuses on understanding business data, analysing data and generating reports and dashboards, performing quality assurance testing to ensure the data presented is correct as well as providing technical support and assistance to the business users where required.  The primary responsibility of the role is to support various reporting initiatives. You will analyse, design and implement quality reports and dashboards for the business.  As the BI Reporting Developer, you are expected to not only be a capable analyst of raw data, but are able to derive meaning from the data, relate it back to the source and work with the business to derive valuable context required for daily tasks and make decisions. You are a champion for data innovation and can use your creativity to find solutions for teams at every level of their data journey.  About the team  You will be joining the Information Management Team that help deliver data analysis services to the business. The Information Management Team covers a wide area of data analysis and application code development and key application foundation services.  What you'll be doing  Data Reporting â€“ Technical  Create, update, and upgrade end user reports in Power BI. Create and update T-SQL queries, stored procedures and views using the Law Society code standard to obtain the data required for reports. Where data is not available from a database, extract data from a variety of sources and transform it for use with a Power BI data model. Create and update Power BI data models for use with both single reports and reports using shared datasets. Be competent in DAX and Power M to meet end user requirements. Determine a reporting structure to ensure that increased usability is available for reports shared between departments. Identify potential faults and optimization opportunities within the Reporting suite and other related reports and dashboards. Monitor availability and provide recommendations on performance, capacity, data integrity and quality for the BI reports. Ensure all report access is secured and audited. Highlight any data issues and work with the data architects to continue to develop the data warehouse as a source of truth in the business. Design aesthetically pleasing and functional reports that meet the LSNSW branding guidelines/ templates but where required able to use the guidelines to make appropriate design choices.  Data Reporting â€“ Non-Technical  Develop/document high quality and well-written user guides, business rules, processes, data flows and other documentation for use by the Information Management team and business users. Provide feedback to the Information Management Data Architect on data requirements (historical snapshots, data requirements) for integration later. Involved in Project Team as a SME and key member on determining reporting needs and providing data requirements at the start of a project. Promote the Reporting function for operational as well as strategic needs. Develop and maintain reporting standards, policies and guidelines and ensure they applied to all reports developed. With the team develop policies and procedures for the collection and analysis of data. Populate User Acceptance forms and ensure all required approvals exist before deployment of the reports.  Team Support Support a collaborative and progressive team environment. Standardise and highlight improvements to services. Provide and maintain troubleshooting support and knowledge sharing across IT.  About you  Significant and relevant experience in requirements gathering, research and analysis, solution discovery, training, and other general Business Analysis capability is required. Tertiary qualifications in Information Systems, Computing Science or similar. 5+ years’ experience as a BI Developer (Preferably Power BI). 5+ years’ experience with SQL/T-SQL. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Strong discovery, analytical and problem-solving skills.  Desirable  Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or equivalent. Working knowledge of relational and non-relational databases. Familiarity with Data Warehouses and Data Lakes. Background in project management or business analysis. Competency in using Azure and other tools in the Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate). Competency in using Canva design software.  More about you  Strong interpersonal skills for conduct in a client facing role, and ability to adapt to communicating with users from a variety of professional backgrounds and technical abilities. Willingness and ability to continuously learn and be able to pick up new technical skills as well as business knowledge on a regular basis. Keen attention to detail, both in testing and validation of data, and in design skills. Able to work independently, and can appropriately assess, analyse, and verify task requirements prior to actioning reporting tasks. Can cooperate and collaborate with a team to learn and share knowledge. A knowledge seeker who is able to challenge requirements, and utilise technical skills, internal understanding and practices as well as external understanding and experiences to continuously improve skills and reporting services provided. Demonstrates the tendency to contribute ideas and initiate new ways of working, shows enthusiasm for project work and special assignments. Proven consistency in making sound decisions. Ability to use information, knowledge, and experience to analyse and form judgements. Ability to comprehend the wider contexts, developments long term goals and determines strategies and actions required to achieve such goals. Able to maintain sustained level of concentration in a volume processing activity to ensure accuracy and identify errors to be addressed. Displays a commitment to quality client service, values the supplying of accurate and timely information and relates to people from diverse backgrounds.   To apply  The Law Society of New South Wales is committed to building and maintaining a respectful and inclusive workplace, appointing the best person for the role and supporting diversity.  Applications should contain a CV and cover letter that outlines your key experience and motivations for this role.Show moreReport

Employment Type: Permanent Full Time Position Classification: Health Manager Level 3 Remuneration: $119,348 - $136,057, plus Superannuation Location: 1 Reserve Road, St Leonards, in a hybrid working environment Hours Per Week: 38 Requisition ID: REQ427954 Closing Date: 10 September 2023 (11:59PM)  Start your journey with us You will be working with a diverse and dynamic team within the Corporate Services and Business Improvement team as part of Health System Support Group (HSSG) based at 1 Reserve Road, St Leonards, NSW 2065. HSSG is a unit of the Public Health System Support Division of the Health Administration Corporation to provide services to support the public health system in implementing Government targets and programs.  For more information visit www.health.nsw.gov.au  What you'll be doing Lead and manage the review and analysis of the organisation's business intentions, services, processes and information needs to identify changes that lead to business improvements. This role involves collaboration with internal subject matter experts and other NSW Government agencies.  The Business Analyst will provide leadership in the development of new and innovative ways of driving system-wide improvement through data processes, contemporary analytics methods and systems for improvement. The role will work across the Corporate Services and Business Improvement team to work collaboratively with subject matter experts and across the services of the Ministry of Health (MoH) and other NSW Health Government agencies. The purpose of the position is to build business capability in analytics, collaborate in the development and implementation of new systems and processes, and perform detailed analytical explorations to support the strategic and operational priorities of the organisation.  The position will champion the development of an information culture that drives continuous business improvement across the organisation as an enabler for change. Being responsible for partnering with internal service delivery teams and support services across NSW Health and Health Agencies in using information for business intelligence and data analytics to drive organisational service improvement and efficiencies. The position will collect, map and critically appraise data and information, identifying issues, risks and identify areas for continuous business improvement and system performance improvement projects.  Candidate Assessment You may be asked to undertake further assessments as part of the recruitment process for this position, which may include, but is not limited to, psychometric assessment (e.g. personality and cognitive abilities assessments) and/or particular work tasks.  How to apply Your application to be considered should include:  Responses by addressing the selection criteria below An up-to-date resume of no more than five (5) pages which clearly details your skills and experience as relevant to this role. 2x referees will need to be supplied prior to an offer being made. Application must be lodged electronically. Please go to https://jobs.health.nsw.gov.au/ and search Job Reference Number REQ427954 to submit your application.  Selection Criteria  Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline and/or demonstrated relevant industry experience. Extensive experience in assessing business systems, mapping end-to-end processes and identifying opportunities for improvement. Interpreting business intent and applying to incumbent systems and process design to improve efficiency and availability of information. Excellent analytical skills including the ability to analyse and interpret complex information from numerous sources, prepare and present analysis and reports, deal with challenges creatively and achieve business focused solutions. Advanced level prowess using business analysis and relational database tools such as Microsoft PowerApps, Excel, SQL. Superior organisational skills and experience working in a high volume and demanding professional environment with proven capacity to prioritise, multi-task, achieve business goals, perform and always work with a customer focused approach. Excellent communication, negotiation, decision making and influencing skills including the ability to interact collaboratively with a wide range of stakeholders throughout all organisational levels. It’s more than a career at NAB. It’s about more opportunity, more moments to make a difference and more focus on you.   About the role:  The Business Credit Management team within NAB Business Lending Product is a highly valued specialised function serving Business Lending credit, analytics, data science and monitoring requirements across all elements of the credit and customer lifecycle. This high-performance team contributes to transformation and change initiatives, and business and strategy decisions, as well as risk and governance obligations and fundamental processes to run the business day to day.  The Business Credit Monitoring Senior Analyst role is a key position in the Business Lending Product’s team at NAB. In this role, you will have the unique opportunity to drive insights from our Business Lending portfolio and play a critical role in identifying and implementing strategic actions based on your analysis. If you consider the current macro environment, as well as our growth and transformation agenda, this is a very exciting and interesting space to be part of right now!  The role will be instrumental in providing accurate and timely analysis to manage the performance of acquisition and customer management credit risk strategies in Business Lending. Your interrogation and interpretation of data, and eg ability to derive actionable insights to our Product, Risk, Digital and Marketing stakeholders will be critical; to ensuring safe growth of automated credit decisioning, and delivering productivity benefits and improving the lending experience for our Business Lending customers. This role is ideal for curious and self-motivated individuals, who have a strong passion for data and analytics, and want to make a real impact  Do you love data, analytics and providing valuable insights to define strategy, drive value and enhance end-to-end experience? Are you ready to make your mark and take the lead?   Your Capabilities, Experience & Qualifications will include:  Tertiary qualifications with quantitative background Knowledge: Credit Risk Management, Business Lending Products Skills: Risk, Data Analysis, Statistical & Visualisation Tools & Techniques, Business Insights Technical: 3+ years’ experience with coding languages such as Python, R, SAS, SQL. Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI (highly desirable) Strong analytical skills and attention to detail Demonstrated ability to build collaborative partnerships Effective communicator and loves to tell a story using data   Your key accountabilities will include: Developing, building, and managing the monitoring of acquisition and customer management credit strategies and decisioning models, to provide insights and mitigate risks to the business Lead and conduct deep dive analysis to assist in the optimisation of credit decision quality, adherence to agreed risk profile and identification of optimisation opportunities Produce monthly reporting and data delivery for internal stakeholders to support the ongoing monitoring of trends and emerging risks for credit strategies and decisioning models Engage with key stakeholders across the enterprise and work collaboratively with cross functional teams to achieve business outcomes   Make a difference through your work At NAB, we work together to deliver exceptional outcomes that exceed our customers’ expectations. We are an ASX listed organisation that has been serving Australian communities for more than 160 years. We are investing in positive change and our work changes the future of banking. Our colleagues have an impact far beyond work, and you’ll be part of a team that is helping to solve some of society’s biggest challenges.   A diverse and inclusive workplace works better for everyone. We know that our people make us who we are. That's why we have built a culture of respect – where everyone feels valued and appreciated for being their true authentic selves at NAB. With our focus on inclusion and diversity, and in partnership with our Employee Resource Groups, NAB is a place where First Nations colleagues, colleagues of all genders, sexualities and ages, carers and colleagues with disability, and colleagues from all cultures, races and religions have the opportunity to thrive, connect and grow.   More focus on you We are committed to delivering a positive experience for our colleagues and a workplace you can be proud of. Roles and duties include:  The ICT Business Analyst will be responsible for defining improvements to business processes, gathering information and analysing the client organization’s business intentions, services, processes and information needs to identify changes that lead to business improvements. Analysing business processes and advising customers (potential or existing) on business process automation and optimization. Identifying and communicating with clients to formulate strategies and produce a requirements specification to create system and software solutions for businesses. Analysing existing systems, application design and functions to ensure strategic ICT objectives are met by adopting contemporary analysis best-practice methodologies and processes including performing gap analysis within a scaled agile framework. Working with clients and users to formulate and document business requirements for workplace systems efficiency. Assisting company to develop functional standards for other system users. Provides and designs, based on pre-defined solution architecture, an integrated high-level solution that fit customer’s business & operational needs. Determining any inefficient business practices and system errors, such as duplicate orders, and double payments, etc, and providing efficient optimal business practice, solutions, and system functionality and behaviours Identifying, investigating, and analysing business processes, procedures and work practices to identify and evaluate inefficiencies, thereby recommending optimal business practices to improve business functionality. Manages the overall IT program scope, maintain its continuous alignment with strategic business objectives and works directly with the customer to clearly articulate and document the business requirements. Taking responsibility for deploying functional solutions, such as creating, adopting and implementing system test plans, which ensure acceptable quality and integrity of the workplace systems. Creating user and training documentation, and conducting formal training classes.   Skills and experience   Analysing and documenting business and technical requirements that best reflect customer needs; Translating the requirements into prioritize epics/features, supporting the release and iteration planning. Developing functional specifications for use by software engineers and developer programmers to create solutions then creating user and training documentation, and conducting formal training classes to train the employees on the new procedures. Using data and process modelling techniques to create clear system specifications for the design and development of system software. Demonstrating experience as an ICT Business Analyst within an agile environment understanding the business and IT requirements of the client. Acting as a central reference and information source, providing guidance and assistance in the system project decision making process by continuous communications with the client and passing on the information and requirements to the system developers. Establish collaborative and influential relationships with stakeholders, customers and colleagues, to ensure easy and effective achievement of team / project / business goals. Overall accountability and responsibility for scope, time, cost, quality, change and integrations within the project. Effectively participates in and/or leads formal and informal reviews with stakeholders, applying knowledge and experience and providing technical perspective and support; Performs demonstrations of solutions to users. Accountable and responsible for development teams during the iterations (provide business clarifications, adjustment to risks, change in scope, reprioritize and approve “done” stories and features during demos). Responsible for communicating the solution to customers’ business and/ or IT personnel, explaining the details of new solutions and their impact on business processes and ensuring that the customer understands the solution. Follows up on solution design issues in his/her domain until solution is signed off and supports the resolution of configuration/ implementation-related issues if and when they arise. Responsible for solution-related documents and functional specifications; May also configure the solution, and create, execute and maintain test plans when applicable.  The successful candidate will have a relevant bachelor degree or higher and at least 10 years of relevant experience. It is preferable if you are a permanent resident or citizen of Australia when applying.  Send your Resume to hr@bar360.com.auShow moreReport

Global Developer of Wind / Solar PV / BESS projects Permanent role - Based in Canberra Supportive culture with opportunities to develop About the Role  You will be based in our Operations Control Centre in Canberra. You will work as part of a highly motivated team responsible for the safe and efficient monitoring and control of our renewable energy assets. You will be a dedicated team player with high standards and attention to detail, motivated to deliver a first-class professional monitoring and control service.  Responsibilities Monitoring & Controlling the assets via SCADA Systems, reacting to new and developing events in the Australian National Electricity Market; Reacting to plant and market notifications and alerts, including working closely with the wider operational team as required; Interfacing with Transmission and Network Service Providers (TNSP), AEMO and other applicable entities regarding asset outages, generation constraints (curtailment) or specific production/network conditions; Monitoring weather forecast systems and issuing alerts, handling emergency calls from asset personnel or other stakeholders; Contribution/production of daily, week, monthly & quarterly operational reports; Liaising with O&M Contractors to maximise availability. Maintaining operational relationships with O&M Contractors, AEMO, TNSPs, Governments, off takers and PPA representatives, as required Coordinating specific maintenance and outage performance on behalf of the Asset Manager, including communication with Contractor, TNSP and AEMO; Continuous improvement of OCC systems, functions and procedures to deliver increased performance based on Key Performance Indicators. Skills & Experience You hold a relevant degree in engineering, data science, commerce or a similar field; You are comfortable with Excel, analysing data and communicating your results. You are rigorous and analytical; You are reliable, organised and team focused; You are experienced and/or comfortable with working in a 24/7/365 shift-based team; You have a capacity to work under intense and constant operational pressure. job_description: Join our team as a risk analyst at PKF Sydney We are seeking a talented individual with strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to join the Workplace Assurance arm of our Governance, Risk and Compliance Team at PKF. We are seeking a talented individual with strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to join the Workplace Assurance arm of our Governance, Risk and Compliance Team at PKF. job_title: Senior Business & Data Analyst - Central Pharmacy Future State
job_description: The role is responsible for analysing data, developing and implementing the future state operating model and associated business processes, and providing actionable insights to support decision-making.  The role requires a strong analytical mindset, process expertise and the ability to work collaboratively across functional work streams. The Business and Data Analyst plays a pivotal role in ensuring the success of the Central Pharmacy Future State Program.  The role will work as part of a dedicated program delivery team within one of the three work programs that make up the Procurement & Supply Chain Optimisation Portfolio.  Key Responsibilities:  Adhere to defined service quality standards, health and safety policies and procedures relating to the work being undertaken to ensure high quality, safe services and workplaces. Transfer of knowledge and upskill employees. Collect, analyse and interpret complex data sets related to pharmaceutical and supply chain processes and performance, develop innovative solutions, options and recommendation in alignment with broader business strategy, organisational goals and legislative requirements. Guide the development and implementation of the Central Pharmacy operating model and business processes in the context of relevant legislation and the implementation of S/4HANA Extensive Warehouse Management (EWM) system software and associated barcoding and scanning solutions. Analyse and document the impacts of the changes to the Central Pharmacy operating model to support the development of change impacts assessment there by providing input into appropriate change interventions. Collaborate closely with specialist teams across the P&SCO ortfolio, Supply Chain Surety Branch and Hospital and Health Services (HHSs) to model requirements and translate these into technical and business specification, whilst ensuring optimal integration of future state processes across all functions of the Central Pharmacy Supply Chain, including purchasing, manufacturing, inventory, transport and reverse logistics. Identify opportunities to optimise supply chain processes through data-driven insights and recommendations ensuring the implementation of the highest standards of customer service and compliance. Ensure data accuracy, integrity and consistency by implementing data collection, validation and cleansing processes to support the implementation of S/4HANA EWM and associated integration points to legacy system.  The position operates as part of a specialised project delivery team and reports to the implementation stream lead. The position does not have any direct reports.  Essential Requirements:  Expert knowledge of world class warehousing operating models and processes in an environment of fast-moving inventory and related space utilisation, logistics and materials handling practices. Well-developed ability to understand how supply chain processes and improvements contribute to organisational goals and ensure data analysis and recommendations are aligned with the broader business strategy. High level of proficiency and skills in statistical and quantitative analysis and the use of data analysis tools and software to collect, clean and analyse large datasets to develop creative and innovative solutions to complex problems. Demonstrated knowledge of data management and data manipulation techniques and high technical proficiency and competence in using data visualisation tools to create reports and dashboards, preferably in a warehousing environment. Deep understanding of interrelationships between warehousing processes with other functions in a complex supply chain system such as purchasing, inventory, transport and logistics and an ability to connect data insights to business objectives and strategy. Conceptual, problem-solving and analytical skills, to identify problems, propose innovative and practical data-driven solutions in a complex and dynamic environment with a focus on documenting analysis processes and findings. Highly motivated to work effectively across functional teams, foster collaboration and build relationships across varied stakeholders by communicating confidently to a range of audiences and undertake effective consultation and negotiation processes.  Other Requirements:  Travel may be required between Brisbane sites. Highly experience in the use of tools such as Microsoft Access, SQL, Power BI Microsoft Excel and Visual Basic which are vital in handling and analysing key data. Proficient in the use of process modelling tools and has the fundamental understanding of industry recognised process notations such as Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN) or Unified Modelling Language (UML). Familiarity with S/4HANA EWM and OPIM modules, particularly related to the back-end data tables and the key elements of the data tables that drive the behaviour of the S/4HANA solution.  Like to know more?  To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Kylie Graham in our Brisbane office on 07 3185 5339 or email kylie.graham@hudson.com, quoting Ref No. 233652.Show moreReport

Job Description BlueScope is an Australian-born, global success story, spanning 18 countries, with a team of over 15,000 people. The Opportunity Come and discover the opportunity to join our Energy Sourcing & Utilisation (ESU) team at our Port Kembla Manufacturing facility as an Energy Systems and Data Analyst. As a part of the broader Australian Steel Products (ASP) portfolio, we have six major manufacturing sites at Port Kembla that deliver a variety of products, innovative solutions and services to our export and domestic customers. The ESU team provides the business with commercial and technical expertise to navigate the constantly evolving energy and climate landscape now and into the future. You will also bring: an ability to communicate effectively and build constructive relationships and broad networks proactive, forward thinking as you apply your strong analytical skills and maintain a high attention to detail a genuine interest to further grow and develop a balance of technical, commercial and problem-solving skills to meet the needs of key stakeholders and emerging activities of the ESU team though not essential, experience in data management and/or reporting systems development will be highly valued Why BlueScope As BlueScope continues to go from strength to strength, a career with us provides you with the opportunity to grow and be rewarded. At BlueScope, you will: create and deliver innovative solutions that drive transformation in our business make an impact that really does shape the world we live in keep growing through continuous learning and development opportunities enjoy the sense of belonging that comes from working with people who genuinely look out for one another At BlueScope, our people are our strength, and we don’t say that lightly. Company Description Hi. We’re OFX, a global provider of online, international payment services. We solve the complexity of moving money and enable better decisions. Headquartered in Sydney with offices worldwide, we’re a customer-focused business that is all about inspiring customer confidence. At OFX, you’ll have the opportunity to reach beyond your role and function across disciplines. Make use of your diverse skill set at a business that values your expertise and turn your potential into reality.  Job Description Purpose of your role You will play a critical role on our marketing team to drive growth, with a focus on the optimisation of the entire customer journey, to ensure our marketing activity drives our customer and commercial targets. You will be pivotal in turning OFX’s client & behavioural data into insightful and actionable information, and ensure this information is acted upon by communicating effectively and proactively with stakeholders. This is an ideal opportunity for an Analyst with an FP&A background looking to transition into a marketing function where you will influence commercial decisions. As a bridge between the worlds of finance and marketing, your passion for providing insights and consulting the business will see you dig deep into data sets in order to effectively story tell, providing ‘why, how and clear recommendation of ‘what’s next’. What you do Identify opportunities to drive market share, profitability, growth, channel strategy and customer engagement through marketing and customer insights Provide a portfolio view and regular reporting of customer and marketing metrics to drive visibility of key marketing performance indicators as well as actual performance to target Work with key stakeholders in the marketing team to size opportunities and support in the development of business cases, including modelling the outcomes and developing the full P&L – this includes marketing, customer engagement, product, UX, digital, website, CRM and data science teams Work closely with the Finance team to business case marketing initiatives and impact of incremental investment Assist the CMO with board reporting Continue to refine and expand our channel strategy across all mediums: SEO, SEM, display, social, PR, content, email. Monitor, analyse, and report on KPIs to ensure marketing initiatives are driving profitable short-term and long-term results Understand and validate that ‘data source-to-report’ is reliable, understandable and consumable Develop a program of continuous improvement through structured and measurable experimentation – insight-to-productionisation, including segmentation, data modeling and predictive analysis Use web analytics and business intelligence tools such as Google Analytics or Data Studio to develop dashboards that understands our customers and exploit those insights in campaigns Ensure customer data is strictly used in accordance with OFX’s legal and regulatory requirements in the markets it operates in Think strategically, analytically and creatively about new ways to reach customers and increase relevance Provide pre and post campaign analysis to determine opportunities or realise uplifts.  Qualifications  Degree qualified in a Finance, Statistics, Mathematics or Business-related discipline highly desired. Knowledge, skills, experience 5+ years of commercial experience, working cross-functionally with a mix of experience in areas of data and analytics, product, marketing, sales and/or finance Excellent stakeholder management skills and ability to present findings and recommendations to all levels of the business, through verbal and written findings Experience in working with online marketing programs with CPC, CPA, and CPM cost models Deep understanding of performance marketing, content strategy, and analytics. A data-driven strategist who focuses on a rigorous LTV/CAC approach. Advanced experience in working with analytical tools such as Google Analytics Advanced experience in working with data visual BI tools such as Data Studio or Tableau Advanced skills with SQL, Excel and BigQuery All related products in Google Marketing Platform, Social Media, Google Ads, Salesforce Analytics (Marketing Cloud & Pardot) are desirable. company: AIHW Australian Institute of Health & Welfare
job_description: Position: Project Officers/Data Analysts Classification: APS Level 4 | APS Level 5 Location: All locations Job Reference: 117_11/23 Group: Housing and Specialised Services Unit: Various Salary $72,379 - $86,430 plus superannuation Ongoing | Non-ongoing (for up to 12 months with possibility of extension)  Engagement Type: Full-time or part-time Advertised: Commonwealth Gazette (Wednesday, 8 November 2023) Closing Date: 11:30pm, Tuesday 21 November 2023 Contact Officer: Kindalin Masters, kindalin.masters@aihw.gov.au, 02 6244 1006 More information: Visit our Careers Page and the AIHW Enterprise Agreement This recruitment exercise may be used to fill similar positions in the Housing and Specialised Services Group or within the Institute over the coming 18 months. About the AIHW The Australian Institute of Health and Welfare (AIHW) provides reliable, regular and relevant information and statistics on Australia’s health and welfare. We are committed to providing high quality, national data and analysis across the health, housing and community services sectors. This covers a wide range of areas, from health and welfare expenditure, hospitals, disease and injury, disability and mental health, to ageing, disadvantaged and vulnerable populations, homelessness, and Indigenous health and welfare. The AIHW Difference The AIHW’s APS Employee Census results attest to our positive and supportive workplace culture. We are an inclusive, flexible, and productive workplace where people are treated with respect and courtesy, and diverse and unique attributes are recognised and valued. Our results also show that we achieve top ten rankings in staff engagement, leadership, communication, innovation, and wellbeing scales out of 101 APS agencies. We offer a range of benefits including: access to flexible working arrangements to support your work/life balance attractive remuneration packages including generous superannuation and leave provisions challenging and fulfilling work where you can use your skills and expertise opportunities for professional development including study assistance We are committed to creating genuine opportunities for everyone and we welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people(s), people with disability, LGBTIQA+, neurodiverse people and people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds. The AIHW has offices in Canberra and Sydney and offers remote work opportunities for many roles. For more information, visit the Benefits of working for the AIHW page of our website. Position Summary The Housing and Specialised Services Group (HSSG) collects and analyses data to support reporting and policy decisions on the health and welfare of, and provision of services to, a range of Australians. This includes: People experiencing homelessness or needing assistance with housing. The use of alcohol, tobacco and other drugs, and alcohol and other drug treatment services. Children placed for adoption and their families, and children and young people in contact with the child protection system. Young people experiencing the youth justice system. The health and welfare of people who are in prison. The experience of teachers through the Australian Teacher Workforce Dataset, and other education projects. HSSG is looking for project officers and data analysts to fill multiple positions in the following Units: Child Welfare Unit – Project Officer, Adoptions and Linkage Team, and Data Analyst, National Child Protection Reporting Team The Child Welfare Unit (CWU) is looking for project officers and data analysts. CWU collects and analyses data to support reporting and policy decisions on children who have been adopted as well as children and young people in contact with the child protection system. The CWU work program involves: Management of the National Adoptions Collection, including annual reporting. Analysis and reporting from linked data assets. Management of the Child Protection National Minimum Data Set. Data development activities relating to Closing the Gap, Safe and Supported: the National Framework for Protecting Australia’s Children and National strategy to Prevent and Respond to Child Sexual Abuse. Annual reporting including Report on Government Services (RoGS) and production of Child Protection Australia. To support the CWU deliver this work program the Unit is seeking talented and enthusiastic team members to undertake data governance activities, project scoping and data analysis. In these roles, you will be responsible for preparing governance materials, and undertaking research, analysis and interpretation. You will also be required to assist with engagement with external stakeholders including jurisdictions and members of relevant working groups. Justice and Education Unit – Project Officer, Australian Teacher Workforce Data project The Australian Teacher Workforce Data (ATWD) project links data on initial teacher education and the teacher workforce to build a national picture of Australia’s teaching profession. The Justice and Education Unit works closely with the Australian Institute for Teaching and School Leadership to deliver the Australian Teacher Workforce Data project. Under general direction, as project officer you will work in a small team to manage the ATWD project, including: Working with state and territory teacher regulatory authorities on the collection and validation of data through AIHW’s Validata system. Liaising with the AIHW Data Linkage Unit to progress the linkage of commonwealth, state and survey datasets. Developing metadata for the ATWD collection. Overseeing data access in a secure research environment, including managing a new process for data access requests. Tobacco, Alcohol and Other Drugs Unit – Data Analyst The Tobacco, Alcohol and Other Drugs Unit (TAODU) is responsible for the collection, validation, analysis, and reporting on the prevalence of tobacco, alcohol and other drug use and alcohol and drug treatment services. The Unit’s work program includes reporting against several national data collections including the Alcohol and Other Drug Treatment Services National Minimum Data Set, the National Opioid Pharmacotherapy Statistics Annual Data Collection, Apparent Consumption of Alcohol, and the triennial National Drug Strategy Household Survey. The Unit works closely with the Australian Government Department of Health and Aged Care, state and territory health departments and other experts in alcohol, tobacco and other drug issues. The TAODU is seeking a talented and enthusiastic data analyst to undertake data analysis, technical and non-  technical written work and provide research project support to the Unit. In this role, you will be responsible for undertaking data collection and data management processes, analysis and interpretation including preparation of reports. You will also be required to liaise and negotiate with external stakeholders including jurisdictions and members of relevant working groups. Housing and Homelessness Collection Processing Unit – Project Officer / Data Analyst The Housing and Homelessness Collection Processing Unit (HHCPU) undertakes a variety of data processing, data sharing and data release activities focused on AIHW-managed housing and homelessness data collections. We also manage a number of related data improvement activities and the National Social Housing Survey. The Unit works closely with the Housing and Homelessness Reporting and Development Unit and the Housing and Homelessness Collection Operations Unit to deliver a national housing and homelessness work program overseen by Commonwealth and state and territory government departments with responsibility for housing and homelessness. The HHCPU is looking for a project officer to play a key role in the collection and validation of housing data through AIHW’s Validata system and a data analyst to assist in the transformation and analysis of homelessness data, to inform this important policy area. The successful candidates will work in a fast-paced environment shaped by stakeholder feedback. HSSG are looking for applicants who can perform some or all of the following: Undertake a range of research, analysis planning, project management, governance and data development tasks. Assist with commissioned research and consultation projects to deliver results. Undertake the collection, statistical analysis and interpretation of data and/or research activities in the child welfare field, alcohol, tobacco and other drugs field, or housing and homelessness fields. Contribute to publications, analytical reports, technical and non-technical submissions and agenda papers. Assist with the ATWD, alcohol and other drug treatment collections, or housing aspects of the AIHW’s online validation system. Support other government agencies, state and local authorities, business or community organisations to prepare housing assistance data submissions. Represent the Institute at meetings as appropriate to the responsibilities above. To be successful in these roles, you will have well-developed skills in, or aptitude for, data development and research project work, strong verbal and written communication skills and sound organisational skills. Experience in data linkage and/or analysis of linked data is desirable. Selection Criteria Our ideal candidate will have most or all of the following skills and knowledge: 1. Well-developed conceptual and analytical skills including the ability to investigate and interrogate data. 2. Demonstrated experience in data management, data governance or data development skills. 3. Well-developed research and writing skills, including the ability to synthesise information from a range of sources to produce high quality written work in a range of formats (e.g. print, web and data visualisations). 4. Good communication skills including the ability to communicate and liaise with a range of internal and external stakeholders. 5. Demonstrated organisational skills including the ability to prioritise one’s workload, adapt to changing priorities, and escalate issues when required. 6. Experience in providing project support including coordinating meetings with project teams, taking minutes, and preparing project plans. Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline, or previous experience involving data development, collation, linkage and/or research analysis and reporting will be highly regarded. How to apply Please submit your application online via the AIHW e-Recruit system. When applying online for the first time, you will need to register and provide a valid email address. Your application must include: 1. A summary of your relevant skills and experience and explain why you would be the best person for the role. Your response should align with the position summary and selection criteria information above, and must be no more than 750 words. 2. Your current CV and the names of two referees. Reasonable Adjustment The AIHW is committed to providing accessible, inclusive and equitable recruitment processes for all candidates. If you require a reasonable adjustment (at any stage of the recruitment process), you can note this in your application and provide details of any adjustments required. All efforts will be made to meet your requirements. Reasonable adjustments may include but are not limited to additional interview time, being interviewed at a particular time of day, interview material printed in large font, making allowances for varying communication styles. RecruitAbility The AIHW is committed to supporting the employment and career development of people with disability. Our participation in APS RecruitAbility means we will progress an applicant who declares that they have disability to a further stage in the recruitment process, where they opt into RecruitAbility on the application form and meet the minimum requirements for the role.Show moreReport

We are currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to complement our external program delivery team. We are unique  We are a regional business that thinks on a global level. We work with determined, passionate and curious people to empower communities to share and use energy for a better tomorrow. With a network that powers 95% of NSW and parts of Southern Queensland, we ensure homes, hospitals, schools, businesses, and services stay connected.  We are currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to complement our external program delivery team. This role will be a fixed term contract for 24 months. This role will be based within the Essential Energy footprint with the ability to work from home in a hybrid work environment. About the role  As a Business Analyst at Essential Energy, you will play a crucial role in supporting contracted program delivery and enhancing our operational and financial performance. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional skills in Excel and have a proven ability to build Business Intelligence (BI) reporting systems. Your primary responsibilities will include analysing data, identifying trends, and developing insights to drive informed decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to improve processes and elevate program reporting capabilities. Key Responsibilities: Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize advanced Excel functions to analyze large datasets and extract meaningful insights. Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to provide valuable business intelligence. BI Reporting: Develop and maintain BI reporting systems to enhance program reporting for financial and operational performance. Create visually appealing and user-friendly dashboards for key stakeholders. Process Improvement: Collaborate with teams to identify areas for process improvement and efficiency gains. Propose and implement solutions to streamline workflows and enhance overall effectiveness. Program Support: Provide analytical support for external program delivery, ensuring alignment with organisational goals. Work closely with project teams to understand requirements and deliver actionable insights . To be successful you will have demonstrated skills to document current and proposed business processing using relevant tools, along with excellent organisational skills to manage and implement large, complex and varying workloads.  You will have strong presentation skills with the ability to identify data and trends in detailed reports to senior management in order facilitated improved decision making.  Your communication, relationship management, negotiation and interpersonal skills will allow for effective communication at all levels, including senior management.  Required Qualifications / Experience Diploma in Business or demonstrated capability through past employment experience and/or relevant qualifications Demonstrated experience in a similar/professional role in the Construction or Consulting or Energy/Electrical or Utilities industry  Demonstrated experience in business/requirements analysis in a large enterprise Demonstrated reporting and policy/process development experience in order to drive continuous improvement opportunities  A thorough knowledge of business/project processes and practices including the identification, analysis, design, documentation and implementation of business processes  Good understanding of commercial considerations and risk management principles  Knowledge and understanding of project management processes and methodologies. For further information please contact  Jason Bierer, Senior Program Project Manager, on 0408 693 208. Applications close on Sunday 19th November 2023 at 11.55 pm (AEST) Passionate people. Global thinking. Regional heart. Building a better energy future. Essential Energy is committed to building a culturally diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourages applicants to apply regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or disability. As an organisation, our aim is to champion inclusivity in the workplace and celebrate the difference in all our employees.Show moreReport

Business Analyst behaviour 101: Helping everyone behind their back without them noticing. AND responsible for delivering a large Cooperative Research Centres Project (CRC-P). Sounds like you? Join us as we are looking for a Business Analyst who draws out the needs that are not known yet with a positive attitude and a passion for payments. Who we are? The Novatti Group is a fintech company that enables businesses to pay and be paid from any device, anywhere. By using our solutions, businesses can send money internationally, accept payment from consumers both in-store and online, provide prepaid Visa cards, automate their billing, and a whole bunch of other amazing things needed to operate in a digital and increasingly cashless world. Our clients include everyone from corner stores to start-ups to global organisations, while our key partners are some of the world's biggest and most innovative companies, including Visa, Apple Pay, Google Pay. We are listed on the Australia Stock Exchange (ASX) and have operations in multiple countries globally, including Europe, Malaysia and the US. Most importantly, we are a fast-growing company that is looking for amazing, talented people who want to join us on our journey and grow with us. What will you be doing? As the Business Analyst, one of the main objectives will be to work with the project team responsible for delivering a large Cooperative Research Centres Project (CRC-P) with multiple delivery partners over 3 years. You'll be primarily responsible for partnering with the project team on ad hoc and recurring analyses and building out workflow and systems as our company continues to grow. Reporting to the Head of Engineering, you'll have the opportunity to roll up your sleeves to help scale an organisation that is doing meaningful work in the industry, valuing truth and helping our clients discover it. The role will require you to solve the most complex, interesting challenges of a rapidly scaling team. Importantly, in this role, you will: Capture requirements in collaboration with Product Managers, Solution Architects and Technical Leads. Assist product managers in preparing requirements documents for vendors. Support Solution Architects to produce high-level solution designs based on requirements. Support Technical Leads to produce detailed technical designs based on requirements. Provide clarifications of requirements to the Engineering team. Ensure that defect tickets raised by support teams capture the required details. Work as a part of an Agile delivery team. Draft customer documentation and ensure that it is up to date in collaboration with the Engineering team and Product Managers. Draft business process documentation required by the sales, legal and marketing teams. What would make you a good candidate? Change is constant here so we're always looking for self-starters who can get roll up their sleeves and crack on! You have experience in creating business analysis, customer documentation and leading projects using different methodologies like Agile, Lean and/or Six Sigma, etc. You can easily translate data interpretation and analysis into insightful presentations and recommendations. You have a solid understanding of API Technologies, Integration Frameworks and PCI domains. You are a problem solver - you aren't afraid to roll up your sleeves, identify problems, and devise thoughtful solutions. You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills. This is a cross-functional role, and therefore, you should be a cultural champion in the organisation. You have the ability to influence those around you, regardless of role and title - you will always have stakeholders that will directly impact the quality and deadlines of your projects. You are motivated by a fast-paced environment where you will have to constantly adapt with a can-do attitude - no two days are the same, seriously! What it means to work for us Does shaping your own future excite you? Are you inspired by blending your passions and career? At Novatti, we are inspired by the curious-minded, diverse thinkers, and authentic individuals, and we recognize that no two journeys are the same. Some of the other perks of working with us: Opportunities to learn and accelerate career development. A collaborative, team environment with people who truly love what they do. Regular social activities, daily discounts and celebrations. Flexible work arrangements, including remote working. Bill Gates once penned “We are changing the world with technology.” If you feel the same, take the leap and apply with us. To start your application with us, please submit your CV and a cover letter (yep, we do read them) and we will be in touch as soon as we can. IN A NUTSHELL  Bellroy is a growing global company with 12+ years of success. We have expanded our reach to 172 countries, serving over 1,200 retail locations and releasing about 50 new products a year. Resilience is deeply ingrained in the fabric of our business, as we embrace the challenges of a dynamic global economy marked by constrained supply chains, rising costs, and fluctuating currencies. We are seeking a skilled business analyst, specialising in margin and pricing analysis, to dig into our data and refine and adapt our margin-management processes to drive sustainable growth.  You will play a vital role in transforming the source data into accessible, usable and actionable information that directly bolster the business's decision-making process. Collaborating cross-functionally throughout the organisation, you will enhance our understanding and optimisation of pricing and margins. By examining the drivers influencing our costs and establishing forecasts and performance metrics, you will facilitate the margin-monitoring function across all revenue channels. You will contribute to shaping our pricing strategy and oversee its implementation, ensuring suitable pricing for our extensive product range and global marketplaces in 18 currencies.  We're really after someone who is fascinated by the applied side of business analysis. You're someone who really wants data to be used to make a difference in the world, and you want to be at the heart of making that happen. If you bring your clear-thinking mind, and focus on practical applications of data to help us, our world-class team will give you the freedom, resources and support you need to make a difference.  YOU COULD BE THE ONE IF YOU HAVE…  4-8 years of experience working with large sets of data, including sourcing data from different systems, pulling it together and drawing practical insights out of it. Strong stakeholder management and communication skills with both technical and non-technical individuals. Advanced skills in spreadsheet modelling and data visualisation using BI tools. Proficiency in writing SQL queries and ability to think about data flows: given some messy source data, you can find a clean normalised form. An interest in the commercial aspects of a business like Bellroy (for example, understanding what drives gross profit). A knack for seeing which insights and pieces of information are the important ones for decision making, and an interest in designing reports that focus on the most important pieces while giving enough context to let people dive deeper if they want to. The desire to get your hands a bit dirty, you want to be involved in the implementation of the process you create so you can understand what is working and what you can do better next time. An interest in programming (you don't have to be a data scientist, a programmer or a statistician, but you probably have dabbled a bit in this area).   IF YOU WERE HERE LAST MONTH YOU MIGHT HAVE:  Analysed our supply chain costs to understand how they differ by product type and country; understand how this is impacting our landed cost & in turn our margins in each marketplace then presented your findings to our Finance Manager Identified key margin performance metrics and developed a BI dashboard that helps you visualise and track their performance Kicked off a project to reengineer our existing pricing process and data flows. As a first step, used SQL to explore raw datasets across a multitude of variables related to our pricing methodology. Completed a pricing review after recent foreign exchange rate volatility, rolled out the updates across relevant systems and provided key stakeholders with a report that outlines the changes. Improved the spreadsheet model used to calculate regional prices for a new product range to make it more robust and scalable; then shared and discussed the proposed prices with regional managers Spent time with our wholesale team understanding our discount and markup rates to make recommendations to improve our profitability while maintaining healthy sales growth Discussed logistics costing with our Logistics and Sales Operations Manager and built a dashboard to monitor costs by provider Spoken with our Chief Production Officer to understand what is driving costs within manufacturing to see how we can optimise this space further Advised our CFO on pricing updates in one of our growing marketplaces   LOCATION & HOURS  This is a full-time role based out of our new Collingwood office (with WFH options).Show moreReport

Samsung Ads   For our client Samsung Ads, we're looking for a Data Analyst in Singapore (Full Time Role).   Samsung Ads, the advertising monetization arm of Samsung Electronics, leverages proprietary real-time TV viewing behavior and insights to promote relevant brands and content experiences to consumers. We partner with brands, agencies and content owners to deliver unique advertising opportunities on native placements within our Smart TV platform and programmatically with a cross device solution.  Samsung’s unique first party data help brands connect to their audience as they explore content across desktop, mobile, tablets and our Smart TVs. The Samsung Ad platform delivers high-quality audience targeting powered by three key components: first-party audience data at scale, world-class data science, and brand-safe cross-device ad inventory.   The opportunity   We’re looking for an innovative individual to support the Samsung Ads Analytics team. This full-time position will create reporting solutions from one of the richest TV viewership/media consumption databases in the industry today.  The candidate will build reporting solutions to guide strategy and ad sales powered by Samsung proprietary data using SQL, Python and leveraging other AWS tools such as EC2 and S3.  The candidate will explore data to find trends and identify new opportunities for the organization. Also, the candidate will help tune and improve current code base.  Candidate must be organized, detailed oriented, flexible and possess ability to establish priorities with minimal guidance in a fast paced environment – must be proactive, analytical problem solver and strategic thinker who is able to draw conclusions- not just report numbers  Candidates must have prior experience with SQL and Python and/or R.  This role will report to the APAC Analytics Lead.  Responsibilities  Data Analytics  Data quality and standards implementation Enhance open data collection to include information that is relevant for the business Maintain databases servicing the Insights Team to improve efficiency Develop and deploy automated solutions to facilitate the decision making process  Sales & Insights  Translate business requirements into SQL queries and Python scripts for Ad Hoc analysis and new reporting solutions Deliver innovative consumer insights solutions for pro-active engagements with agencies and clients Tune and optimize current reporting solutions Explore data to identify trends and anomalies, develop new analytical capabilities/solutions, and find new monetization opportunities Data-driven insights for briefs responses and marketing narrative Document business requirements  Team Support  Ability to translate technical analysis into a actionable insights for non-technical audience Develop working relationships and exchange best practices with other Samsung Ads entities such as North America and Europe   Qualifications  Degree in computer science/engineering or quantitative discipline (Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics). Masters Preferred. Strong statistical acumen 4+ years in a related engineering/analytics work/data mining Strong SQL skills – 3+ years using SQL Strong Python and/or R skills - 2+ years working with Python and/or R for data manipulation, cleansing and automation Strong BI Experience Experience with AWS tools such as EC2 and S3 Jira, Confluence, GitHub and other agile development tool experience   Bonus  Familiarity with media, TV measurement DOMO Experience Linux Experience Dash and/or Shiny or any other libraryShow moreReport

Insights Analyst Permanent role Hybrid and flexible working environment Sydney (Norwest) office location About Woolworths   Woolworths Group is a food and everyday needs retailer united by the shared purpose of creating better experiences together for a better tomorrow. With more than 1,400 stores across its Woolworths Supermarkets, Countdown Supermarkets (New Zealand) and BIG W brands, and fast-growing eCommerce businesses, Woolworths Group is Australia and New Zealand’s largest retailer. A top 10 company on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX), Woolworths Group employs more than 180,000 team members and serves more than 20 million customers a week.   About the role   The Risk Analytics team helps the risk community across Woolworths Group use data to make risk-informed choices with confidence and helps them focus on what matters most. The team drives the organisation towards the effective use of data and analytics to support decision-making and early detection of issues across Woolworths Group.  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Insights Analyst to join our dynamic team. As an Insights Analyst, you will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making and delivering actionable insights to support Woolworths Group Risk strategic objectives. You will be responsible for analysing large datasets, identifying trends, and translating complex data into meaningful reports and recommendations. Responsibilities will include: Data Analysis: Utilise advanced analytical techniques to extract insights from complex datasets, identifying trends, patterns, and correlations to provide actionable recommendations. Strategic Insights : Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into data requirements, ensuring that insights align with overall organisational goals. Reporting and Visualization : Create compelling and visually engaging reports, dashboards, and presentations to effectively communicate insights to stakeholders at all levels of the organisation. Data Integrity and Quality : Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing data validation, cleansing, and transforming processes to maintain high-quality datasets. Forecasting and Predictive Modelling : Develop and implement forecasting models and predictive analytics to support strategic planning and business forecasting initiatives. Risk Management : Understanding principles of risk management and be a thought partner across the business in identification, assessment, control, and monitoring of various material risks affecting the organisation Collaborative Relationships : Build strong relationships and collaborate with stakeholders across the organisation, including marketing, finance, operations, and product teams, to understand their needs and provide insights that drive informed decision-making. Continuous Improvement : Stay updated with industry best practices, emerging technologies, and data analysis techniques, and proactively identify opportunities to enhance analytical methodologies and processes  Who we are looking for We are looking for an experienced Insights Analyst, who has proficiency in technical skills for data analysis, alongside excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data and technical concepts in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Requirements: Experience: Minimum of 3 years of experience as an Insights Analyst, Data Analyst, or a similar role, with a proven track record of delivering impactful insights and recommendations. Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with expertise in statistical analysis, data modelling, and data visualisation tools (e.g., Python, SQL, Tableau, Google Looker). Business Acumen: Ability to understand business objectives, translate them into analytical requirements, and provide actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making. Education : Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Actuarial, or a related field. A master's degree would be a plus Team Player : Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and build relationships across the organisation. Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and consistency in data analysis and reporting. Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple priorities, and adapt to changing business needs. Grow with the Group  As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.  We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency.  As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.  We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.  We’d love to hear from You  If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au . #LI #work180. #Hybrid Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.Show moreReport

job_title: Senior Data Analyst, SBS On Demand
job_description: Senior Data Analyst, SBS On Demand At SBS, we embrace difference, and we welcome applications from people of all backgrounds. We also acknowledge the unique contribution that Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples make to our society and our workplace through their enduring and continued connection to land, sea, sky and community. About Us SBS is one of the world's most unique and innovative media organisations, producing trusted, meaningful and engaging content that exists for all Australians to inspire, support and celebrate the diversity of our multicultural society. Our purpose, for the last 40 years, has reflected and explored the evolving diversity of Australia, investing in initiatives to deepen its connections with communities, sharing their stories and giving a voice to those often unheard, with the aim of increasing understanding and respect of the differences that make up Australia. SBS is a truly distinctive network, showcasing multicultural, multilingual and First Nations stories otherwise untold in the Australian media. The Department SBS has now surpassed 13 million registered users of SBS On Demand. With premiere releases, boxset collections, live events, channel simulcasts and catch-up titles, there is more than 15,000 hours of programming available at any time, for free. We adopt human-centred design principles that let our audiences guide the product, curation and engagement strategies, as we help users navigate the breadth and depth of our diverse and evolving catalogue. Our product roadmap ensures SBS On Demand is stable and accessible, supporting scale with features that encourage content sampling, allowing for tactical user retention activities whilst meeting commercial objectives. The Role As the Senior Data Analyst, you will work with data to provide valuable insights, helping our team make better decisions and plan for the future. You'll be skilled at asking the right questions, finding important data, and using sophisticated methods to get useful information. Then, you'll explain it clearly to assist our team in solving complex problems. Your analysis will span our end-to-end user journeys, across multiple platforms, channels and the content they are consuming. Reporting into the Analytics Lead within our Engagement team this role will see you: Be a trusted adviser to the SBS On Demand product teams, helping them to identify key business questions and finding ways to answer those questions with data and statistical analysis where applicable. Define problems and scope solutions for your work, understanding the business context of the work as well as the broader strategic direction of the product and company. Partnering with cross-functional teams to set data standards and architecture, improving data infrastructure for organisation-wide access and utilisation. Produce metrics and models which enable stakeholders to enhance user onboarding, retention, and overall engagement on the SBS On Demand platform. Design and develop Tableau dashboards to provide reporting and insights to various stakeholders. Proactively seek opportunities to automate data and reporting to reduce human error and dependencies. It is a requirement of this role that incumbents are fully vaccinated with an approved Covid-19 vaccination in line with the ATAGI guidelines which include booster shots. We do however have a medical exemption process and we would be happy to discuss your application should this be applicable to you. You might want to consider what other opportunities this could lead to down the track. About you Strong analytical skills with the ability to effectively communicate findings, explain the analytical process, and provide practical demonstrations of past work. Expertise in analysis / reporting - including use and understanding of business intelligence tools, data warehousing and reporting. Strong SQL and Tableau skills In-depth knowledge and experience of Adobe Analytics and/or similar enterprise digital analytics tools, preferably in a media environment Proficiency in R or Python Experience handling multiple stakeholders Feel like you meet most, but perhaps not all the criteria listed? Then, send through your detail as whilst we have specific requirements in mind we can look at how we can bridge the gaps! Some of the reasons to consider working with us The people! a genuine sense of feeling included (we truly celebrate and welcome difference!) and being part of one of the most inclusive companies in Australia! The culture and the engagement of our workforce, we are proud to have an employee engagement score of 82% with low levels of employee turnover. A brand that is not only recognisable but trusted and established, we have been broadcasting for over 40 years and we’re not done yet! We offer a range of benefits from, health care checks, salary packaging, Employee Assistance Programme, flexible work arrangements and for our Sydney based employee’s free gym membership! We also love to promote from within! we have allocated funds to do just that and help with training gaps when moving from role to role. Want to learn more? Then hit apply and take the first step to applying for not just another job but a possible whole new career! Want to learn more? Then hit apply and take the first step to applying not just for another job but a possible whole new career in a purpose led organisation! Not quite the right role for you? No problem, how about popping your details into our talent pool? Email us at noreplytalentpool@sbs.com.au to let us know what roles would be of interest to you and we will keep you informed of when they arise! (If you no longer want to be listed in our talent pool, then just email us and let us know and we will remove your detail). For other opportunities within our organisation please visit our careers website SBS Careers - Working at SBS Reasonable adjustments SBS recognises that everyone is unique, and you might require some adjustments to ensure you have the best opportunity to apply and put your skills forward for consideration. If we can make some adjustments to the SBS recruitment/interview process to better enable you to shine, then please contact careers@sbs.com.au and let us know. Adjustments include but are not limited to; alternative application methods, interview setups, physical requirements, guidance for trans or gender diverse applicants, specific interview availability times and more. To find out more about reasonable adjustments with SBS, please view our video here. We are shortlisting applications as they come in, so don’t delay, apply today!
