job_title: Senior Data Analyst (MySQL) - Remote work or the office!
job_description: Excellent opportunity for a passionate Senior Data Analyst (MySQL) to join a respected & evolving payments organization that are expanding Australia wide. This is a great time to come on board as they continue to transform the payments industry.  As the Data Analyst you will play a key role in the company and will collaborate with leaders & external clients too. You will be supported by a team of BA’s and developers working in a connected Agile environment.  Work remotely or from anywhere in Australia. My client will invest in you and support you to diversify your career to a BA or a PM move up the ladder. Friendly and progressive payments client with a very diverse culture   Experience required:  5 years’ working as a Data Analyst or business Data Analyst Ability to parse, manipulate and review large quantities of complex data Solid commercial experience working with MySQL Knowledge of other databases such as SQL Server, PostgreSQL and NoSQL databases Expertise in designing user-friendly, insightful, interactive dashboards using Qlik, Tableau or Power BI Desired experience working within Payments is a huge bonus!! Financial Services, Capital Markets, Insurance, or Wealth & Asset Management experience is also valuable.   This is a fantastic opportunity to join a company that is thriving!!  To be considered please APPLY to today or text Anna-Maria on 0426 503 822 for more information.Show moreReport

Our mission at Secure Code Warrior is to make the digital world safer by helping companies secure their software through developer-driven security. In a nutshell, Secure Code Warrior gives developers the skills to write secure code. Our learning platform is the most effective secure coding solution because it uses agile learning methods for developers to learn, apply, and retain software security principles. Over 600 enterprises trust Secure Code Warrior to implement agile learning security programs, deliver secure software rapidly, and create a culture of developer-driven security. To make our mission possible, we’ve brought together individuals passionate about software, security, connection, and collaboration. We are a venture-backed, global remote-first company with offices in Australia, America, Belgium, Iceland, and the United Kingdom. For more information about Secure Code Warrior, visit www.securecodewarrior.com. This role will be working with the Product team to identify trends, gaps and opportunities for improved customer and business outcomes, by understanding customer usage of the Secure Code Warrior SaaS platform.  You will help the product team understand how the SCW platform provides value to our customers, including the investigation of data around adoption, engagement, sentiment and other similar SaaS metrics. This role will have the chance to work amongst peer data professionals from across the company who are delivering insights from the Tableau Cloud platform, working with multiple and diverse data environments (Amplitude, Productboard, Salesforce, Jira …) through a data lake technology stack as the “Single Source of Truth”.  This is an opportunity to be in a vital role, representing and supporting our Product team with our dynamic visual analytics platform environment in a growing business and pivotal industry. What You Will Do: You will produce and maintain standardised reporting dashboards for the Product team As a key member of the SCW Data team, you will be the ‘go-to’ for insights for the Product team, elevating the team on quality and innovation by designing/building/delivering actionable insights Work closely across the SCW Data team to analyse and decipher insights and support growth initiatives. To support effective business decision-making, provide timely insights and analytical support to internal Product stakeholders Can help relate the problems of the Product Managers to the Platform, so that they can also contribute some good ideas in that space. What You Will Bring: 2+ years of experience in a high-impact Product Analyst role. (ideal backgrounds include: a similar analyst role at a SaaS company, a data-based consulting role, or other data strategy-type positions) Bachelor's degree in an analytical field or equivalent experience is desirable Some programming/scripting ability is a plus (willing and able to get ‘under the hood’ if needed) Experience with Tableau in designing, building and delivering visual analytics solutions Usage of Amplitude to help answer business questions A curious mindset - to research different ways to measure existing data points in other ways You're joining us at an exciting stage in our journey, and are key to our future success. You’ll have the opportunity to create impact, deliver on your ideas, and use your spark; experience and expertise to help us live long and prosper. Warriors have full flexibility. We appreciate that you’ll do your best work when you’re rested and energized. With our business operating globally, there’s no 9-5 grind at Secure Code Warrior. You’re encouraged to work the days, times and in the way that suits your best. We also offer generous leave and work from home options so you can make work work for you. We’re a tight-knit team that values humility, diversity, giving back to the community and to each other. Giving back is key to being a Warrior, and we do what we can to make the world a little bit brighter as we work to make it more secure. Diversity. Inclusion. They’re more than just words for us. They’re the hard-and-fast principles guiding how we build our teams, cultivate leaders and create a company where every single person feels safe and celebrated. We have a global, multicultural following—we want to reflect that inside our walls and ensure people come as they are, we like it that way!Show moreReport

job_title: Technical Business Analyst (BA) Data Warehouse-Data Engineering
job_description: Work with leading edge API's and data projects Salary- 110,000-130,000 + super + benefits+ perks Flexible Diverse Supportive and Innovative  Technical/Digital Business Analyst   ScaleUP is partnering with a leading media tech company seeking a talented technical business analyst (tech BA) who wants to work for a supportive, exciting, and dynamic company with a culture of high performance & best practices. The team consists of a diverse workforce that each brings something a little bit different to the team.  You will join a team of talented Software engineers, Designers, PMs, and Delivery Managers who will help you build and maintain bleeding-edge applications that are disputing and impacting the media and technology industry & worldwide.   Your Purpose  The purpose of Technical Business Analyst (or digital business analyst or Data Business Analyst) is to bridge the gap between Product requirements and technical solutions. You will ensure the Squad achieves desired outcomes to help the business thrive and deliver technical solutions.  We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Technical Business Analyst with an understanding of API development and Data Engineering.  Every day you will work closely with the Solution Architect and cross-functional teams and will be pivotal in driving innovation. You'll have an Agile mindset and live and breathe Agile working methodologies.  Your role ensures the seamless alignment of business requirements with technical solutions in the dynamic fields of data integration and API development for all of their key flagship technical products.  What's needed to be successful in this role:  It's a mid-level role, we are looking for someone with 4 -5 years worth of experience working as a technical BA with a track record of contributing to the success of API and data engineering initiatives.  You'll have in-depth knowledge of how large-scale business technology teams operate from API development, data engineering, data modeling, ETL, data warehousing & analytics.  Agile. You'll live and breathe it. You love working with its methodologies and being a champion of its processes in your day-to-day.  Strong Communication skills are a must in this role. I don't need to write this, surely it's what you do on a day to day, but what I'm getting at is being able to communicate between stakeholders and speak their language, you'll need to speak dev talk to API engineers, data talk to data engineers, business talk to upper management, manage expectations, write up requirements, and work with the PM's and delivery leads to ensure delivery is running according to plan.  This role has loads to offer the right person in regard to growth potential for your career and exposure to modern bleeding-edge technology and application development. Plus you'll get to work with pretty awesome people at a company that thrives but doesn't take itself too seriously.   It's a hybrid role (3 days a week in the office) that's based in Sydney's CBD very close to public transport, providing a great mix of cultural integration and understanding. It's also a truly flexible working environment that has a mature understanding of what it's like and needed to be flexible. They are also a huge advocate for women in technology and foster an incredibly inclusive work force.  It's a permanent full time opportunity paying a salary up to $130,000 + super + loads of cool benefits. Open to people with full working rights and appropriate visas to work in Australia.  If you are keen please apply now or email nivy@scaleuprecruitment.com.auShow moreReport

Job Description KPMG is seeking a passionate, autonomous Data Analyst to support the marketing function of the firm. This role will be responsible for reporting on all facets of marketing performance and enabling data governance and best practice. Your Opportunity Forming part of the Marketing Operations team in Client Experience & Brand, this role will be key in delivering to the data strategy for Marketing. You will be responsible for marketing campaign & CRM reporting that happens across the team. You will work with SMEs in building & maintaining your understanding of the changes to the digital marketing eco system and will incorporate these into reporting. You will collaborate with the Services & Industry Marketing leads to deliver reporting needs by providing evidence to the conversations they have with KPMG Partners and other business leaders. You’ll work with the broader CX&B team to implement reporting best practises. How are you extraordinary? You are an expert in the Data & Analytics space and have a clear understanding of all data analytics principles including data quality, data governance, data integrations, data architecture, documentation, visualisation and mainly data driven decision making. You have studied Business Analytics or Data Analytics formally and have work experience in the digital marketing space. Your Experience At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients, and communities. To be considered for this opportunity, your qualifications, skills & experience could include the following: Report building (in Excel & Power BI) has been part of your previous work. Able to maintain a reporting cadence (monthly, quarterly, annually) and deliver to timelines. Expert in understanding the digital media landscape of an organisation. Demonstrated success in managing multiple stakeholders. Able to have conversations with both highly technical and non-technical stakeholders and show expertise in translating requirements between the two. Ability to take ownership of the data architecture of the team. Able to think and suggest creative solutions to data and reporting issues. Comfortable and motivated working in a collaborative matrix environment. Tertiary qualification in Business Analytics or Data Analytics preferred. Work experience in Marketing Analytics or Digital Marketing preferred. Experience working with Microsoft Dynamics CRM is an added advantage. Additional Information KPMG is a professional services firm with global outreach and deep sector experience. We work with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change and enable growth. Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who’ve got your back. You’ll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture. At KPMG, you’ll take control over how you work. We’re embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more. Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact the Talent Support Team. At KPMG every career is different, and we look forward to seeing how you grow with us.Show moreReport

Analyst, Structured Finance Ratings, Sydney Requisition ID: 45963 Business Unit: Fitch Ratings Category: Credit Analysis & Research Location: Sydney, NSW, AU Date Posted: Nov 3, 2023 At Fitch, we have an open culture where employees are able to exchange ideas and perspectives, throughout the organization, irrespective of their seniority. Fitch’s ERGs are available to connect employees with others within the organization to offer professional and personal support.  With our expertise, we are not only creating data and information, but also producing timely insights from every angle to influence decision making in this ever changing and highly competitive market. We have a relentless hunger to innovate and unlock the power of human insights and to drive value for our customers. There has never been a better time to make an impact and we invite you to join us on this journey.  Fitch Ratings is a leading provider of credit ratings, commentary and research. Dedicated to providing value beyond the rating through independent and prospective credit opinions, Fitch Ratings offers global perspectives shaped by strong local market experience and credit market expertise. The additional context, perspective and insights we provide have helped fund a century of growth and enables you to make important credit judgments with confidence.  Analyst, Structured Finance, Sydney Australia/New Zealand Structured Finance and Covered Bonds is currently seeking an Analyst based out of our Sydney office. The Australian Structured Finance (SF) and Covered Bonds (CVB) team is currently a team of 16 analysts covering all asset classes in Australian and New Zealand SF and CVB.  What We Offer: Join an experienced team; Exposure to majority of issuers in the market; Variety of work with ability to work on multiple asset classes, in both monitoring existing transactions as a well as rating new transactions; Great development opportunity for someone looking to start or continue to develop their career in SF/CvB.  We’ll Count on You To: Ensure all structured finance transactions/CvB programmes are reviewed on a continuous 12 month schedule and all transactions/programmes have been reviewed at least once a year by the due date which include: Performing data analysis in excel Executing Fitch generated models Preparing analytical documentation based on Fitch templates Presenting analytical documentation and communicate comments and opinions in committee effectively Preparing press releases based on Fitch templates; Assist with rating new transactions; Provide timely market/transaction performance commentary; Manage queries from issuers/bankers/investors – represent Fitch and communicate effectively with external transaction parties; Participate in originator/servicer review meetings; Adhoc projects/reporting and author reports.  What You Need to Have: Undergraduate degree in a finance related discipline; A minimum of 18 months experience with a financial institution working in the mortgage or asset finance departments (preference in a credit or analytical related role) where the role required; The candidate to work in excel to manipulate, transform and perform calculation to generate an analytical result to support their proposal / recommendations The candidate to prepare documentation to support their proposals / recommendations; Intermediate excel skills with knowledge of following functionality [vlookup(), sumif(), if(), index(), match() etc]; Strong time management skills and a high level of attention to detail; An analytical individual who enjoys working with spreadsheets to generate a solution / result.  What Would Make You Stand Out: Previous structured finance experience; Previous credit experience.  Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning. For more information please visit our websites: www.fitchratings.com | www.fitchsolutions.com | www.fitchlearning.com Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Data Analytics and Visualization Specialist As a Data Analytics and Visualization Specialist, your primary responsibility is to harness the wealth of data available in the health and pharmaceutical sector, providing valuable insights to our commercial team through effective visualization. You will play a pivotal role in overseeing and implementing brand forecasting, long-range planning (LRP), market research, business development assessment, and marketing and sales insights using advanced modeling and business intelligence (BI) tools. Key Qualifications: A minimum of 5 years of experience in a comparable role. Proficiency in data analysis and interpretation. Strong decision-making support skills. Exceptional communication abilities to effectively convey data-driven narratives. Meticulous attention to detail. Sound financial and business acumen. Ideally, experience with Tableau or Power BI. Role Description: In this role, you will collaborate closely with the Specialty business unit and the commercial marketing team, serving as a key support figure. Your tasks will include partnering with the marketing and brand teams to gain a deep understanding of the market, therapeutic areas, and gathering data related to competitors and product usage across various settings (e.g., hospitals and homes). You will also work alongside brand managers to develop market and forecast models, providing valuable insights and analysis to guide decision-making. Responsibilities: Dive deep into data, translating it into actionable insights for the business unit. Perform ROI analysis and analyse sales and market data to offer feedback. Examine customer segmentation and sales channels, identifying strategic opportunities. Utilise data and insights to create informative reports and compelling dashboards. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and leverage BI tools and spreadsheets. Develop new reports and dashboards to meet evolving business needs. Offer analytical support to the Commercial marketing groups by comprehending market dynamics and product landscape. Collaborate with brand managers to gather data on competitors and market trends. Assist in developing market and forecasting models, including long-range planning. Support brand teams in generating insights through primary market research. Regularly assess existing reports for relevance and usage. Conduct campaign ROI analysis and provide actionable feedback. Monitor purchasing patterns of major wholesalers and customers and analyse their implications on regional sales. Work closely with the marketing and business analytics team to understand customer segmentation and preferences. Leverage visualisation techniques to interpret commercial requirements effectively. Gather information from stakeholder meetings and produce insightful reports and analytics. Compile market insights and key performance indicators (KPIs/KBIs) for marketing, sales, and management. Utilise advanced spreadsheet and BI tools to analyse data and identify leading and lagging indicators. Continuously assess and optimise existing reporting structures for relevance and utility. If you have a passion for transforming complex data into actionable insights and possess the requisite experience and skills, we encourage you to apply for this challenging and rewarding position. Join our team and play a crucial role in driving data-driven decisions in the health and pharmaceutical industry. In so doing, they ensure that all operational services and their performance are measured in a consistent, professional manner throughout the IT organisation, and that the services and the reports produced meet the needs of the business and customers. Experience in the process of developing and implementing new report templates. Experience working with Microsoft Exchange, Word, Excel Project, Power Point, Power BI and VBA. Understanding of and experience with ITIL (IT Infrastructure Library) highly regarded Understanding of system generally used in service management operations e.g. Service Now, highly regarded Display a strong client service orientation Excellent communications skills Good report writing skills using advanced excel and other MS office packages. Logical and systematic and has the ability to drive resolution using influencing skills Understand the business needs and expectations Meticulous with good problem solving and solution formulation ability   Selected candidate must be an Australian Citizen and will be subject to successful background checks and employment pre-screening. Are you committed to bringing your best to life every day?  At MLC Life Insurance, we’re proud of our history of protecting Australians for over 135 years. We provide flexible, affordable, and innovative insurance products to almost 1 million Australians. We’re Australian-led and managed, and part of a global network through our partnership with one of the world’s leading life insurers, Nippon Life Insurance Group.  We’re driven by a powerful purpose, providing our customers and their families with a Promise for Life to be there when they need us most – and that’s a great purpose to bring us together at work every day.  We work hard to deliver a total customer experience that keeps our customers and partners at the forefront of all our decisions. We’re a values-driven business that strives for high performance and growth as we look towards the future.   The Role  Reporting in to the IT Practices Manager, the Observability Site Reliability Engineer role is a newly created role within the team to help drive the overall observability of our systems and processes and foster a data driven culture.  You will be responsible for uplifting the observability and real-time monitoring capability and culture at MLC Life Insurance.  You will succeed in doing so by gathering, analysing and presenting data across various systems and tools to help develop an organisation and technology-wide view to provide meaningful reports, metrics and visualisations. This will aid in and promote improvements and insights to support informed decision making. About you  You are an experienced Observability Analyst with a minimum of 2+ years of experience in IT performance management or in a similar capacity.  You possess knowledge and exposure to the concept of Observability, APM and logging tools (e.g. Splunk, New Relic, Dynatrace, AppDynamics), with working knowledge of SQL, SSIS and data reporting and visualisation tools such as Power BI.  Lastly, you possess the ability to build and maintain relationships with a wide range of stakeholders, enabling you to influence the decision making process.  Bringing our best to life - why join us? We reward and celebrate our successes, through our incentive and recognition programs. job_description: 3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. Job Description: 3M is establishing two industry-leading companies, creating value through the spin-off of its Health Care business, while 3M will continue to be a global material science leader, focusing our innovation to win in favorable global megatrends and attractive end markets. This new Health Care Company will be a leading global diversified health technology company with: Proven category leadership Exposure to attractive end-markets Innovation mindset driving improved patient outcomes Collaborative customer relationships Deep global regulatory experience Operational excellence and strong cash flow Strong sales growth and profitability with significant recurring sales We expect the creation of the two companies will be completed by the end of 2023. For now, we will continue to operate as one global company. This role is positioned to drive the success of the "New Health Care Company”. This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military experience to a 3M career. The Impact You’ll Make in this Role; As a(n) POS/CB Analyst for ANZ, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. A great place to work When you join Capricorn, you become a part of something bigger than a typical company, because as a co-operative we exist to improve the lives of our Members by supporting them in building stronger businesses – not the other way around. We are purpose-led and are committed to empowering our community to thrive. Our community includes our employees, and we know what is important to them, because we asked! And here's our commitments to you: Provide a diverse and inclusive workplace – because we know how important it is for everyone to be treated fairly and with respect. Give you flexibility – it's important to recognise we are all unique and need to create work life balance. Offer paid parental leave – that supports both parent's leave and their transition back to work. Create a fun environment – our social calendar is full up with a range of different virtual and face-to-face events to keep us connected. Work perks – that our employees actually use, such as a fantastic reward and recognition program, wellness program, additional leave purchase and so much more! The role and what we are looking for The Capricorn Risk Division (CRD) is on the lookout for a dynamic and passionate Business Intelligence Developer to join our team. If you thrive on challenges, value skill development, and have a hunger for transforming raw data into meaningful business solutions, this role is perfect for you. As a Business Intelligence Developer, you will play a pivotal role in fulfilling the data and reporting requirements for the CRD. You will support the behind-the-scenes production of data, ensuring it is collected to release its fullest potential. In terms of reporting, you'll be the bridge between raw data and actionable insights. Your key stakeholders will be within the Product & Underwriting, Sales, Claims, and Finance departments. In addition, forging strong relationships with the Data Platform and IT infrastructure teams will be essential to ensuring the seamless flow of data. Software and Tools: We have an impressive tech stack for you to leverage. While SAS Enterprise Guide serves as our primary ETL tool, we're on the cusp of a thrilling transition to the Data Virtualization tool Denodo, which you'll actively engage with. Tableau is our main Data Visualization tool, and we encourage you to explore the world of Power BI and other data visualization tools. Your journey involves not just dashboard building but also maintaining and optimizing our existing suite of reports and dashboards, taking them to new heights of functionality and user-friendliness. Agile Framework: The CRD operates on Agile Methodologies, and your understanding of Jira will be a valuable asset for managing your workload efficiently. Collaboration, adaptability, and staying ahead of the curve are essential traits in this dynamic environment. Skill Development One of the most exciting aspects of this role is the immense scope for skill development. If you're passionate about a career in data and innovation, this is the perfect opportunity. You'll be at the forefront of making enhancements, pioneering innovative processes, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the realm of business intelligence. Every day offers a chance to learn and grow, and you'll be encouraged to drive innovation as a key driver of success in this role. What are we looking for in the ideal candidate? Familiarity with coding SAS and SQL: You're well-acquainted with the languages of data and can put them to work effectively. Understanding of ETL processes, Data Warehousing, and Data Lineage: You're not just a data collector; you're a data architect who knows where it comes from and where it's going. Experience with Tableau or other Data Visualisation tools: Creating visual stories from data is your forte. Building relationships with stakeholders: You're not just a data expert; you're a people person who knows how to translate data into actionable insights for teams. Proficiency in gathering requirements and seeing projects through to completion: You're adept at understanding and executing project requirements, ensuring successful outcomes. Understanding of Agile Methodologies, AI, and Cloud Technologies: You're forward-thinking, embracing new technologies and methodologies to drive innovation. If you're ready to join a dynamic team, work with cutting-edge technologies, and take your career in data to new heights, apply today. Your adventure in data-driven excellence starts here! Who are we? Capricorn is a member-based financial services organisation which exists to improve the lives of over 25,000 Members across Australia and New Zealand by supporting them in building stronger automotive businesses. We provide products and services including trade credit, risk protection, equipment finance, trade events, travel services, fuel cards and more. Last financial year Member purchases exceeded $2.93 billion and Member returns exceeded $72.5 million. The next steps If you think you are the right person for this role and you believe in a Member first culture, then please apply now. Applications will be reviewed as they arrive, so it is better to apply sooner rather than later. If you need any assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact HR at 1800 327 437. For further information and detail on Capricorn, please visit our website at www.capricorn.coop/careers (http://www.capricorn.coop/careers).Show moreReport

job_title: Data Analytics Engineer - Python, JavaScript, ML, Docker
job_description: Data Analytics Engineer - Python, JavaScript, ML, Docker You are a curious and enthusiastic individual with a true passion for data and engineering We are a committed team responsible for delivering automation solutions for Business Bank Risk Together we can build state-of-the-art data solutions that enable effective risk management and strong outcomes for the Group Do work that matters: Here, you’ll turn your passion into reality. You will be part of a small engineering team and work with a diverse range of modern technologies to address business challenges and improve efficiency. You will use your expertise in Data Analytics, Data Engineering and CI/CD to build and manage automation, data integration and application development that supports business decision-making. See yourself in our team: Business Banking Risk is responsible for approval and oversight of risk frameworks and processes. You will support the team by seeking opportunities, understanding business challenges, improving and designing automation solutions(including AI solutions), to overcome the key challenges. To us, data is everything. It is what powers our cutting-edge features and it is the reason we can provide seamless experiences for millions of customers from app to branch. We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half your time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few. Talk to us about how these arrangements might work for you. We are seeking people who are: Passionate to execute state-of-the-art coding practices, driving high quality outcomes to solve core business objectives and minimise risk Challenge-seekers that constantly think outside the box and break boundaries to solve complex data-centric problems Curious-learners that stay ahead of latest technologies and industry trends to improve their existing skills and adapt to emerging tools Naturally talented communicators that can collaborate with cross-functional teams in creating a positive impact Analytical- thinkers that operate with an Agility mindset to identify business challenges and propose strategic solutions Adept with understanding of business processes, managing multiple projects and key priorities to achieve business goals Tech skills We use a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks. We don’t expect you to know them all but having significant experience and exposure with some of these (or equivalents) will set you up for success in this team. Python, JavaScript, HTML, Machine / Deep Learning / Natural Language Processing. Software development frameworks and tools (e.g. Git, Jenkins, Docker, Unix Shell). Knowledge of database management systems (e.g., SQL, Spark, Hive), data analysis tools (R, Python) and data integration techniques. Knowledge of UX principles and best practices for creating user-friendly applications. Working with us: Whether you’re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career with CommBank is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with flexible work locations. One where we’re driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day. Here, you will thrive. You will be supported when faced with challenges and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We’re hiring engineers from across all of Australia and have opened technology hubs in Melbourne and Perth. We really love working here, and we think you will too. **Apply Now to live your best life, by doing your best work with us! ** If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest, x15ventures), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. Job Title Technical Business Analyst Purpose of the Role Think of an e-ticket as a contract across all the stages of your trip: from Ticket creation through boarding and flying... If you change plans, face difficult climatic conditions (or get kicked off the plane ...), refunds or exchanges can also be performed. Behind the scene, the control of your ticket is circulating between different airlines systems and financial transactions are taking place. Amadeus airline customers have a complex system to orchestrate all these transactions: the Amadeus Ticketing Server! Joining Amadeus, you will be working on this mission-critical system, designing innovative solutions for our airline customers. We are a dynamic team mixing Business Analysts, Software Engineers and DevOps and collaborating with an Agile mindset. You will be part of a truly multicultural group and interact with colleagues all around the globe. You will contribute to the platform evolution and stability thanks to your testing and validation skills. You will also have the opportunity to create and develop new features for our customers and help them face the industry challenges such as Cloud-based services and data privacy and security. Main Responsibilities:Product Expertise Participate in building a vision for the product Anticipate future needs and identify risks and opportunities Build and maintain end to end knowledge of our products and their usage Build a relationship with the different stakeholders, including the Ticketing teams in Bangalore and Nice. Take part in feasibility studies and sizing exercisesProduct increment Clarify requirements with customers and the team Build/influence solutions, balancing quality/value and our constraints. Negotiate scope/dates with stakeholders, including customers Interface with relevant departments to identify interactions with other Amadeus packages and ensure functional compatibility. Write/review specifications and APIs Validate deliveriesProject support Provide support on our features (to other teams, PMs, customer, implementation) Analyze issues on existing product reported by customers Relevant Work Experience: Minimum 3 - 5 Years experience in Software Development Life Cycles (SDLC) and Agile Methodology as Business Analyst. Experience working with a customer. Autonomy and proactivity Travel business knowledge is preferred. Diversity & Inclusion We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and seek to hire the best candidate regardless of age, beliefs, disability, ethnicity, gender or sexual orientation.Show moreReport

job_title: Solutions Analyst - AI, Automation and Analytics
job_description: lluka Resources is a leading global producer of the critical minerals zircon and high grade titanium dioxide feedstocks (rutile and synthetic rutile). Iluka has also established a significant position in rare earth elements (rare earths). As an international supplier of critical minerals, Iluka’s products are used in an array of applications including technology, construction, medical, lifestyle and industrial uses. As the world moves towards a smarter, safer and sustainable future, Iluka’s high quality products are increasing in demand. Our people are the foundation of our business and are vital to our success now and into the future. Iluka offers an empowering and inclusive work environment that is as diverse as the communities in which we operate. About The Role Are you passionate about applying artificial intelligence, automation, and analytics to solve problems? Do you want to work for a global critical minerals company that values sustainability and innovation? Our team has a diverse range of technical skills and collaborate with various teams across Iluka to deliver process automations, analytics and explore the power of AI. Our team leverages SQL, Power Platform, Azure AI and Data Services, a leading RPA platform, and other modern technologies. The work we deliver is leveraged everyday across Iluka. We are looking for a Solutions Analyst (AI, Automation and Analytics) to join our team. This is a full time, permanent position based at our Perth office. You will play a key role in the design, delivery and support of business process automation and data solutions working directly with colleagues across operations and functional teams. Reporting to the Automation and Analytics Lead, you will have the opportunity to work with the latest technologies in a dynamic environment across a diverse range of initiatives. Key elements of the role include: Delivering high quality automation and analytics solutions across Iluka business units while implementing AI components wherever opportunities arise Accountability of end-to-end solution development with support from the wider team Contributing to a culture of continuous improvement in our automation and analytics platforms, processes and solutions Working collaboratively with both IT and non-IT colleagues to deliver quality, value-adding solutions Sharing your knowledge and technical expertise through cross-skilling, collaboration and mentoring About You To be successful for this role, you will have: A Broad range of both technical and non-technical business analyst skillsets Solid background in automating manual transaction and reporting processes Strong communication and interpersonal skills Effective time management and task prioritisation skills Excellent problem-solving skills Demonstrable skills across a range of Microsoft-centric tools and technologies Some programming experience Sound working knowledge of existing, new and emerging data analytics trends Desired skills and experience: These skills are desired, but you don’t need all of them to apply. Highlight the skills you have from this list (and if you bring other technical skills too). Our approach is to leverage and nurture the skills you bring, and help you develop other skills as part of the team. SQL | API integration | Azure Data Factory | Azure Synapse | Azure AI Services Power Platform (Power BI and DAX, Power Query, Power Apps, Power Automate, Dataverse) RPA (Robotic Process Automation) | Regular Expressions (RegEx) Excel, Pivot Tables and VBA (Visual Basic for Applications) Our Offer To You Flexible working arrangements, hybrid working and flexi hours Be supported through an inclusive and collaborative culture 18 Weeks Paid Parental Leave for Primary Caregivers Ability to Purchase Additional Annual Leave Competitive Salary and Bonus Structures Company share matching scheme Access to a state-of-the-art Gym in our Perth building, free of charge! You will be supported, empowered, included and encouraged to be the best version of yourself. If you share our values of Integrity, Respect, Courage, Accountability and Collaboration; and you have the skills and experience to help us to succeed and deliver sustainable value, apply now. Full working rights in Australia are required for you to be eligible to apply for this role. Applications Close: 20 November 2023 “We respect and encourage diversity in a workforce that reflects our communities.”Show moreReport

job_title: Senior Pricing Insights and Data Analyst
job_description: A career with Viva Energy is more than just a job. It’s an opportunity to be part of something bigger. To support the world's evolving energy needs by producing and supplying energy products that keep Australian's moving today as we help to build a sustainable future for tomorrow.  Will you be part of the energy solution?  About the role: A senior role in our Retail Pricing Team you will be responsible for providing actionable insights and reporting. The role aims to improve the way we use data, analytics and insights to make better, more informed strategic business decisions and deliver capabilities of analytics, reporting and insights. This position will suit someone who is customer-obsessed, thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic environment where no day is ever the same, and is passionate about driving commercial outcomes and incremental value to the business through a strong data-driven and analytical approach.  The ideal candidate will demonstrate a sense of urgency whilst maintaining high levels of accuracy; is highly skilled at using data and appropriate metrics to validate ROI and KPI measures; is able to exhibit a willingness to learn, grow, and contribute to the overall success of the team; can demonstrate high levels of technical competency, and has a high level of commercial acumen. The Senior Data and Insights analyst will be a champion of data, reporting and insights for the Mobility Fuels Pricing Team and will be responsible for leading collaboration across the Fuel Pricing Analysts and broader Convenience and Mobility analyst groups to seek out and proactively develop new and disruptive fuel pricing strategies to build profitable market share  The Senior Pricing Insights and Data Analyst will have the following accountabilities; Providing deep insights and analysis to the Retail Pricing Team and wider business Extract business requirements and to ensure reports / dashboards are relevant, user-friendly and effective for business needs Analyse data, interpret trends/patterns and synthesise them into business insights to inform decision-making Develop, create dashboard reporting in Power BI Provide insights and analysis on network, site level and product, competitors, margin and volume Construct comprehensive forecast models Be a trusted and valued partner in the planning, execution and review process to ensure the desired outcomes for the business are delivered Routine and ad-hoc reporting and analysis Work cross functional to ensure the appropriate capture, storage, accessibility, and availability of relevant data in order to report and deliver insights Build trust in the data, reporting, and dashboards by contributing to quality improvements, data integrity, and the provision of clean and accurate data Support implementation of new systems, process improvement to drive better informed strategic decisions, enabling the sharing of data and developing actionable insights with the wider Consumer business Please keep reading…. Join us and let’s make a bigger difference together.  It’s an exciting time to be joining Australian Unity – we have grown significantly over recent years and are transforming to capitalise on further growth opportunities to help our customers and employees thrive. We operate with commercial principles and with a strong social purpose to create community value. Australian Unity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  Established in 1840, we’re Australia’s first member-owned wellbeing company. Today we have over $1 billion in revenue and provide smart solutions and services to more than 700,000 Australians. We employ over 7000 people and our purpose is to Help People to Thrive.  Your New Role:  The Senior Data Test Analyst is responsible for conducting data quality testing, with a focus on testing data lakes, data warehouse, MDM, ETL logic and transformations. The analyst should have a deep understanding of QA principles and the SDLC, as well as extensive experience with developing complex SQL queries, end-to-end data flow validations and data analysis. Additionally, the analyst is responsible for managing the definition, implementation and integration of quality principles and processes throughout the delivery cycle and providing planning and visibility of QA to project stakeholders.  Your New Role Looks Like This:  Delivers testing solutions that are comprehensive, taking into account risk and business priority, ensuring that systems are delivered fit-for-purpose. Delivers data validation and reconciliation testing to satisfy business and data quality requirements. Create fit-for-purpose test strategy for ETL tasks and other related applications which communicate with ETL tools and technologies. Implement test plans, test cases, processes and standards. Design test cases, test scripts and test data to support the requirements with a goal of automating the testing.  About You:  Ability to take ownership of data quality testing and ensure delivery is within timeframes. Extensive experience with developing test scenarios using requirements docs and ETL mappings & executing tests using SQL. Must have experience working in Master Data Management platform. Experience working in python and pyspark Working knowledge of SDLC, Test Development Lifecycle and Agile Development Regular attendance and involvement in the QA industry, to keep abreast of the latest technologies, methodologies, challenges, and issues facing QA and testing. Full understanding of Agile test methodologies and a proven track record of producing high quality test material from a variety of requirement mediums Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and a passion for working in highly collaborative environments.  Your Benefits:  You will enjoy a range of great employee benefits and rewards including: Competitive Remuneration and Incentive Program A range of attractive product and service discounts from Australian Unity’s Retail and Wealth Management portfolio – including health insurance and banking products Supported Learning and Career Development program Flexible Working Arrangements including Work-From-Home days with a real work-life balance Available access to LinkedIn Learning courses through our great Learning platform Additional paid Wellbeing and Community Volunteer Days yearly  What Makes Us, Us  Putting people first is not just something we say, it's what we do. We care for our people so they can care for themselves and our customers. We stay true to our values (Bold, Warm, Honest), we work hard because it matters and we work well together – collaborating, encouraging and even managing to have some fun.  At Australian Unity we do the right thing and we expect the same from others. Being a member-owned company, means we're focused on our members and customers, not shareholder returns. Our purpose to Help People to Thrive, drives us to make a real difference, every day, big and small. We are passionate about improving the wellbeing of all Australians and about making a positive difference.  Australian Unity is an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from all members of the community, including people of Aboriginal and Torres strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and, mature aged people.Show moreReport

Overview:  Work for a global company with some of the world’s most trusted and iconic brands. Be part of an exciting business where employees are recognised and career growth is nurtured. PepsiCo Australia & New Zealand is home to some of the world’s most trusted brands such as Smith's Chips, Red Rock Deli, Sakata Rice Crackers, Pepsi Max and Gatorade! We are a progressive and people-focused business, and believe our diverse workforce is the key to our success. Because we value our employees and their families, we offer an agile and flexible working environment with an emphasis on work life balance and health, as well as plenty of learning opportunities and room to grow your career. We currently have an exciting opportunity to join our ANZ Team as a Consumer Insights Analyst. The key to success in this role is your ability to Support the Senior Consumer Insights Manager and the Insights Leadership team in driving business growth and portfolio planning based on strong Consumer and marketplace Insights by building and executing solid Insights and Analytics solutions. Leverage data and consumer- based diagnostics to drive and guide Business Decisions.  Responsibilities:  About the Role: Support the Consumer Insights Leadership team to interpret and synthesise data from multiple sources (consumer behaviour, market trends, competitive landscapes etc) and crafting compelling narratives that translate data into clear, concise, and impactful insights. Support the Consumer Insights Leadership to foster a culture of curiosity by embracing an exploratory mindset that goes beyond data, fostering an outside-in creative thinking and consistently seeking innovative angles to approach consumer insights, emerging trends, market opportunities and competitive shifts. Support Consumer Insights Leadership by helping to execute the brand/portfolio Learning Plans (study by study execution and supporting the Marketing brand teams in bringing insights to life) Support the execution of Insights projects focused on Brand Building, Innovation, Market place Insights in close partnership with research and creative agencies. Support Insights Leadership in building the right Insights solutions to answer Business needs and identifying key research/insights questions and objectives by collaborating closely with key stakeholders and cross-functional teams Manages key continuous data agencies to ensure timely delivery and quality of information. About you: Ability to draw sharp insights triangulating data from multiple sources and create compelling stories translating data into clear, concise, and impactful insights. Strong and demonstratable analytical skills with the ability to dive deep into data, spot trends, and identify and distil insights. Strong and compelling storytelling and communication skills; with the ability to share learnings and conveying insights in a swift, persuasive and impactful manner. Out-of-the-box, critical and exploratory thinker with a creative mindset and problem-solving attitude. Desire to learn how to look at big data (Quantitative) and thick data (Qualitative) together to draw meaningful Insights. High level collaboration and communication skills. Thrive in a multitasking environment with strong project management skills, capable of juggling multiple projects within tight timelines in an FMCG industry environment. Flexibility and adaptability to quickly pivot on priorities and tasks as required. Flexibility and creativity to adapt research strategies based on market shifts and emerging trends. Bachelor’s degree or MBA with up to 5 years’ experience in Consumer Insights, Strategic Research, and/or Marketing experience. Recent graduates with degrees in Social Sciences, Research or Psychology will also be considered. For you: We offer a competitive benefits package Access generous leave options (e.g. wellness, birthday, volunteer, purchase additional leave/cash out leave) We understand that bringing the best version of yourself to work means looking after yourself holistically. Our Health & Wellness programs support you with all dimensions of wellness Access learning programs for your professional development, as well as our global offerings and online courses. About us: We are a progressive and people-focused business and believe our diverse workforce is the key to our success. Because we value our employees and their families, we offer an agile and flexible working environment with an emphasis on work life balance and health, as well as plenty of learning opportunities and room to grow your career. Recognised as a Top Employer in both Australia and New Zealand in 2021 and 2022, one of only 16 organisations globally to earn this certification. Recognised as an WGEA Employer of Choice for gender equality for the past 12 years and is one of the leading organisations in this space. Gender Tick (NZ) Family Friendly Certification (AU) Pep+ (PepsiCo Positive) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. It is our roadmap for becoming the global leader in convenient foods and beverages and a leading actor in the transformation of the global food system. With a large portfolio of food and beverage brands, PepsiCo Australia & New Zealand employs more than 1,600 people across ANZ at Smiths Snack Food Company, Bluebird Foods NZ and PepsiCo Beverages. Acknowledgement of Country  CSIRO acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the land, sea and waters, of the area that we live and work on across Australia. We acknowledge their continuing connection to their culture and pay our respects to their Elders past and present. View our vision towards reconciliation  Child Safety  CSIRO is committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people involved in our activities and programs. View our Child Safe Policy.  The Opportunity  Part Time role (four days a week) available within Data61. CSIRO’s Data61 is the digital technologies and data science arm of Australia’s national science agency. With around 400 staff and another 300 affiliate staff, Data61 represents one of the largest collections of R&D expertise in artificial intelligence, data science, cybersecurity, robotics, and software engineering in the world. With a focus on impact-driven science and technology, Data61 works across disciplines and industry sectors to solve some of the world’s greatest challenges through digital R&D. The Business Analyst (BA) position is a mid-level position that will support the Science Support Manager and team in make data informed decisions about our program portfolio and business operations. The BA will be an integral part of the team in deciding key metrics and performance indicators across programs, designing processes to collect those metrics efficiently and visualise and report on them to internal and external stakeholders. The BA will also play a key role in designing solutions to integrate data across different systems to ensure programs can be run smoothly and with a high level of automation. This role will be given agency and autonomy to think critically and creatively about best ways to collect and visualise programs and students data and metrics, as well as provide feedback on best practices to be implemented by the team. The Science Support team is a high performing, value driven team of 12 individuals that work with a high level of autonomy across Australia. The team is output driven and enjoys flexibility and autonomy when it comes to working arrangements. The team has set a collaborative and trust based culture where team members support each other and seek help and support when needed. Your duties will include: To ensure the Next Generation Graduates Program (NGGP) and the Student Programs Teams can be supported in the areas of student management, ongoing internal and external reporting and finance and budgeting, a Business Analyst is required.  The role, reporting to Science Support Officer, will carry on the following duties: Analysis and auditing on existing documentation, reports, templates and tools Building a digital solution to provide up to date reporting on key metrics for Science Programs and Next Generation Graduate Programs Support the team with the internal and external reporting, data visualization and insights on project key metrics. Build a digital solution to support the teams with a Student Management System that integrates with current systems and tools.  Location: Any location where D61 has a presence, fully remote location considered. Salary: AU$104k - AU$109k per annum (pro-rata for part-time) plus up to 15.4% superannuation Tenure: Specified term of until May 2025 Reference: 94910  To be considered you will need: Essential Under CSIRO policy only those who meet all essential criteria can be appointed. A relevant qualification (e.g., degree, postgraduate degree) or successful relevant experience in data management, data analytics and/or data visualization Advance level of expertise with data analytics tools and software such as excel, PBI, Tableau, SAP Data Analytics etc. Strong communication skills appropriate for a diverse cohort; the ability to clearly convey information and ideas in written and verbal form; and proactively establish and maintain effective interpersonal relationships with internal and external stakeholders Proven ability to investigate complex problems by utilising sound judgement to identify and consider potential implications of a range of available alternative solutions Demonstrated ability to deal with ambiguity and adapt to changing circumstances and new responsibilities. Ability to quickly adapt to technological, structural, and procedural changes whilst maintaining professionalism and flexibility. Desirable Ability to work independently and autonomously while raising issues and asking for support timely Knowledge of CSIRO systems and processes is desired  Eligibility  Applications for this position are open to Australian/New Zealand Citizens, Australian Permanent Residents or you must either hold, or be able to obtain, a valid working visa for the duration of the specified term. Appointment to this role is subject to provision of a national police check and may be subject to other security/medical/character requirements.  Flexible Working Arrangements  We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work.  Diversity and Inclusion  We are working hard to recruit people representing the diversity across our society, and ensure that all our people feel supported to do their best work and feel empowered to let their ideas flourish.  About CSIRO  At CSIRO Australia's national science agency, we solve the greatest challenges through innovative science and technology. We put the safety and wellbeing of our people above all else and earn trust everywhere because we only deal in facts. We collaborate widely and generously and deliver solutions with real impact.  CSIRO is committed to values-based leadership to inspire performance and unlock the potential of our people.  CSIRO is committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people involved in our activities and programs, whether we are undertaking research, engaging with the public or nurturing future scientists in person or online. Source – CSIRO Child Safe policy 2023  Join us and start creating tomorrow today!  How to Apply  Please apply on-line and provide a cover letter and CV that best demonstrate your motivation and ability to meet the requirements of this role. Working with a leading National Utilities Provider Remote working Attractive daily rate A leading National Utilities Provider is seeking a Business Analyst for an 8 month contract, until the end of June 2024 to provide support in migrating on-premise applications to the cloud. This is a fully remote role besides a visit to the office every 3-4 months.  Role Description:  The project is moving and migrating on-premises applications and platforms to new data centres. Company Name: Rokt  Job Description  About Rokt Rokt is the global leader in eCommerce technology, helping companies seize the full potential of every transaction moment to grow revenue and acquire new customers at scale. Live Nation, AMC Theatres, PayPal, Uber, Hulu, Staples, Lands’ End, and HelloFresh are among the more than 2,500 leading global businesses and advertisers that use Rokt's solutions to drive more value through every transaction by offering highly relevant messages to their customers at the moment they are most likely to convert. With our December 2022 secondary transaction, Rokt’s valuation increased to $2.4 Billion. We are expanding rapidly and globally – operating in 14 countries across North America, Europe and the Asia-Pacific region with the largest office in Sydney and a major R&D hub in NYC. With 50% annual growth and vibrant company culture, Rokt has been listed in ‘Great Places to Work’ in the US and Australia. Our award-winning culture is guided by our eight core values: smart with humility, own the outcomes, force for good, conquer new frontiers, enjoy the ride, raise the bar, communicate with impact, and disagree then commit. These values help us attract, engage, and develop the right talent around the globe and ensure we foster an environment that helps us all do our best work. Keen to join a fast-growing company and a vibrant culture? Learn more at rokt.com.  About the role Rokt is hiring a Senior Data Analyst to join our Product Development team in Sydney. We are a data-driven company, and data is at the heart of all of our decision-making. We are looking for someone who will help the business innovate and grow through comprehensive and actionable data-driven insights. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a key role in helping our Rokt Ecommerce and Relevancy/ML teams enhance the value they create for our partners and advertisers through deep-dive analyses, providing recommendations on improving products and features, building models and data products that can be actioned on by various teams, and influencing teams with your analyses, models and recommendations. You will be expected to leverage your business acumen, analytical skill, product sense, and communication to drive a variety of impactful initiatives across Product teams that you are embedded into. You will also be expected to own and develop new metrics, and measurement frameworks, track performance, define success for various features and investigate changes in their KPIs. An ideal candidate will develop data products that scale, produce accurate and statistically robust analyses, and communicate in a way that makes analyses and models easy to interpret by Product, Engineering, and GTM teams. Requirements Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics or an equivalent quantitative field 4+ years of experience in Analytics or Data Science Deep SQL skills and proficiency in working with big data and ETL management Autonomous, detail-oriented, and comfortable with breaking down ambiguous problems into quantitative solutions Passion for extracting actionable insights that move the business forward Good business acumen and communication skills (written and verbal). Proficient in being able to distil complex findings and analyses into simple outputs. Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau Strong stakeholder management experience Team player who positively contributes to the culture of the Analytics team and Rokt Preferred Qualifications Master’s degree or higher in Statistics, Analytics, Data Science, or an equivalent quantitative field 5+ years of experience in Product Analytics 2+ years of experience analyzing ecommerce data Familiar with data mining and data engineering Python/R experience strongly preferred Experience communicating results and business impact of analytical deep dives to senior leadership Experience with statistical analyses and familiarity with basic machine learning Responsibilities Partner with Product and Engineering teams through analyses, reporting, modelling, and generate valuable insights to aid in decision making Conduct quantitative analyses on partner, advertiser, and customer behaviour to help Product Managers and Engineering refine their product strategy Provide product managers and engineering teams with recommendations that help them achieve business outcomes through by unearthing actionable insights across our product suite Create and maintain dashboards and reports to baseline and monitor Product usage and company-wide metrics Define measurement frameworks and analyze key metrics and to inform decision-making and measure success Offer thought partnership to stakeholders by deconstructing problem statements into quantitative hypotheses and proposing associated analyses Collaborate with the product team to set SMART goals for the organization and implement methods to track progress (i.e., supporting measurement of OKRs) Understand the drivers that impact our north star metric, and propose A/B testing roadmaps to influence various Product teams Benefits Work with the greatest talent in town. Our recruitment process is tough but diligent. We’re constantly aiming to implement our value of “raise the bar” and setting high standards for our Rokt’stars. This is essential in our high-performing, high-grow culture where we strive to bring in the brightest and best talent. Our teams thrive by challenging the status quo and we encourage all of our teams to unleash their desire to achieve something bigger. Join a community. At Rokt we’re a community of curious explorers. We’re not afraid of venturing into uncharted territories. We work together as one single, aligned team. We value diversity and transparency which is why we support a number of internal employee resource groups including an EDI steering committee, Rainbow Rokt which empowers our LGBTQIA+ Rokt’stars, Womxn who Rokt promotes gender equality in tech, and more. Accelerate your career. We want you to unleash your full potential. This is why we have an annual ‘Level Up’ allowance of $5,000 that gives Rokt’stars the ability to take courses, attend events, go to training, and more to help our great employees become even better leaders. Take a break. When you work hard, we know you also need to rest. We offer generous time off and parental leave policies, as well as mental health and wellness days for all employees. We even incentivise individuals to utilise their PTO with “High 5” days, an additional 5 days of PTO when you’ve used 75% of your allotted annual paid leave. We also offer a paid Rokt’star Sabbatical for employees who have been with us for 5 years or more. Stay happy and healthy. Enjoy catered lunch every day and healthy snacks in the office. Plus join the gym on us! Rokt offers a monthly allowance to use on a gym membership or online fitness classes. We also provide all Rokt'stars access to free 1:1 coaching, therapy and digital mental wellness resources. Become a shareholder. All Rokt’stars have stock options. If we succeed, everyone is rewarded. See the world! We want our Rokt’stars to enjoy the ride. As we aim to bring meaning and fun to our everyday work, we host global all-staff events in amazing locations (Phuket, Thailand in January 2020, Hawaii in May 2022, and Whistler in 2023). As we strive to build a community of curious explorers, we also offer generous relocation packages for those interested in moving to another Rokt office. We have bustling offices in great cities including New York, Sydney, London, Singapore, and Tokyo. We believe we’re better together. We love spending time together and are in the office most days (most teams are in the office 3-4 days per week). We also get that you need to balance your life and your commitments so you have the flexibility to manage your own hours and can spend up to a week of every quarter working from anywhere. We believe in equality. Rokt is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we know our collective strength comes from how different we all are. We encourage you to apply for one of our open roles—irrespective of socio-economic status or background, age, gender identity, race, religion, sexual orientation, colour, pregnancy, carer/family responsibilities, national and social origin, political opinion, marital, veteran, or disability status.  Salary Range - $142,500 to $165,000 AUD per year plus equity #LI-HybridShow moreReport

Specialization: Supply Chain/ Procurement Location: Eastwood, SA, AU, 5063 Date Posted: 20 Oct 2023 Job Summary  Are you ready to drive change and innovation in the world of logistics and customer service? Bridgestone Australia is seeking a dynamic and analytical Supply Chain Business Analyst to join our Supply Chain team in Eastwood, South Australia. If you have a passion for data-driven decision-making, cost management, and continuous improvement, this is the role for you!  Responsibilities  As a Supply Chain Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in optimising Bridgestone Australia’s logistics and customer service strategy. You'll work closely with cross-functional teams, analysing warehouse and transport metrics and operational and service performance trends, identifying opportunities for improvement. Your insights will drive strategic decisions, enhance operational efficiency and ensure outstanding customer centric service. You will also support the development of systems to identify continuous improvement opportunities Support and analysis within key metrics will include:  Warehouses: 12 across Australia and New Zealand. Warehouse Team: 100+ employees. Overall budget: $50m+ per annum. SKU’s: 1,500 active Containers: 7,000k per annum. Tyre moves: > 6 million tyre movements (In/Out) per annum. Carriers network supporting logistics: 20+  Assisting in the preparation of budgets, producing timely management reporting and monthly forecasting and supporting business case development for our evolving logistics footprint is critical to this role.  Key Responsibilities Support the preparation of yearly budgets for all transport and warehouse and operational requirements, monitoring and managing costs to maximise cost effectiveness. Seek initiatives and new trends within warehouse transport arrangements to meet the needs of our business and customer service alignment. Support business and strategic projects, reviews and development. Assist in implementation of transport, operational and system changes. Oversee KPI metrics and reporting for all stakeholders. Manage inbound supply to state warehouses. Use a documented risk management process to eliminate or minimise HSE risks where appropriate. Skills Tertiary qualifications in logistics preferred. Experience in cost management and strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and time/project management capabilities. Proficiency in Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems (preferably SAP). Confident in using business intelligence tools such as SAP Business Objects, Tableau, Power BI. Proficient in PC-based tools, especially Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. Proven team player with enthusiasm, commitment, and flexibility. About Us  A renowned global leader in tyres and rubber, Bridgestone is striving towards a vision to provide both social value and customer value as a sustainable solutions company. With sustainability at the core of our business and guided by the values of our Bridgestone E8 Commitment, Bridgestone offers a diverse product portfolio of premium tyres and advanced solutions backed by innovative technologies, improving the way people around the world move, live, work and play.  Bridgestone offers a range of services and solutions to all segments of the Australian and New Zealand markets. Our extensive range of quality tyres is complemented by the provision of mechanical and fleet services through the company’s nationwide retail network of Bridgestone Select and Bridgestone Service Centres, mobile service provider Lube Mobile, and the manufacturing and sale of quality retreads through Bandag Pty Limited.  If you're ready to make a significant impact on Bridgestone's logistics and customer service operations, apply today and be part of a dynamic team that values innovation and continuous improvement. Join Bridgestone and drive your career forward!Show moreReport

Join our Global Market Risk team based in Sydney who play a key role in building and maintaining models covering all asset classes across the group.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  As a Quantitative Market Risk Analyst/Associate, you will be responsible for building and maintaining Market Risk models including but not limited to, Value at Risk (VaR) models for Traded Market Risk (such as regulatory VaR used for capital under APS 116, and the Fundamental Review of the Trading Book) and Non-Traded Market Risk (e.g. Interest Rate Risk in the Banking Book). You will engage with various stakeholders, build out new models, and enhance existing models to meet the dynamic requirements of Market Risk.  What you offer  Proficient programming skills and ability to traverse various programming languages (such as Python, R, and C++) Strong understanding of fundamental quantitative/computational finance principles and techniques and excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to communicate effectively with key stakeholders, both verbally and in writing Tertiary qualification in finance, mathematics, statistics, engineering or a related quantitative discipline Ability to balance being immersed in detailed day-to-day activities whilst managing longer term activities and objectives Keen interest in financial markets.  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing  About the Risk Management Group  In our Risk Management Group, you will be part of an independent, and centralised function, responsible for independent and objective review and challenge, oversight, monitoring and reporting in relation to Macquarie’s material risks. Our divisions include behavioural risk, compliance, credit, financial crime risk, internal audit, market risk, operational risk and governance, prudential risk, and Risk Management Group central.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.  If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.
