Are you a Technical Business Analyst that wants to work in a fun and fast-paced environment? Do you enjoy new challenges? And want a business that will support your career growth?  Well, if you said yes to all three questions, then this Technical Business Analyst role may be for you!  Your role with us:  As our Technical Business Analyst, you will be joining our Twist Gaming team, which is our in-house gaming studio specialising in creating online slot games.  Within Twist Gaming, there is the Twist RGS (Remote Gaming Server) division, this is the team you will be joining! Twist RGS is a backend service which links third party providers (such as Twist Gaming) and customers together, they're the middleman if you'd like to call it that!  You will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between our technical team and business stakeholders. You'll be responsible writing JIRA tickets, managing stakeholders, and scoping new business features. You are someone who enjoys writing JIRA tickets, has great stakeholder management and can help facilitate scoping business needs from a technological standpoint.  We are looking for somebody who will join as a Business Analyst and then later transition into a Product Owner to help facilitate delivery and strategy. We would like to support your learning of the business, before we help facilitate your Product Owner transition.  You will have plenty of support by the whole Twist Gaming team (including RGS) and report directly to the Technical Lead.   Who are we?  At Easygo we proudly stand as a prominent service provider to a powerhouse of brands within the iGaming industry, including Stake.com, Kick.com and Twist Gaming. Level up your online entertainment with Kick.com, the vibrant live streaming platform, which connects millions of gamers and content creators worldwide. All alongside the innovative game design studio, Twist Gaming, which takes creativity to new heights by crafting cutting-edge and captivating online slot games.  Our commitment to placing our clients and their communities' entertainment at the forefront of everything we do, has solidified us as the ultimate online service provider for entertainment companies. Headquartered in the beautiful city of Melbourne, our growth has been remarkable. From humble beginnings to a thriving workforce of 270+, we've expanded not only in numbers but in ambition.  There really is something for everyone here, whether you work in Tech, Marketing, Operations, Mathematics or Design, we are sure to have something for everyone.  Click play, on your career today!  What you will do: Performing analyses on features and functionality across both our RGS offering as well as competitors to identify areas of improvements. Determining system efficiency and functionality by liaising with stakeholders, internal departments and end-users. Build detailed business feature requirements to support technical scope development. Ensuring end-user proficiency with new features, integrations, fixes and updates across products. Building out procedures and processes to help transition to a more data driven decision-making framework. Analyse and model data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. Working alongside Tech Lead to develop and prioritise a roadmap with short and long term solutions and goals.  What you will bring:  Proven 4+ year's experience being a Technical Business Analyst Proficiency in technical documentation, including architectural diagrams and API specifications. Strong knowledge of software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, DevOps) and project management tools Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques. Strong understanding of business processes, requirements gathering, and documentation. Excellent communication, organisational and collaboration skills.  Bonus points if you also have:  Bachelor's degree in Business Analysis, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Previous experience working in Gaming industries, with Slot Gaming being highly advantageous  Some of the perks of working for us:  EAP access for you and your family A full-time barista who will make you coffee, tea and fresh juices Daily catered breakfast Massage Wednesdays - we get professionals to do this! The EL1 Data Analyst (Labour Hire) is responsible for actively managing key internal and external stakeholder relationships and may be required to represent and negotiate on behalf of the NDIA to advance the NDIA’s interests across a range of forums. job_title: Senior AML Systems and Data Analyst
job_description: About the Role An opportunity has become available within BOQ Group’s Financial Crime Operations (FCO) business unit, as a Senior AML Systems and Data Analyst!  This role will see the successful candidate supporting BOQ's risk based Financial Crime detection systems including the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing (AML/CTF) Transaction Monitoring Programs, Entity and Payment Screening configuration, and AUSTRAC regulatory reporting.  You will provide financial crime data and analytics insights and deliverables to assist in identification, management and mitigation of financial crime risk in coordination with the broader FCO team and the Financial Crime Risk Strategy.  Support the development, implementation, maintenance and enhancement of Financial Crime Risk detection systems and data environment. Provide application support for the Financial Crime detection systems. Track, manage and assess issues using data analytics, and supporting issue resolution. Produce data analytics deliverables in relation to Financial Crime Risk, including exploratory data analytics, and end of month Management Information Reporting. Contribute to the development, review and update of process and system documentation. Contribute to the design of technical data mapping from source to target including transformation rules. Contribute to data governance processes and procedures, including business rule definition and documentation. Liaise with both operational and technology functions across the BOQ Group, where required, to complete inquiries. Assist with related Financial Crime Operations and/or other business projects with a Financial Crime Risk impact, as required. Support maintenance of key financial crime analytics controls and control self-assessments. Keep abreast of new technologies in relation to data analytics, emerging ML/TF trends and issues.  About you As the successful candidate for this role, we would like to see 1-3 years' experience working in a similar role! You will also be able to demonstrate the following skills and attributes:  Experience with relevant systems & programming languages (SQL, Power BI, Python, R), strong SQL skills are essential Experience implementing and/or supporting financial crime risk systems for example NetReveal on Demand (NROD) – for transaction monitoring, screening and case management, and/or AUSTRAC regulatory reporting. Including understanding of data feeds, rule sets, platform tuning, customer, account and transaction data types Experience in overseeing and implementing AML/CTF or Sanctions systems and controls such as transaction monitoring and sanctions screening processes Experience working in a digital banking environment Experience in AML and data infrastructure design and development  About Us BOQ is one of Australia’s leading regional banks and provides a genuine alternative for Australian financial services customers and employees. Our purpose is to create prosperity for our customers, shareholders and people through empathy, integrity and by making a difference. Our ambition is to be known as the bold challenger bank; with multi-brands that are digitally enabled with a personal touch.  BOQ is passionate about providing opportunities for you to develop your career as we continuously adapt and deliver in a transformational and collaborative environment with a strong focus on community.  BOQ’s Inclusion vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.  Since 2021 BOQ Group is recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA). Our Benefits  Flexible working arrangements Discounted financial products Salary sacrificing options Paid parental leave with no minimum Paid volunteer days Purchase annual leave Discounted private health insurance plan Employee Assistance Program (EAP) 5 employee diversity network groups focusing on: First Nations Reconciliation Council, Proudly ME (LGBTIQA+), Multicultural, Gender and Early Career BOQ Group is a member of Pride in Diversity and a participating organisation in the Australian Workplace Equality Index  How to Apply To apply for this role please follow the QR code or apply via our Careers Page.  The Bank of Queensland is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.  If you are successful for a role with the Bank of Queensland, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include, but are not limited to: identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, bankruptcy checks.  Please no agency applications.  Job Reference: BOQ02726Show moreReport

Company Description ALDI. Good Different. With roots dating back to 1913, ALDI is proud to make a real difference to people across the world by offering top quality products for low prices. ALDI first entered the Australian grocery market in 2001 and has since grown to have almost 600 stores and 8 distribution centres in 6 states. If you’ve ever shopped at ALDI you know we are not your average supermarket. We’re also not your average employer. ALDI is a place where you’ll find good people, good purpose and a good opportunities. So you can work with a great team, feel great for making a real difference for everyday Australians and have a rewarding career. It’s that simple. ALDI Good Different.  Job Description Exciting opportunities for 2 x Analysts have become available within the National IT department of ALDI stores, based in Minchinbury. These positions are for fixed-term contracts until 30 May 2025. As an Analyst you will be responsible for ongoing monitoring and analysis of new business processes within the AHEAD SAP Centric landscape across all departments. You will present key findings and recommendations to shape the development and delivery of process improvement projects and activities whilst engaging with various stakeholders and experts in a fast-paced retail environment. What does the role look like? Collaborate with stakeholders to scope, develop and implement products and applications to support business processes Support cross-department collaboration to align with process improvement experts from all business areas Architect, design and build robust and scalable solutions Drive optimisation, testing and tooling to improve the quality of SAP Systems Guide internal project teams to optimise technical solutions and outcomes Implement automated measures to ensure data quality issues / errors in applications are automatically prevented / detected and corrected  Qualifications What do we need from you? Demonstrated experience in data mining and database management solutions including design, development and administration Demonstrated experience engineering data pipelines and optimising solutions Experience working with data across sources including Celonis, SAP S/4 Hana and SQL High competency with reporting tools such as Tableau, Power BI or SSRS Project management or coordination experience highly regarded Exposure to business transformation projects highly regarded Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to engage non-technical stakeholders Prior experience in retail or FMCG advantageous Additional Information What’s in it for you? Transparent tiered salary range between - $129,300 - $147,500 including super 5 weeks paid annual leave Fixed-term contract until 30 May 2025 Structured training plan from day 1 Hybrid work options, working up to 2 days per week from home (WFH) Working with a retailer who has been recognised as an Employer of Choice (as voted in 2022, 2021, 2020, 2019 and 2018) Access to wellness programs such as discounted gym memberships, physiotherapy services, employee assistant programs and moreShow moreReport

Job Number: 493386 Work type: Full Time Permanent Location: Sydney (CBD), Melbourne (CBD) Categories: Analysis, Product & Underwriting  Your new company  Guild Insurance is Australia’s leading provider of insurance solutions for allied healthcare professionals. For more than 50 years, we’ve been providing exceptional products and services and unparalleled customer experiences, driven by genuine care for our clients’ professional and financial well-being. We pride ourselves on our future focus and innovation.  At the heart of what we do is being there for those our communities rely on.  Our comprehensive product suite includes professional indemnity, public liability, workers' compensation as well as business, home & contents, and car insurance. We are Australian-owned with offices nationally, so our customers benefit from our local knowledge and presence.  About you  As a Business Analyst, you’re here to help support and coordinate the Product & Underwriting (P&U) team's business needs and collaborate with relevant stakeholders across Guild to design and deliver underwriting system solutions that are fit for purpose. You are driven by operational efficiency and energised by connecting various roles and departments to achieve a shared goal and vision.  You will be leading, facilitating, managing, and administering system-related change support; understanding business initiatives and working with key stakeholders to document & analyse the requirements of the business, customer needs, impacts, and benefits of proposed changes; and pro-actively finding, analysing, and recommending ways the team can improve process efficiency and effectiveness.  With your team, you’re working on a variety of initiatives and projects. You have a desire and interest in project management whilst having a knack for understanding the needs of our customers – internal and external with high attention to detail.  Ideally, you have experience in the insurance/finance industry and previous exposure to project management. You thrive in a collaborative environment, focused on creating the right processes and solutions.  You are a team player and enjoy learning new things. You value a team where opinions are heard and challenged in a collaborative environment.  If you were already in this role or a similar role, here are some of the things you might have done last week:  Define Business Requirements in conjunction with the Portfolio Manager.  Facilitate the workshop to document the reporting needs for a key initiative.  Mapped underwriting business processes, documenting ‘current state’ and ‘future state’.  Gather, analyse, and interpret data to develop P&U business cases that are aligned with projects and Guild’s strategic objectives.  Prepare problem, solution, and data analysis to shape P&U options and recommendations.  Undertake P&U change management activities, including stakeholder analysis, developing communication plans, training requirements, and transition plans.  Effectively escalate unresolved P&U issues for direction and resolution.  Why us?  We pride ourselves on having an inclusive and productive workplace where we treat our people and our clients with fairness, dignity and respect.  We offer:  An extra day of paid leave in addition to your annual leave entitlements.  Parental leave.  Enhanced long-service leave.  Staff discounts with leading retailers.  An Employee Assistance Program that provides counselling and support to all staff members and their immediate families.  Wellbeing initiatives such as health checks and skin checks.  Flexible working program available to eligible staff.  For more information about Guild Insurance visit https://www.guildinsurance.com.au/  Next Steps  If you would like to work in a company that values your effort, will celebrate your success, and encourage you to achieve personal and company success, please apply or reach out to Steph Chara from our Talent Team at schara@guidgroup.com.au to learn more.  You’ll get an email acknowledgement after you’ve applied. We strive to provide a personalised experience for all suitable applicants.  If you are the preferred candidate, we will ask you to complete background checks (including identity verification and police checks). Full time role with a hybrid working model Join a high performing, collaborative and friendly team Located in the heart of Sydney's CBD (Martin Place) The Law Society of NSW is Australia's largest and most influential membership association for solicitors. We're not all lawyers, but we work together to support the legal profession and ensure a just society for all. We are currently looking for a BI Reporting Developer to join our Information Management team. About the role The Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting Developer focuses on understanding business data, analysing data and generating reports and dashboards, performing quality assurance testing to ensure the data presented is correct as well as providing technical support and assistance to the business users where required. The primary responsibility of the role is to support various reporting initiatives. You will analyse, design and implement quality reports and dashboards for the business. As the BI Reporting Developer, you are expected to not only be a capable analyst of raw data, but are able to derive meaning from the data, relate it back to the source and work with the business to derive valuable context required for daily tasks and make decisions. You are a champion for data innovation and can use your creativity to find solutions for teams at every level of their data journey. About the team You will be joining the Information Management Team that help deliver data analysis services to the business. The Information Management Team covers a wide area of data analysis and application code development and key application foundation services. What you'll be doing Data Reporting – Technical Create, update, and upgrade end user reports in Power BI. Create and update T-SQL queries, stored procedures and views using the Law Society code standard to obtain the data required for reports. Where data is not available from a database, extract data from a variety of sources and transform it for use with a Power BI data model. Create and update Power BI data models for use with both single reports and reports using shared datasets. Be competent in DAX and Power M to meet end user requirements. Determine a reporting structure to ensure that increased usability is available for reports shared between departments. Identify potential faults and optimization opportunities within the Reporting suite and other related reports and dashboards. Monitor availability and provide recommendations on performance, capacity, data integrity and quality for the BI reports. Ensure all report access is secured and audited. Highlight any data issues and work with the data architects to continue to develop the data warehouse as a source of truth in the business. Design aesthetically pleasing and functional reports that meet the LSNSW branding guidelines/ templates but where required able to use the guidelines to make appropriate design choices. Data Reporting – Non-Technical Develop/document high quality and well-written user guides, business rules, processes, data flows and other documentation for use by the Information Management team and business users. Provide feedback to the Information Management Data Architect on data requirements (historical snapshots, data requirements) for integration later. Involved in Project Team as a SME and key member on determining reporting needs and providing data requirements at the start of a project. Promote the Reporting function for operational as well as strategic needs. Develop and maintain reporting standards, policies and guidelines and ensure they applied to all reports developed. With the team develop policies and procedures for the collection and analysis of data. Populate User Acceptance forms and ensure all required approvals exist before deployment of the reports. Team Support Support a collaborative and progressive team environment. Standardise and highlight improvements to services. Provide and maintain troubleshooting support and knowledge sharing across IT. About you Significant and relevant experience in requirements gathering, research and analysis, solution discovery, training, and other general Business Analysis capability is required. Tertiary qualifications in Information Systems, Computing Science or similar. 5+ years’ experience as a BI Developer (Preferably Power BI). 5+ years’ experience with SQL/T-SQL. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Strong discovery, analytical and problem-solving skills. Desirable Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or equivalent. Working knowledge of relational and non-relational databases. Familiarity with Data Warehouses and Data Lakes. Background in project management or business analysis. Competency in using Azure and other tools in the Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate). Competency in using Canva design software. More about you  Strong interpersonal skills for conduct in a client facing role, and ability to adapt to communicating with users from a variety of professional backgrounds and technical abilities. Willingness and ability to continuously learn and be able to pick up new technical skills as well as business knowledge on a regular basis. Keen attention to detail, both in testing and validation of data, and in design skills. Able to work independently, and can appropriately assess, analyse, and verify task requirements prior to actioning reporting tasks. Can cooperate and collaborate with a team to learn and share knowledge. A knowledge seeker who is able to challenge requirements, and utilise technical skills, internal understanding and practices as well as external understanding and experiences to continuously improve skills and reporting services provided. Demonstrates the tendency to contribute ideas and initiate new ways of working, shows enthusiasm for project work and special assignments. Proven consistency in making sound decisions. Ability to use information, knowledge, and experience to analyse and form judgements. Ability to comprehend the wider contexts, developments long term goals and determines strategies and actions required to achieve such goals. Able to maintain sustained level of concentration in a volume processing activity to ensure accuracy and identify errors to be addressed. Displays a commitment to quality client service, values the supplying of accurate and timely information and relates to people from diverse backgrounds. To apply The Law Society of New South Wales is committed to building and maintaining a respectful and inclusive workplace, appointing the best person for the role and supporting diversity. Applications should contain a CV and cover letter that outlines your key experience and motivations for this role.Show moreReport

Role: IT Business Analyst Employment type: Full time Location: Sydney, Australia Company: InfoCentric $70,000 - $160,000 plus superannuation.  InfoCentric are currently hiring for a Business Analyst. As part of our team, you will be working with some of Australia's largest organisations to deliver industry leading data solutions. This role is full time and permanent, based out of Melbourne.  About the role  The IT Business Analyst plays a key role within the product development team, acting as the main conduit between the development team and the business by understanding and translating business needs into software requirements, ensuring that the requirements, designs and specifications are captured, defined and well understood by the development team, using agile practices.  Day to day activities Work with stakeholders to prioritise the product backlog and defects based on business value, ensuring the value of the work that the team performs. Work closely with the project team members to ensure that the product meets the agreed requirements and to ensure the product is of a high quality. Accurately describe the problem statement, business impact and client experience. Work with the business to clearly identify success criteria for each milestone the team are working on. Define the acceptance criteria for user stories and requirements to ensure clarity for the development team Assist with the definition of the testing strategy and test execution including participation in testing activities and release readiness assessments. May lead agile ceremonies (stand up, retro, showcases, workshops, inceptions etc.) through visualisation techniques Gain a thorough understanding of the clients' business and be able to gather, refine and articulate their needs Analyse user requirements and deliver artefacts to assist with understanding - including domain modelling, workflows, user stories and interface design, by liaising with a range of people including users & product managers, drawing together information needs from across the organisation.   Skills Required: Minimum 2 years experience working as an IT Business Analyst Solid experience in gathering requirements Strong knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle Strong SQL knowledge Agile values and principles: Agile SDLC, Teams, Roles, Ceremonies and Artefacts. Jira (working with multiple projects: Scrum and Kanban boards) Strong knowledge of testing and automation of testing Confluence, Slack, Google Suite, Excel. Presentations: project pitches, internal and external demos, feature reviews, design critiques. East Melbourne, VIC, AU, 3002 Permanent The name IXOM may be new to you (it’s only a few years old) but as an organisation we’ve been around for over a century. We now have more than 1,100 employees across 10 countries, so far.  IXOM is a market leader in chemical manufacturing and distribution in Australia and New Zealand, with an increasing presence throughout South East Asia and North America.  Every day, we provide solutions to a range of industries including dairy, water, and food & beverage.  Chances are, we are already part of your everyday life, in some way or another. This is an exciting time to join our business as we move towards a sustainable, successful, and promising future.  Your role  It is an exciting time to join our business as we continue along our journey of ongoing expansion, change and transformation. Through continued growth and success, we are searching for an experienced Commercial Finance Analyst who is looking to work alongside a strong leader as a mentor, within a supportive and collaborative work environment.  Within a high-performance culture, this action-oriented role provides financial and analytical support to a broad range of stakeholders while gaining a better understanding of business needs. Your open, engaging communication style will allow you to share knowledge and valuable insights in this genuine business partnering role. In this role, you will be closely partnering with product and account managers across our Traded Products team to deliver their annual growth targets and strategic objectives, with a focus on pricing and business case support. Your responsibilities  Partner with the commercial business leaders to improve financial outcomes, support decision making and identify & implement strategic growth initiatives Ensure commercial arrangements progress through a robust financial model and decision-making framework to ensure they add value, meet agreed KPIs and mitigate risk Support the pricing strategy by delivering efficient pricing to improve the quality of earnings on all products across the portfolio Support on investment decisions by constructing business cases with integrated financial models to support growth activities and to assess business risks/opportunities Support the Finance Business Partner across a variety of tasks including the preparation of month end commentary and monthly management reporting pack, providing fact-based insight of business performance and preparation of presentations for Senior Executives Forward looking assessment and challenge of projected business performance, validation of S&OP input assumptions Drive disciplines and approach for ongoing portfolio reviews (fix and exit decisions) Support the business to conduct analysis of market growth/share, ensuring a detailed understanding of the competitor landscape, identifying potential risks and opportunities for the business Preparation and maintenance of 3-way corporate and strategy planning model, actively track performance against strategic KPI’s  Your skills & experience  Tertiary qualification in Commerce, Finance or Accounting is essential A professional qualification (CA or CPA) would be valued Experience in commercial finance, pricing or analytical role in a manufacturing organisation Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills and working knowledge using data analytics tools (Power BI preferred) High degree of commercial acumen with superior attention to detail Strong analytical skills and experience in an analysis role; comfortable working with large data sets Experience in a fast-paced environment and flexibility to juggle multiple tasks and priorities Strong interpersonal and influencing skills and ability to work with people at all levels, with confidence to challenge in the right way to influence better outcomes Highly regarded is having ERP knowledge (preferably SAP) along with HFM experience  Your benefits at IXOM  For a start, you’ll work for a large successful global organisation, where you’ll not only earn a competitive salary, you’ll have access to an Employee Assistance Program, a Recognition Program, and a range of health and benefits discounts. You’ll be provided with ongoing learning and development to meet your professional needs. You’ll be supported by an accessible leadership team who are driven by a solid values platform that underpins who we are and how we operate. What’s more, you’ll find yourself working with a flexible, diverse, and inclusive workforce. We celebrate and nurture our people. We’re focused on embracing change. There is no better time to join us. Your next step  Please note that you must have full working rights to apply.  No agencies please. Job description We are looking for a Product Support Analyst to join our growing team in Sydney. Get in on the ground floor at one of Sydney’s top startups, become an expert on Akeneo’s products, and help our clients and partners unlock growth through the power of our Product Experience Management (PXM) solutions. The Sydney members of the Akeneo team like to get together in the office several times a week. The other members of Support are based in Nantes, France, and Boston, USA. We are all part of the Product team. Our squad is filled with dedicated and passionate people who take pride in going the extra mile to deliver the best customer experience. Key Responsibilities  Respond to functional and technical requests from Enterprise edition customers in a considerate, accurate, and timely manner from the Jira Service Desk portal. Coordinate the technical qualification of bugs and questions with our support engineers and the patch releases with our maintenance leaders. Build on customer and partner feedback by improving our functional and technical documentation. Take part in the ongoing learning and success of the Support team with active contributions to help achieve team goals and successes. Collaborate with the rest of the product squads to test new features and bug fixes, and help to surface meaningful customer feedback. On-call duties to best support our clients in their product experience enhancement. Qualifications You have at least 2 years of experience in the SaaS Support field. You naturally look for all resources possible to make a difference and grow our customers' happiness. You love solving puzzles. You are proactive, autonomous, self-motivated, and resourceful. You love being challenged and you enjoy being involved in multiple tasks. You have experience working with Jira Service Desk, or other ticketing systems, Datadog, and Github. You write and speak English fluently. Having an understanding of French would be a plus. Overview The requirement is for Senior Data Analyst to join one of our prestigious federal clients. The Senior Data Analyst will provide credentialed data expertise and technical analysis support to build, maintain and innovated well-managed data solutions and capabilities to solve business problems. Their work will empower the project team and guide business decisions. The Senior Data Engineer will have to handle multiple simultaneous tasks, prioritize work, and remain functional under pressure, and short timelines. Key tasks/duties: Utilize programmatic and quantitative methods to identify patterns and relationships in large data sets, as well as apply mathematical, statistical, and other data-driven analysis to address intelligence questions. Perform quantitative analysis of complex business situations, such as strategies, performance, and solutions involving system performance and efficiency. Conduct detailed data analysis on data used across business units to evaluate business processes, discrepant data scenarios and improve on/create new feature. Apply advanced computer modelling, database tools and/or other approaches in conducting the analysis. Provide data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks for data consumers. Perform various data analytics in R, Python, SAS including SQL/PL SQL and MS Excel using statistical models or industry accepted tools Develop and executing tools to monitor and report on data quality Establish appreciation and adherence to the principles of data quality management, including metadata, lineage, and business definitions Provide support to Tech teams in managing security mechanisms and data access governance. Design, code, debug, test, document, and support server based applications such as SQL consistent with established business requirements and specifications in order to deliver the highest possible value to the Agency. Provide high level advanced triage support to stakeholders, business partners, and product teams in managing specific issue resolution activities. Develop a deep understanding of existing data sources, the relationships between each dataset and their limitations to support ability to support the end-to-end process of developing dashboards. Requirements Demonstrated capabilities as set out in key tasks/duties section At least 5 years in a data analyst position, preferably working as a Data Analyst in a fast-paced and dynamic business setting Tertiary qualifications demonstrating high level of investigative skills and data analysis or a strong demonstrated experience in this field. A minimum of Bachelor’s degree in addition to advanced technical skillsReport

About us  Evolution Mining was founded in late 2011 and has operations across Australia and in Ontario, Canada. We currently operate five wholly owned operations across NSW, QLD, WA and Canada with a leadership team that continually focuses on embedding a values driven culture aligned with our company vision to create a premier, global gold company.  Our Group operations are based in Liverpool St. (Sydney CBD) providing support across all sites in several key areas including IT, ensuring Evolution are positioned as a leader in effective optimisation of Information Technology.  About the role  We are currently recruiting a Senior Data Analyst to join our team on a 12-month fixed term contract. The Senior Data Analyst will lead the delivery of a program of high quality and timely data modelling, BI reporting, and advanced analytics (including AI/ML) for Evolution Mining, initially across the Asset Management (including maintenance) and Finance functions.  This role will involve significant stakeholder engagement, defining requirements, programme managing the implementation of fit-for-purpose analytics solutions, assisting and providing guidance and mentorship to members of the BI and advanced analytics teams, promoting a high performing and collaborative environment.  You will design and develop robust data models and supporting documentation and processes that support BI requirements to enable efficient data usage and analysis, informing stakeholders on patterns, trends and insights. Key to your success will be maintaining and utilising Power BI and other advanced analytics tools to create and maintain accurate visually appealing and interactive dashboards, reports, and data visualisations to enable data driven decisions.  This role will ideally be based in our Sydney Group office, however applicants with the ability to work in Brisbane will also be considered.  A bout you  To succeed in this role, you will have significant experience in leading reporting and advanced analytics work in Power BI, AI/ML technologies and tools, Power Query, Power Pivot, Power View, and Power Automate and have an in depth understanding of Microsoft Azure, within the mining industry and specifically in the fields of asset management (including maintenance) and ideally also finance.  You will be able to show evidence of the strong business benefits, improvement initiatives and outcomes that your work has delivered, such as significant financial impact/savings, large scale automation resulting in substantial time/cost savings in line with improving companies’ overall performance and increasing competitive advantage.  Key is that you are comfortable in demonstrating experience of building relationships with operational mining and asset management professionals is key; being able to scope, build and deliver BI and advanced analytics products that you are comfortable communicating, presenting, training/upskilling and continuously improving, able to translate complexity into user-friendly reporting.  This is very much a hands-on advanced analytics and reporting role where you will be leading your own projects, and outcomes, with clear KPIs and incentive based on performance within a supportive, structured team.  What we offer  Our Data and Analytics team is progressive and future focused, driving innovation within an organisation that is embracing a high-performing data team, utilising the latest tools, techniques and technologies in data and analytics. We are an outcome focussed team who lead projects that deliver real and large-scale value for the company, that is tracked and visible.  It’s an exciting time to be part of the Data and Analytics team at Evolution as we also lead a complex data governance programme, develop state of the art data lakehouse platform architectural framework, and further develop our data culture, change management and literacy programmes.  This role is offered on a fixed-term 12-month basis with a competitive salary, access to an incentive payment based on completion of project milestones, and a hybrid work environment. As this is a fixed-term contract you will accrue leave (annual and personal), superannuation and you will be eligible for up to three days wellness leave in accordance with our benefits.  We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to providing safe and inclusive work environments which allow our employees to be themselves. We support our employees' work-life integration and provide a stimulating environment to foster development and career growth.  To understand more on this role, please contact marie.stocker@evolutionmining.com  We encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply.  As part of the application process, Evolution will be collecting your personal information to assess your suitability for the role.Show moreReport

Company Description Supporting millions of Aussies since 1988 with low fees and competitive long-term performance. Profits back to members, not shareholders Closing date: 27th October 2023. *  Job Description About Us Established in 1988, Rest is one of Australia’s largest profit-to-member superannuation funds. We support more than 1.9 million members, with around $70 billion of funds under management and are recognised as a responsible investment leader*. We believe when members understand and engage with their super, they’re more likely to get a better retirement outcome. Everything we do at Rest is underpinned by our values and behaviours, we want to Be Daring, Keep it Simple, Take Action and Have Grit. To put it simply we want our people to thrive and love the work they do. About the Job Rest’s Data, Technology and Delivery (DTD) business unit is accountable for planning and preparing the organisation for the future through strategic technology innovation, as well as charting our business strategy and executing for today and tomorrow. Situated in the Business Analysis Practice, the Senior Business Analyst - Data has three main priorities: Being the voice of the data team and assessing the impact to data across current initiatives Supporting the Product Owner/Business Owner/Sponsors to ensure that business needs and solutions options are understood Ensuring the product/platform/project team have a shared understanding of the requirements, through written and verbal communication. Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities Gathering and documenting requirements: Gather, review, analyse, validate, evaluate, and map business systems, processes and user needs and translate them into requirements/user stories with acceptance criteria Managing stakeholders: Engage, inform and negotiate with stakeholders to elicit and validate requirements and prioritise them Analysing and modelling: Analyse documents, programs, logic, process flows and specifications. Model the requirements using a range of techniques such as process mapping, story mapping, user stories and acceptance criteria, business rules Managing the requirements lifecycle: Ensure that requirements/user stories are prioritised based on their value, complexity, and feasibility, ensuring that the most critical items are delivered first Team communication and collaboration: Work closely with Engineers, Testers, Change Managers Third Party members within the product/platform/project team to ensure everyone understands business requirements to be able to develop a fit-for-purpose solution Risk and issue management: Identify risks and issues and develop effective mitigation/management strategies according to Rest’s risk framework, and communicate risk assessments and plans to the necessary stakeholders.  Qualifications About You: Degrees and/or certifications Bachelor's degree IIBA® or similar industry standard certification preferred. job_title: Governance Research Analyst (Open to New Graduates)
job_description: Let’s be #BrilliantTogether Overview: We are currently seeking a full-time Mandarin-speaking Governance Research Analyst. This position will be permanent and based in Sydney for the research and write-up of corporate governance and voting research for institutional shareholders of Chinese and Taiwanese companies publicly traded in the Greater China region and the United States. Founded in 1985, the Institutional Shareholder Services group of companies (“ISS”) empowers investors and companies to build for long-term and sustainable growth by providing high-quality data, analytics, and insight. With over 2,600 employees spread across 29 offices in 15 countries, ISS is today the world’s leading provider of corporate governance and responsible investment solutions, market intelligence and fund services, and events and editorial con tent for institutional investors and corporations, globally. ISS Governance offerings include objective governance research and recommendations, and end-to-end proxy voting and distribution solutions. Institutional clients have long turned to ISS to apply their corporate governance views, identify environmental, social, and governance risks, and manage their complete proxy voting needs on a global basis. ISS covers approximately 48,000 meetings in 115 markets yearly, delivering proxy research and vote recommendations while working closely with clients to execute more than 12.8 million ballots representing 5.4 trillion shares. Responsibilities: Analyze corporate governance and financial information to process data and write research reports on publicly traded companies in mainland China and Taiwan Issue proxy vote recommendations for shareholder meetings of the companies listed on stock exchanges in mainland China and Taiwan Develop market specific expertise in corporate governance, securities regulations, and proxy voting issues gathered through research and engagement with company executives, institutional investors, and government/regulatory/listing authorities Lead or participate in engagement meetings and calls with corporate executives, directors, and financial and legal advisors, as well as institutional investors, as part of research process on high profile or contentious shareholder meetings Develop market overviews and generate research notes on developing governance trends, emerging situations, and other governance-focused topics for internal and external clients Contribute to seasonal reviews, bulletin calls, and other client-focused governance research reports Answer internal/external client/corporate issuer queries on research reports and participate in discussions and development of ISS policy Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a related field such as finance, law, economics, business, accounting, political science, and international relations, or equivalent experience Master's degree in a related field or MBA or CFA qualifications or equivalent work experience preferred 3-5 years of experience in research and analysis or any related fields is preferred, but open to New Graduates Excellent oral and written communication skills in Chinese (both simplified and traditional) and English Experience in financial analysis and knowledge of corporate governance and proxy voting issues preferred Strong analytical ability, including financial statement literacy and attention to detail Goal-oriented and comfortable with ambiguity and able to prioritize, anticipate, and deliver multiple, sometimes competing objectives under tight deadlines Strong organization skills, teamwork, and ability to work independently Passion for corporate governance research Must have the proper work authorization in the country- please indicate work eligibility in resume #LI-CP11 #Associate #Research What you can expect from us Our people are the moving force behind ISS. We are dedicated to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry and empowering them with the resources and support to enhance their career, health, financial and personal well-being. We are committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. We are invested in our people and are working every day to ensure a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. Let’s empower, collaborate, and inspire one another. Let’s be #BrilliantTogether. About ISS ISS empowers investors and companies to build for long-term and sustainable growth by providing high-quality data, analytics, and insight. We are committed to positively impacting the environment and society through our market-leading solutions and leading by example. Company Description McDonald’s Australia is the largest quick service restaurant operation in the country. Fondly known as “Macca's”, we are a household name in Australia for over 50 years, we believe that our customers are the heart and soul of everything we do and make it our mission to make every moment count! As an employer of choice winner, working with us means taking pride and having fun along the way, while growing and developing your career in a dynamic and supportive environment. Not only do we offer flexible working arrangements and an attractive staff discount; but we provide an opportunity to work alongside other passionate and talented people every single day.  Job Description Could you be our next Technical Business Analyst? Are you an experienced, motivated professional looking for your next big opportunity? We're excited to introduce you to our newly established position as a Technical Business Analyst. In this dynamic role, you'll play a pivotal part in translating business needs into remarkable technological advancements. Your mission? Collaborate closely with stakeholders, evaluate, define requirements, set the scope, and engineer business solutions that align perfectly with McDonald’s strategic and operational needs, both in technology and business. Your expertise will help drive our success. What can you expect on a day-to-day basis? Crafting strategic roadmaps for designated applications Skilfully gathering and documenting business and technical requirements through engaging meetings, interviews, and in-depth analysis Orchestrating workshops to capture and document technical, functional, and business specifications Collaborating closely with solution architects, product owners, and vendors to ensure the delivery of crystal-clear and effective solutions Working hand-in-hand with business units to ensure applications align seamlessly with their needs Offering your subject matter expertise to enhance McDonald’s systems Prudently managing projects, delivering results that stay well within budgetary boundaries Coordinating the provision of outsourced resources for support and development Navigating the entire McDonald’s applications lifecycle, from quality assurance testing and user acceptance testing to deployment, sustainability, and efficient vendor management Guiding the process of change control by raising requests and ensuring that solution documentation is current Keeping our Technology Solutions documentation and knowledge base up-to-date Spearheading the identification of system and process changes that elevate solution reliability, enhance effectiveness, streamline efficiencies, minimize support escalations, and reduce disruptions to our business partners Managing and participating in the successful launch of product releases and go-to-market plans Actively participating in IT Initiatives and forums, contributing to local and global discussions as necessary  Qualifications Your keys to success: Tertiary qualifications in either Computer Science or demonstrated equivalent experience Demonstrated experience as a Technical Business Analyst for a minimum of 3+ years Strong understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Technical proficiency in databases and SQL Advanced expertise in MS Office products Exceptional problem-solving, analysis, and testing abilities Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills Proficiency in verbal and written communication, with adaptability to the different audiences Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment Proven experience in project and change management Collaborative mindset with a focus on achieving business and team goals Willingness to get hands-on and dive into the technical aspects of the projects Proactive, self-motivated, and ability to work independently and part of a team environment Ability to identify opportunities for process improvement and take action Experience in Marketing Technology will be an added advantage Desirable skills: Have experience with project management and software development tools such as JIRA, Confluence and Service Now Experience in Marketing, CRM and Data technologies Braze, M Particle Experience in web development, general purpose scripting language, working with database query language and hosting technologies Experience in Data Visualisation tools (PowerBI, TableAU etc.) Additional Information The Maccas Difference Birthday & Volunteer leave A fun and vibrant culture packed with local events i.e. People Month – that’s right a whole month to celebrate our people! Access to hundreds of retail discounts including discounted Macca’s Highly flexible work environment Wellbeing initiatives including a 24/7 wellbeing partner for you and your immediate family 5th week of annual leave for you to switch off and recharge Ongoing professional development opportunities in line with your career goals and passion As an equal opportunity employer, we strongly encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, ethnicities, cultures, and experiences. About us  HammondCare is a not-for-profit, values-based organisation that is passionate about improving the quality of care for people in need. As one of Australia’s most innovative health and aged care providers, we aim to set the global standard of relationship-based care for people with complex needs. HammondCare provides care primarily through hospitals, residential care homes and home-based care as well as services for dementia support, community palliative care, rehabilitation, positive aging and older persons’ mental health.  About the role  This exciting role ensures HammondCare gets the best value from its investment in business systems. This role focuses on all data collected in our business systems, methods of collection, systems integration, data warehouse design and management, reporting and providing business teams the information from our business systems to assist with decision making.  As a pivotal advocate, you will champion the role of data and analytics in delivering value to HammondCare. This includes optimising investments in business systems, enhancing business and customer insights, and equipping management with the information necessary for efficient decision-making.  This role is a permanent full-time role based at St Leonards with working from home options.  Key Responsibilities include  Proactive Stakeholder Engagement: Identify reporting and analytics needs, and proactively collaborate with key stakeholders to understand strategic data and analytical objectives. Enable them to access critical decision-making insights through user-friendly and intuitive tools Data Transformation Expertise: Develop and implement methodologies, processes, and technologies that convert raw data into meaningful and actionable information. This includes historical, current, and predictive views of business operations Modeling for Insight: Employ descriptive and predictive models to extract valuable knowledge and insights, enabling data-driven recommendations and decision guidance. BI Stack Mastery: Serve as the technical and functional expert for HammondCare's BI stack, including SQL Scripting, SSIS, SSRS, and PowerBI. Bridge the gap between conceptual business ideas and the detailed execution required for success Data Integration Leadership: Extract, transform, and store data from various systems and sources, both on-premises and in the cloud. Analyse this data to generate valuable business insights. Provide expertise in designing, developing, and managing system integrations to support various business teams Support for Systems Administration: Collaborate with the Application Management Team by offering information for application support, data migration, data analysis, upgrades, and configuration changes Effective Communication and Collaboration: Maintain open and efficient communication with key IT team members to ensure the operational reliability of systems. Strategic Business Reporting: Implement a well-planned and technically superior strategy for managing business reporting and dashboard requirements  About You  Commitment to engage and align with HammondCare’s Christian Mission, Motivation and Mission in Action A bachelor’s degree in information systems or computing Science, complemented by hands-on practical experience A minimum of four years demonstrated expertise in the field of information systems, particularly in business systems, databases, and the development and implementation of data and Business Intelligence (BI) strategies Mandatory extensive proficiency in the MS SQL Server stack, notably in SQL scripting, SSIS and SSRS, with a strong preference for experience in Microsoft Data Factory. Power BI preferred Proven track record in unlocking business and customer value through the management of complex CRM and ERP systems A fervor for data analysis to drive informed business decisions and enhance operational efficiency Keen understanding of business dynamics Strong business analytics skills, including gathering user requirements, process mapping, and preparing comprehensive project documentation Expertise in data warehousing and data integration methodologies Proficiency in API implementation and coding Exceptional analytical capabilities and unwavering attention to detail Demonstrates initiative and maintains a service-oriented attitude Capable of working both independently and collaboratively within a team Possesses advanced communication and interpersonal skills Exceptional organisational abilities, with a talent for task prioritisation to meet deadlines Aged Care and/or Health industry experience preferred but not essential  Benefits  We care about your wellbeing at HammondCare and as a result offer a wide range of health and lifestyle benefits including:  Fitness Passports; Full facility access can include gyms, group classes and pools for yourself and your family. Discounts across a range of household names such as JB HI- FI Option to purchase up to 2 weeks additional annual leave 14 weeks Paid Parental Leave Learning and development opportunities  To Apply  If you are ready to make a difference with HammondCare, ! For any specific queries please contact talent@hammond.com.au.  Pre- Employment Checks  All short-listed applicants for these positions will be asked to consent to a criminal record check and reference and must be willing to obtain a COVID-19 vaccinations.Show moreReport

POSITION NUMBER 3731 DEPARTMENT Product, Analytics and Data Science ROLE TYPE Non-teaching JOB TYPE Full time CONTRACT Ongoing LOCATION Preston APPLICATIONS CLOSE 20 November 2023 BUSINESS ANALYST Annual Salary $86,826 - $95,637 + Superannuation MP offer Flexible Working, this role is based out of our Preston Campus. We are close to public transport and provide secure onsite parking, onsite Café & restaurant with a gym facility, hair salon & we are only a short walk to Preston market.  About the Organisation:  Melbourne Polytechnic is a learning organisation that has been delivering vocational training since 1912. Learning at Melbourne Polytechnic is a unique experience with an applied focus. delivered by teachers with real-world experience and expertise.  At Melbourne Polytechnic we are committed to providing high quality, innovative, applied and future focused, purposeful education and training to students, industry and communities. Our teachers are passionate and established in their professions and look guide students in theirs. We know that circumstances can create barriers to learning, so we offer our students personalised pathways, flexible study options and learning support.   About the role:  As a member of the Product, Analytics and Data Science (PADS) team, you will be responsible for working with stakeholders across the organisation to solve critical business challenges. This role will see the elicitation of user requirements for building business intelligence, performance monitoring and reporting solutions. You will be an expert in open-ended problem solving and getting to the root cause of issues based on evidence. You will also be adept at bridging the gap between business users and technical teams. As part of a high performing and supportive team, you will have the ability to collaborate on a range of analytical and strategic initiatives. You will enjoy working autonomously and have a high tolerance for working in ambiguity.   Duties: Engaging heavily with business stakeholders to define, document and provide recommendations for end-to-end business intelligence assets, eliciting requirements, covering data source & lineage, metrics & measures and user experience. Lead or participate in multiple enterprise level projects, applying agile project management methodologies to achieve organisation goals, including preparing project charters, supplying reports and identifying, mitigating and escalating risks. Applying open-ended problem-solving skills for the development and facilitation of stakeholder interviews, workshops and surveys to translate into user scenarios, KPI’s and solution specifications. Act as a bridge between business users and technical teams, including external suppliers, by simplifying information so it is easily understood by all stakeholders.   Skills and experience required: Tertiary degree in a field including Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or similar. Minimum of 2 years experience in a similar role working on analytic, business intelligence or reporting initiatives. Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills including demonstrated ability to communicate complex analytical and process concepts with confidence and in an accessible way. High-level open-ended problem-solving skills and ability to work autonomously in a complex environment with competing priorities. The role Reporting to the Manager, Analytics Team, your role revolves around identifying and applying innovative statistical methodologies tailored to the organization's needs. You will lead in designing and conducting advanced statistical analyses of diverse data collections, providing invaluable insights for Hospital and Health Services (HHS's) and other units within Queensland Health. Your responsibilities extend to developing and implementing robust policies and procedures for ongoing statistical analysis, contributing significantly to Queensland Health's planning, management, and evaluation processes. You'll conduct comprehensive literature reviews, employing your expertise in project management to strategize and implement clinical initiatives. Building and managing strategic networks will be essential, enhancing information sharing with key stakeholders, both internal and external. Your role involves offering vital support to the Patient Safety and Quality Improvement Service, aiding staff in quality improvement projects. Demonstrating exceptional people skills, including consultation, presentation, negotiation, and influence, you will communicate authoritative advice effectively, particularly in written formats like correspondence, briefings, and reports. Proactively enhancing your technical knowledge is crucial, ensuring you consistently excel in your role and adapt to the evolving environment. The successful personTo excel in this position, you should possess excellent interpersonal abilities, showcasing your capacity to lead clinical groups, facilitate discussions, and communicate effectively across all organizational levels. Additionally, you need to demonstrate advanced skills in conceptualizing, communicating, and evaluating innovative approaches to tackle intricate organizational challenges within a clinical setting. This involves expertise in data information systems and measurement programs, utilizing project management methodologies. Your role also requires providing authoritative written advice to senior management on complex statistical matters and preparing intricate submissions, briefings, and high-quality reports. About usThe Department of Health is responsible for the overall management of the public health system in Queensland. We are an organisation that strongly believes in the need to work with people who value the goals of our organisation and who will thrive in our workplace. Working at the Department of Health is about making a difference. Clinical Excellence Queensland (CEQ) has a mission to partner with health services, clinicians and consumers to drive measurable improvement in patient care through the continual pursuit of excellence. CEQ is committed to a client-first approach; through building strong relationships and understanding the needs and aspirations of our clients, we are best able to achieve our mission. The role of the Clinical Excellence Queensland (CEQ) is to drive the patient safety, quality improvement and clinical improvement agendas for the Queensland health system. It will achieve this by identifying, monitoring and promoting improvements in the quality of health services delivered by service providers (both Hospital and Health Services and private health facilities, globally and within Queensland), and support and facilitate the dissemination of best-practice clinical standards and processes that achieve better outcomes for patients. The quality improvement agenda is actively supported by a significant research agenda. The Division is also accountable for setting and supporting the direction for mental health, alcohol and other drug services in Queensland, as well monitoring and reporting on performance. This role works on tasks helping to ensure price quality, deal compliance, management of formula / indexed pricing, contract development and administration, and timely communication of pricing to sales and customers. Experience in working closely with sales teams or supply chain teams to assist with execution of price changes in our systems and processes. Monitors process capability and system enhancements to minimize any lag between the decision to change prices and the effective date of the change, resulting from administrative constraints or system bottlenecks. Report metrics that ensure speed and efficiency of the deal desk processes and that help identify areas of process improvement. Assisting in execution of price changes in our systems and processes. Monitors process capability and system enhancements to minimize any lag between the decision to change prices and the effective date of the change, resulting from administrative constraints or system bottlenecks. Employment Type: Permanent Full Time Position Classification: Health Manager Level 4 Remuneration: $137,173.00 - $163,431.00, plus Superannuation Location: 1 Reserve Road, St Leonards, in a hybrid working environment Hours Per Week: 38 Requisition ID: REQ446877 Closing Date: 14 November 2023 (11:59PM)  Agency Overview NSW Health is the largest health system in Australia, with 228 hospitals and around 130,000 staff (full-time equivalent 2021/22). The purpose of NSW Health is to plan the provision of comprehensive, balanced and coordinated health services to promote, protect, develop, maintain and improve the health and wellbeing of the people of NSW (Source: Health Administration Act 1982, No. 135, Section 5).  The NSW Ministry of Health is a Department established under the Government Sector Employment Act 2013, section 22 and Schedule one, to support relevant ministers to perform their executive and statutory functions. The NSW Ministry of Health also has the role of system manager for the NSW public health system.  The Workforce Planning and Talent Development Branch (WPTD) is a part of the People, Culture and Governance Division, and is responsible for planning, developing, facilitating and evaluating workforce, culture and talent strategies across the NSW health system, to improve health outcomes for the people of NSW. In collaboration with national and state agencies and other stakeholders, WPTD aims to establish a clear picture of the health workforce now and into the future to improve workforce supply and distribution.  For more information go to www.health.nsw.gov.au  What you'll be doing The Principal Analyst - Workforce Intelligence will provide operational and technical leadership of an integrated workforce information system for the NSW Health. Including relevant system architecture, data modelling, reporting and analytics.  Candidate Assessment You may be asked to undertake further assessments as part of the recruitment process for this position, which may include, but is not limited to, psychometric assessment (e.g. personality and cognitive abilities assessments) and/or particular work tasks.  How to apply Your application to be considered should include: Responses by addressing the selection criteria below. An up-to-date resume of no more than five (5) pages which clearly details your skills and experience as relevant to this role. 2x referees will need to be supplied prior to an offer being made. Application must be lodged electronically. Please go to https://jobs.health.nsw.gov.au/ and search Job Reference Number REQ446877 to submit your application. Selection Criteria Extensive experience and a record of achievement in workforce informatics and reporting in a large diverse service industry organisation, and relevant tertiary qualifications or equivalent (e.g. IT, HR, Economics or Engineering). This includes expert knowledge and demonstrated achievement in managing, manipulating and interrogating large datasets, data analysis, designing reports and extracting actionable insights. Superior understanding of Large-Scale Enterprise Human Resource Management systems and demonstrated advanced knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (Qlik, PowerBI) to support workforce informatics, including advanced proficiency using scripting languages such as Python, R, DAX, SQL. Strong analytical skills including the ability to analyze and interpret complex information from numerous sources, prepare and present insightful analysis and reports, deal with challenges creatively and achieve business focused solutions. Proven achievement in the development and successful implementation of strategic initiatives, including the capability to plan, manage change, strategically improve performance and manage multiple projects.  Need more information?    2) Find out more about applying for this position For role related queries or questions contact Rian Thompson on Rian.Thompson@health.nsw.gov.au. Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion At the NSW Health we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible environment which reflects the community and customers we serve. We actively promote the employment of women, people with a disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, LGBTIQ+ community and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. If you identify as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander and would like assistance with your application or to obtain more information on how to apply please visit The Stepping Up Initiative. To be eligible for employment in these roles you must be an Australian citizen, or a permanent resident of Australia, or a New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand Passport, or hold a valid visa with permission to work in Australia.  COVID-19 Vaccination Compliancy All NSW Health workers are required to have completed a primary course (2 doses) of a Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) approved or recognised COVID-19 vaccine (except for the Janssen COVID-19 vaccine which is approved by the TGA as a single dose primary course). New applicants must have completed the vaccination course prior to commencement with NSW Health, or provide an Australian Immunisation Register (AIR) Immunisation History Statement certifying the worker cannot have any approved COVID-19 vaccines available in NSW. Acceptable proof of vaccination is the Australian Immunisation Register (AIR) Immunisation History Statement or AIR COVID-19 Digital Certificate. Booster doses are highly recommended for all health care workers who have completed the primary course of COVID-19 vaccinations.  Additional information This recruitment may be used to create a Talent Pool for similar future roles (ongoing or temporary) that may arise over the next 18 months. Working at Transurban is different; it’s a place where you can see the benefits of your work play out in real life, every day. We create city-sized solutions—building and operating safer, smarter, and more sustainable roads—to solve pressing transport challenges that are slowing cities down. About the role We’re seeking a Senior Business Analyst to develop requirements for end-to-end processes such as billing, invoicing and customer accounts. This role will involve the analysis of initiatives relating to preventative and detective controls, reporting of process improvement and customer remediation programs, as well as the management of financial models for new projects. As our Senior Business Analyst, you’ll contribute to lasting and positive changes that shape the future of our cities and communities. It’s meaningful, challenging and exciting work. Day-to-day, you will: Perform high level feasibility analysis on new problems, gathering relevant data and quickly integrate and analyse information to form logical answers to questions. Investigate inputs regarding potential data inaccuracies. Development and execution of specific use-cases. Run workshops as required to build proactive identification processes. Document business needs analysis and business requirements for proposed areas of change. Assist with the development and management of the remediation framework and principle. This role will suit someone with a curious mind and transferrable skills and experiences, including: Demonstrated experience in an analytical role such as a Systems or Senior Business Analyst. You’ll be experienced in process reviews, process mapping, holding workshops, running stand ups etc. A strong understanding of Agile methodologies and principles. Robust analytical and problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and proficiency in the MS Office Suite (i.e. MS Word, MS PowerPoint and MS Excel) An inquisitive mindset. You’ll be curious and know how to break down problems to investigate their root cause. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact with a diverse range of stakeholders. Demonstrated ability to successfully engage stakeholders and to facilitate meetings/workshops as necessary to achieve business objectives. Experience in documenting and articulating problems and processes. A motivated self-starter with a proactive ‘can-do’ attitude. If you meet some of these requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. With a career at Transurban, you’ll enjoy a range of benefits, including: A range of flexible working and leave options, including the option to purchase an additional six weeks of leave each year 16 weeks paid parental leave (regardless of gender or carer status), with no waiting period, with Superannuation paid during unpaid leave as well Learning and development opportunities to support your career interests Health and wellbeing support—access to Headspace and our EAP program, wellness facilities, and more Share offers and insurance benefits Social activities, community give-back programs and paid volunteer days We offer a range of flexible working and leave options, so you can balance your work and life commitments and interests. Have a conversation with us about how this could work for you. We embrace diversity with a foundation of safety, wellbeing and inclusion; where everyone belongs. We treat everyone with fairness, consideration and respect, regardless of gender, gender identity, marital or family status, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity, religious beliefs, cultural or socio-economic background, perspective, and experience – whether they work for us or not. We want to ensure everyone feels comfortable and safe to express ideas, questions and concerns.
