company: Telethon Institute for Child Health Research3.7 ★
job_title: Data Analyst - WAACHS Linked Data Study
job_description: The Opportunity The Western Australian Aboriginal Child Health Survey (WAACHS) Linked Data Study is a partnership between researchers, the Aboriginal community and government to provide evidence for policy and practice addressing high priority health and wellbeing issues for Aboriginal children and families. The study uses a longitudinal linked dataset based on a population representative sample of Aboriginal children and their families (the 2000/02 Western Australian Aboriginal Child Health Survey; WAACHS) and government data across health, education, child protection, and justice domains. We now have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join this high achieving team and support a range of sub-studies outlined by study investigators and the Aboriginal Steering Committee. Working closely with the Lead Investigator, your role will include data manipulation, writing script in appropriate software (e.g., R, STATA), data description and statistical modelling, producing draft outputs for review by Investigators and reference groups, and presentation of results for publication and dissemination. This role will be based at Perth Children’s Hospital and will be offered on a full-time basis for 2 years commencing in February 2023. Some of your duties will include but are not limited to; Create specific analytic datasets by integrating data from multiple data sources for unbiased sub-groups to address sub-study questions. Carry out statistical analysis ranging from exploratory & descriptive analysis through to complex longitudinal modelling. Provide interpretation of results and prepare tables, figures and other engaging visualisation as required for review and discussion with Investigators and reference groups. Ensure that all analyses and reporting meet Aboriginal research standards, is culturally sensitive and consistent with the overarching study narrative. About You The ideal applicant for this role will have a tertiary qualification majoring in statistics or another relevant discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or equivalent work experience in a quantitative field. Along with this, your application must also demonstrate the following skills and attributes;  Strong data management skills and general analytic ability.  Skills, experience and confidence in the application of a wide range of statistical techniques  Relevant experience in data analysis for research purposes using large data sets (e.g., population survey data, administrative datasets).  Excellent programming skills in appropriate scripting language/s (e.g., STATA, R or Python).  Ability to work effectively in a team and conduct tasks autonomously. We are driving inclusion and diversity as part of the way we work and embrace the diverse career and life experiences of our staff. If you meet a number of the requirements (and not all), we encourage you to submit your application. We also encourage you to address any career disruptions (if applicable) you may have had in your cover letter. About Us Our aim is to create a workplace where people are respected and encouraged to fulfil their potential. We encourage a workforce that is innovative, eager to acquire knowledge and enhance skills; we embrace all employee differences, foster a culture that supports diversity and inclusion, and are committed to providing reasonable accommodations where required. Some of our staff benefits include: Additional annual leave over Christmas and Easter.  Save on tax and increase your take home pay by salary packaging up to $15,899 of Living Expenses and up to $2,650 on Entertainment Benefits each FBT year.  Extensive health and wellbeing program with weekly events.  Flexible work options and hybrid working.  Reward and recognition program.  Professional development opportunities including access to unlimited online training with LinkedIn Learning.  Modern offices and end of trip facilities, including sit to stand desks.  Access to Corporate Health Insurance.  Staff purchasing discounts including travel, IT Hardware and stationery. How to apply If you think that this is the right role and an exciting new challenge for you, please click on 'Apply Now' to navigate to our Career Site to view the Job Description and submit your application. Your cover letter (no more than 2 pages) should specifically address your skills and experience outlined in the “About You” section above. Applications will only be accepted through our career portal. If you are experiencing technical difficulties with our online portal, please direct your query to recruitment@telethonkids.org.au  If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, please direct your inquiries to recruitment@telethonkids.org.au.   Contact Name: Sarah Johnson  Contact Email: sarah.johnson@telethonkids.org.au  Closing Date: 17/11/2023 Telethon Kids reserve the right to hire prior to the closing date.Show moreReport

NAB, invested in you  At NAB, we believe success comes from our people. Technical Business Analyst for Data Warehousing Project  Position Overview: As a Technical Business Analyst (BA) for a data warehousing project, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions. You will collaborate with stakeholders, including business users, data architects, data engineers, and developers, to gather requirements, analyze data, and design efficient data warehousing solutions. Your expertise in both business processes and technical aspects of data warehousing will be essential for the successful delivery of the project.  Key Responsibilities  1. Requirement Gathering and Analysis  Work closely with business stakeholders to elicit and document their data warehousing requirements.  Analyze existing business processes, data models, and systems to identify improvement opportunities and align them with project goals.  Define clear, concise, and unambiguous functional and non-functional requirements  Data Analysis and Modeling  Collaborate with data architects and data engineers to design and develop data models, schemas, and data integration workflows.  Conduct data analysis to identify data quality issues, inconsistencies, and gaps, and propose solutions.  Ensure the data model aligns with business requirements and industry best practices  Requirements  Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.  Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role, specifically in data warehousing projects.  In depth knowledge of data warehousing concepts, methodologies, and best practices.  Strong understanding of data modeling, data integration, ETL processes, and database systems.  Proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases (e.g.Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL).  Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.  Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex business requirements into technical solutions.  Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.  Detail-oriented and able to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.  Experience working in Agile development methodologies is desirable  About Virtusa  Teamwork, quality of life, professional and personal development: values that Virtusa is proud to embody. Job no: 495171 Work type: Full time Location: New South Wales Categories: Administration, Transport & Logistics  About us  Qube Ports is the major integrated port solutions provider in Australia, with services and facilities in over 28 Australian Ports, together with cargo storage, materials handling and distribution operations in all Australian states. This allows us to lead the market in providing purpose designed solutions for our customers handling containers, bulk, automotive and general cargo.  At Qube, we recognise that our people are our most important asset and are the engine that drives our organisation, playing a vital role in ensuring our business achieve our objectives and deliver on our commitments. We believe that attracting the right people, maximising their contribution, and rewarding performance is vital for success. By choosing to work at Qube, you will be choosing to work at Australia's largest integrated provider of import and export logistics services with a market capitalisation in excess of $4.8 billion as at 30 June 2022. We operate in over 142 locations across Australia, New Zealand and South East Asia with a workforce of over 8,200 employees.  The Role  As a key member of the Workforce Management Systems team, you will be responsible for providing business analyst support across a number of key workforce systems areas with a strong focus on EA interpretation, documentation of system enhancements and requirement gathering for implementations into the Workforce Management Systems (WFMS)  This role provides analytical and reporting support to the Labour Centre Manager and WFM Systems Manager working with the System Data Analyst to provide insightful labour reporting. The role will be critical to ensuring Workforce Management Systems are configured in a way that employee payments are timely, accurate and compliant with EA’s and awards.  Key Accountabilities  Provide accurate review and interpretation of EA’s, Awards and Letters of agreement (LOA’s) for configuration by the System Administrators in our Workforce Management Systems Ongoing review and audits of workforce management systems configuration to prevent incorrect payment or entitlement calculations Develop requirements for reporting and dashboarding to provide insights and trends in labour costs and labour management to Qube management and finance teams Support Industrial Relations GM’s with data and analysis leading up to and during EA negotiations Identify and document business requirements for enhancements to Workforce Management Systems Document use case scenarios of Workforce Management system functions Create user guides, system guidelines and documentation for Workforce Management Systems Perform requirement gathering for new site implementations into the Workforce Management Systems Work with National Labour Centre Manager and WFM Systems Manager to improve employee and management experience of the rostering processes such as allocation requirements, employee self-service, leave application and approval processes. Identify and champion business process improvement opportunities that reduce cost, improve employee experience and reduce compliance risk. Other BA support to the National Labour Centre Manager and WFM Systems Manager  Core Competencies  The following competencies have been identified as required to be successful. These competencies help define how we do our role and recognise the behaviours that we need to display daily. Identifiant de la demande: 12257 Lieu de travail: Southbank, AU, 3006 About US (GEMS): ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.  ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.  3,300 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.  Our +120,00 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.  Our 4 expertises: Asset managementEnergy transition servicesEnergy supply & global commoditiesRisk management & market access  At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.  More info on GEM Hub (https://gems.engie.com) or LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions).  About ENGIE: Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 170,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.  Context: Within the GEMS Business Unit, the Australia and New Zealand Business Platform (BP ANZ) are managing and developing the group’s trading activities for these regions around 4 main pillars: risk management and market access, asset management, green solutions and energy supply businesses.  The missions of the BP ANZ are: Support the development and the operations of the other GBUs (Global Business Units) in all aspects related to risk representation and risk managementDevelop a commercial franchise which contributes to the overall risk management of the portfolio and generates value  The GEMS ANZ Analytics team develops market insights and quantitative models. These are used to optimise dispatchable assets, forecast customer consumptions, risk manage positions, assess long term prices, value hedging product and shape strategy.  The purpose of this role is to provide subject matter expertise for quantitative commodity trading models built by the Analytics team. The analysis and insights generated will lead to improved decision making across the rest of GEMS ANZ and the wider ANZ business.  Role: The incumbent is responsible and accountable for the following key responsibilities: activities which can align to evolve with the business’ requirements.  Develop quantitative financial models to value energy derivatives (Power, Green, Gas)Engage with the Forward Trading and Commercial teams to develop and operate models and tools to support trading decisionsWork together with Head of Analytics or Head of Forward Power Trading on complex, ill-defined tasks with minimal assistance from Manager (i.e. gather requirements, come up with design, implement and test)Ensure that the analytical work is complete to a high standard and on time, while regularly communicating the status of the projectProvide thought leadership and creativity in developing innovative solutions to new problems, together with the Head of Analytics and Principal Analyst Quantitative ModellingProactively suggest new possibilities for analytics/projects to the Head of Analytics and Head of Forward Power Trading  The incumbent must adhere to all regulatory and compliance requirements relevant to the requirements of the role. You must comply with all Health Safety & Environment compliance requirements, as they apply to your position, other team members and to the Company.  Education and professional background: Tertiary degree in relevant disciplineMasters/PhD in Quantitative Discipline (Maths/Physics/Engineering) favourableExperienced within the wholesale electricity, gas, and financial markets (ideally in Australia) and the fundamentals of how these markets operate and interact.  Hard skills: 1 to 5 years relevant experience to the roleNEM experience favourableExperience developing and running quantitative models to support commodity trading. E.g. Option valuation modelsTechnical / programming skillsSQL, Microsoft Excel, coding in R and Python Statistical skills  Soft skills: Organisation, analysis, and interpretation of numerical dataExcellent analytical thinker and problem solverWork revolves around coming up with models, tools and techniques that have not been done before, as such, there is a lot of experimentationProject Leadership and mentoring of junior team members  If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time! Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.  ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provide equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you. The Victorian Government Cyber Incident Response Service (CIRS) is seeking a talented and self-motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our team.  CIRS sits within the Department of Government Services. It provides organisations with access to expert cyber incident response and coordination services. This includes technical, forensics and communications specialists. These experts assist with reducing the scope, impact and severity of cyber incidents as they impact the Victorian Government.  The Senior Data Analyst operates within the Cyber Defence Centre (CDC) and is a key member of the CIRSteam. The position is responsible for the leadership, innovation, design, development and delivery of cyber threat and cyber risk insights and analytic products that are produced for Victorian Government stakeholders.  About you  As our ideal candidate, you will have: Demonstrated experience in analytics and business intelligence web and product development and operational support through code (software engineering) and BI products/tooling.  Well-developed communication skills including workshop participation, product demonstration, requirements and design documentation, presentation skills.  Demonstrated experience in analysing issues from different perspective, identifying and proposing workable solutions, implementing solutions and evaluating effectiveness and adjusting actions as required.  Demonstrated experience establishing and maintaining relationships with people at all levels and from different backgrounds and organisations to achieve outcomes and manage risks.  Mandatory requirement   Ability to successfully acquire and maintain a NEGATIVE VETTING 2 level security clearance in Australia (requires Australian citizenship).  The closing date for this position is 19 November 2023. Current VPS employees are strongly encouraged to apply via the Jobs and Skills Exchange (JSE) platform. How to apply Apply before the advertised closing date. All applications should include:   a resume; and a cover letter which addresses the key selection criteria (within three pages).  This position is only open to applicants with relevant rights to work in Australia. Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com  Our total rewards package offering includes bonuses, healthcare, insurance benefits, retirement programs, wellness programs, as well as service and performance awards – not to mention various social and recreational activities, all of which are location specific.  Know someone at Stryker?  Be sure to have them submit you as a referrral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program Stryker is a leading Medical Supplier in Australia and New Zealand distributing a diverse range of products. Strong data quality is fundamental for our success - by investing in data quality, we are better equipped to thrive in today's data-driven business environment and support our mission, “Together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better”. The purpose of this role is to be a key player in the Stryker South Pacific Data Management and Governance Team Key outcomes will include: Increasing business success through driving the goals of Data Management and Governance of the Customer, Supplier and Employee Domains, and Business Data. Being responsible for the strategy to define how data integrity is upheld ensuring it is controlled and measured. Ensuring issues are raised to leadership and are addressed, promoting data ownership across the business. Defining how transactional data integrity is upheld ensuring data integrity is tracked and inventory integrity is well controlled Ensuring Stryker maintains high standards around quality, controls and processes through individuals clearly understanding their role in stewardship, and ownership of data and driving that accountability Key areas of accountability: Executing on the data strategy aligned with organisational goals and objectives, including determining critical data elements and prioritising accordingly, driving data ownership, a process for escalation and prioritisation and setting & enforcing standards. Implementing a data quality methodology i.e. a method to assess data quality, with criticality in mind, implementing and driving strong data quality metrics. Creating and maintaining tools to demonstrate that data quality is meeting requirements. Develop and maintain data dashboards and reports to monitor data quality, governance, and compliance metrics, providing regular updates to senior leadership. Overseeing data quality initiatives, including data profiling for criticality, cleansing, and enrichment, to maintain high-quality data across all systems and databases. Collaborating with stakeholders across various departments to understand their data needs and ensure data is leveraged effectively to support decision-making and business processes. Driving data meeting ownership and attendance. Working with the Business Controls Team to define and establish policies and procedures for the overall transactional and inventory integrity management to ensure all auditing requirements are met including Sarbanes Oxley. Identifying and leveraging opportunities to continually improve the quality of inventory management looking at processes and standards with reporting as necessary. Staying up-to-date with data regulations and ensure the organization's data practices comply with legal and industry-specific requirements. Key skills/requirements: Excellent analytical, interpersonal and communication skills with a passion for customer service Knowledge of the medical sector highly advantageous Knowledge of JDE and Salesforce highly advantageous 5+ years of experience working in the data space A positive and enthusiastic team attitude Culture & Benefits: Ongoing training and opportunities for career progression Paid Parental leave schemes Volunteer Day Engagement Day Being part of one of the world’s largest and most recognizable brands. Excellent team culture – we have fun whilst we work! A Leader who will support & guide you throughout your career Access to employee benefits including health care, financial wellbeing & insurance Access to our career and self-development program from day one Work with likeminded individuals who are driven by exceeding targets and improving patient outcomes! Know someone at Stryker? Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program To join us, click apply now! Deliver with impact, connect to what matters & live your way with flexible working options  Ongoing Full Time Location: Willing to consider candidates across all NSW locations. Preference will be given to candidates based regionally, with a focus on Queanbeyan, Armidale, Dubbo and Coffs Harbour Salary from $139,787 to $161,663.00p.a + super Create a legacy using your specialist skills  About the Role  As a Senior Technical Data Analyst in Local Land Services (LLS), you will play a pivotal role in spearheading the development, maintenance, and implementation of data integration resources essential for the seamless operation of our business. You will take charge of managing the connectivity between various LLS systems, as well as with external entities, including other NSW Government agencies.  Your responsibilities extend to overseeing the LLS Reporting Data Warehouse (RDW), which is instrumental in providing insights and data for LLS decision-makers and compliance with legislative reporting requirements. You will act as a liaison between LLS and other Departments to ensure the availability and administration of critical resources required for data integration and RDW operation.  Why Join LLS?  Make a strategic impact on the future of land management in New South Wales Collaborate with a diverse range of stakeholders, both within the Department and external vendors Work on challenging and rewarding projects that have a real-world impact Be part of a team of passionate and talented individuals who are committed to making a difference  Key Responsibilities  Develop, maintain, and implement data integration solutions Manage the connectivity between various LLS systems and external entities Oversee the LLS Reporting Data Warehouse (RDW) Act as a liaison between LLS and other Departments Ensure the availability and administration of critical resources required for data integration and RDW operation  Skills and Experience  You will possess a combination of technical skills and relevant experience such as:  Proficiency in several data analytics focused programming languages, such as Python, R, and SQL Experience with CI/CD solutions, such as Microsoft Azure DevOps or GitBe Experience in database and storage resource management. Azure resource management, including ADLS and Key Vault Experience in data integration, data warehousing, stakeholder engagement, enterprise architecture, and data analytics. Expertise in data governance and cybersecurity in data systems. Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills  For more information on the Senior Data Analyst role, please refer to the detailed role overview. You can also view the role description and contact Robyn Silk, Director ICT Local Land Services with any questions about the role. Robyn on 0421 610 315 or via email robyn.silk@lls.nsw.gov.au  How to Apply  If this role sounds ideal to you, please apply via our online portal by submitting your resume and a brief cover letter outlining how your skills and experience match what we are looking for.  Applications through email will not be accepted.  Applications Close: Thursday 16 November 2023 at 11:55 pm  Please make sure you are available for interviews on Monday 27 November 2023. We’re an innovation business that brings together the brightest minds in e-commerce, technology, media and data to transform the way people live and shop. We’re here to create better everyday experiences for our customers. We’re focused on creating a better tomorrow, in the big picture, and the fine detail. In moments big and small.   With an industry leading loyalty offering and a customer-first mindset, we are passionate about market disruption and transformational growth. Our agile teams are empowered to innovate and deliver an awesome experience for our customers - no matter whether they choose to shop in-store, or online.   We embrace diversity of thought and love to take on challenges with a pragmatic and innovative approach. Our culture thrives on mutual respect, care, curiosity, openness, and a proactive attitude. As a team we continually seek ways to pair, collaborate, support and learn from each other! What you’ll do  As a Senior Technical Business Analyst at WooliesX, you will play a vital part in our platform management squad, with a specific focus on Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC), Swrve and Branch. Due to the increased number of projects, the team is seeking a Technical Business Analyst to work on ongoing projects and continuous improvement initiatives and to add to our overall capability. The team looks after a tech stack that manages customer and transaction data, marketing automation and customer experience systems. You will also: Serve as the in-house expert on our direct communication platforms (SFMC, Swrve, Branch), including data architecture, journey builder, email and app marketing, automation and integration with other platforms Work closely with marketing and technology teams to elicit, document and prioritise business requirements for email and app campaigns and initiatives Conduct deep-dive data analysis to extract actionable insights for marketing campaigns and customer engagement Identify opportunities to improve and streamline our marketing tech stack usage, implementing best practices for email and app deliverability, segmentation and personalisation Collaborate with developers, data analysts and marketing teams to drive improvements, troubleshoot issues and ensure successful campaign execution  What you’ll bring  Coming from a background in digital technologies, you will demonstrate business acumen, excellent communication and technical know-how that will help drive success. You’re as comfortable facilitating sessions with stakeholders as you are with breaking down bugs and getting into the technical nitty gritty with the team. Your ability to zoom in on the data and details while maintaining a broad view of the bigger picture is critical. Most importantly, you should possess the strategy and skills to take an idea from inception to delivery. You will also have: Strong experience working with marketing automation platforms such as SFMC, Swrve or Branch Solid experience working with marketing automation platforms and ESPs (SFMC, Braze, Marketo, Swrve) SFMC Certifications (Marketing Cloud Developer, Marketing Cloud Email Specialist) preferred but not a must Ability to perform data analysis, including data profiling and source-to-target mapping Excellent stakeholder management skills working with large, complex, crossfunction teams, in an Agile environment Exceptional communication and presentation skills  What you’ll experience  Our Team Members are at the heart of everything we do and we’re always looking for ways to support your career journey and reward great work: A progressive and flexible ‘work from anywhere’ policy that gives you more control over your work, life and wellbeing Team discounts across our range of Woolworths Group brands you know and love and a robust rewards program that celebrates and incentivises purpose-driven work As a leader in a crucial growth-focused role you will have regular exposure to our most senior business leaders in WooliesX and the broader Woolworths group and accumulate valuable experience to grow your career in surprising ways A range of programs to help you prioritise and manage your wellbeing, including 24/7 access to the Sonder app. A progressive and competitive leave policy that gives you more space for what matters to you   Everyone belongs at Woolworths Group  Creating better experiences begins with creating inclusive and safe environments where everyone is valued, supported and empowered to bring their whole self to work and do the best work of their careers. We believe that all team members should feel valued, respected and safe irrespective of your gender, race, culture, religious beliefs, education, age, disability, family responsibilities, sexual orientation and gender identity and we encourage applications from all candidates. Together starts with you and we believe that everyone should have the opportunity to be their best, when applying for a role. Please let us know about any workplace adjustments or support that you may need. Platinum Tier Employer - Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion  Employer of Choice for Gender Equality - Workplace Gender Equality Agency. Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. See how we’re creating better experiences together, for a better tomorrow.  Discover more opportunities with Woolworths Group. Grow with the Group  As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.  We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. job_title: Senior Data Analyst - Risk and Controls
job_description: Senior Data Analyst – Risk and Control You are passionate about all things data related with a positive attitude We are a high performing team with a passion for innovation and continuous improvement. Together we can deliver an exemplary experience for our stakeholders and the Group See yourself in our team: Business Banking (BB) secures and enhances the financial wellbeing of people, businesses and communities. Business Banking (BB) offer a wide range of services and solutions to our small to medium, enterprise customers and our regional and agribusiness customers. We also take care of our personal and institutional online trading customers. The BB Governance, Framework and Risk Delivery (GFRD) team’s purpose is to support BB in achieving its strategy by providing a portfolio view of BB’s risk and compliance, ensuring consistent and effective deployment of risk frameworks and co-ordinating major risk projects. Do work that matters: Your primary contribution will be to support the Senior Manager, BB Risk & Controls Enablement (Insights) and proactively work with stakeholders from across BB (including Line 1 Op Risk, Line 2 Op Risk & Compliance, Product and Distribution teams) to assist with the following: Supporting ongoing improvements to BB’s Risk Management System RiskInSite (RiS) Data Quality Perform data extraction from various sources and cleaning to ensure data integrity with various internal stakeholders to help formulate and scope business problems. Collect and analyse data from multiple sources to identify trends and patterns and provide the business with actionable insights. Innovative insightful data driven reporting to provide transparency over policy implementation and risk framework adherence whilst driving consistency across BB Create visualisations and dashboards to help stakeholders understand data insights. Represent and advocate for BB in Group-wide Working Groups where appropriate (e.g. RiS Business Unit Administration, Data Analysis Risk Tool (DART)) Owning and designing continuous improvement initiatives Communicate complex analytical findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner We're interested in hearing from people who have: Experience with reporting automation, and medium proficiency in data analytics tools and platforms like SQL, Tableau, Tableau Prep, Teradata, Power Query and Alteryx is essential. Strong attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy whilst working to competing priorities. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability. High Level competency in Microsoft Office including, Outlook, Excel and Word Strong reporting and analytical skills Ability to think critically and use data driven insights to solve problems. Working with us: Whether you’re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career with CommBank is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with flexible work locations. One where we’re driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day. Australia’s largest privately owned Engineering Organisation Employee Benefits: Compressed work week, fitness subsidies, health care discounts, paid parental leave Highly Reputable organisation with support and mentorship. Our world is rapidly changing and the greatest challenge for our country, industry, and community is the transition to a low-carbon economy. Ampcontrol want to be at the forefront of this transition, create change and support our customers, all by tackling the challenges they will face so that they can remain competitive and prosper. To achieve our new vision, we are realistic that we also need to transform our business and the way we work. By doing so we will accelerate transformational activities so that Ampcontrol is positioned to support our customers in the global energy transition as rapidly as possible and at scale. ABOUT THE ROLE As part of our business transformation journey, we are rethinking the way we work. We are in the process of replacing both our Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, moving to an integrated Microsoft Dynamics solution. To support this implementation and ensure the long-term success of our data management efforts, we are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Master Data Management Lead to join the team. The Master Data Management Lead will have a unique opportunity to contribute to Ampcontrol’s success by establishing and leading the master data management function. This role will be pivotal in designing global standards, defining governance strategies and ensuring accuracy and integrity of master data across the business. Initially working as part of a project team, the successful candidate will gradually transition to a leadership position, taking charge of the master data function and driving strategic direction. This is an initial 12 month – full time position, with a possibility for extension. Functions the role will perform include: Collaborate with the project team and key stakeholders to define master data requirements for the CRM and ERP systems. This will include helping to define critical attributes across key master data pillars Develop and implement data governance policies, procedures and standards to establish a robust master data management framework Manage the ERP and CRM implementation teams with data cleansing and migration activities to enable a seamless transition Lead ongoing data cleansing and enrichment activities to support the continuous improvement of master data quality and accuracy Monitor and resolve data integrity issues once systems are live Establish data management best practices and provide training and guidance to end-users on master data processes Identify data domain experts within the business and enable them to support best practice data stewardship Support operational teams and system end users, providing mentorship and fostering a culture of continuous improvement Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies and evolving regulatory requirements, with a focus on information security related to master data management to ensure Ampcontrol continues to follow industry best practice in this space ABOUT YOU: Our ideal team member will possess a unique combination of technical expertise, strategic thinking and leadership skills. You will have a passion for data management and are excited about the opportunity to shape and lead the master data function at Ampcontrol. Some other key attributes might include: You are a highly motivated individual who enjoys working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment managing multiple stakeholder groups You get excited to identify and drive process improvements within the scope of master data management You are extremely organised, with strong communication skills You will demonstrate a successful track record in designing and implementing master data solutions and your experience includes setting up a master data function and leading a team Meticulousness, with a keen eye for detail are second nature for you. You recognise the importance of data integrity and accuracy and constantly strive for excellence in data management You are motivated by achieving results and driving organisational success. You will have strong analytical and problem-solving skills which enable you to identify data related issues, develop solutions and deliver measurable outcomes that positively impact business outcomes WHY AMPCONTROL? For over 50 years Ampcontrol has achieved and celebrated a growing workforce across the world. Amongst the technological firsts, awards, impressive growth and global reach, our focus on our customers and a philosophy of solving problems that others can’t, has meant our solutions redefine industry expectations. At Ampcontrol, we are united by the principles of safety, people, innovation, customer and performance. Our people and values make our business better and are at the heart of everything we do. We are committed to investing in our people and provide a supportive, healthy and safe working environment for all our employees. If you believe you have the right skills, experience and passion for succeeding in this role, please submit your cover letter and resume for consideration via the link. VideoShow moreReport

Company Description McDonald’s Australia is the largest quick service restaurant operation in the country. Fondly known as “Macca's”, we are a household name in Australia for over 50 years, we believe that our customers are the heart and soul of everything we do and make it our mission to make every moment count! As an employer of choice winner, working with us means taking pride and having fun along the way, while growing and developing your career in a dynamic and supportive environment. Not only do we offer flexible working arrangements and an attractive staff discount; but we provide an opportunity to work alongside other passionate and talented people every single day.  Job Description Could you be our next Business Analyst? At Macca’s, the Business Analyst is driving insightful decision-making, supporting financial management, and contributing to overall business growth for key stakeholders and the organisation at large. Your role is at the core of financial expertise, enhancing decision-making processes and fortifying financial management, all while nurturing the broader business. What can you expect on a day-to-day basis? Strategic Partnership: Collaborate closely with key stakeholders, providing expert advice and support on pertinent financial matters. Dynamic Reporting & Analysis: Deliver timely, accurate, and invaluable management reporting and analysis that enriches the organization and aligns with its needs and goals. This includes: Comprehensive Month/Quarter/Year End Reporting: Thorough G&A expenses analysis; Precise Month-end Profit & Loss (P&L) Statement variance analysis; Essential Support for Budgeting and Projection Processes, involving both building and analysis; Daily Cash Flow and Treasury Management for precise projection and system management and; Management of specific balance sheet accounts to mitigate potential organisational risks, such as Prepaid Accounts. Communication & Insight Generation: Translate financial data into actionable advice, analysis, and insights for stakeholders. Empower them to interpret and apply financial information to drive informed business decisions and reach set goals. Adaptable Problem-Solving: Manage ad hoc requests for financial information and business analysis, while actively identifying and seizing opportunities for process improvement both within the Finance Department and externally. Resource Development: Identify departmental needs and develop tools, templates, and resources, ensuring the department is well-equipped for effective financial management. Compliance & Accountability: Understand and uphold Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (SOX) compliance requirements, supporting the annual statutory account reporting process. Precision and Diligence: Perform general accounting tasks with accuracy, alongside any ad hoc financial duties required to achieve the outlined responsibilities.  Qualifications Your keys to success: Bachelor’s degree in Commerce, Accounting or similar 1-3+ years of hands-on experience, ideally within large corporate environments, navigating complex organisational structures and diverse teams Demonstrated history of working seamlessly within collaborative settings, excelling in building effective partnerships and fostering strong relationships with stakeholders across various domains Proficient in prioritising tasks and projects, showcasing exceptional organisational abilities to manage workflows efficiently Known for an acute eye for detail, ensuring accuracy and efficiency in all tasks undertaken Strong communication skills, adept at translating complex financial concepts into easily understandable language, tailored to the needs of diverse stakeholders Capable of managing difficult conversations and thriving in high-pressure situations with a composed and calm demeanour Strong communication skills, adept at translating complex financial concepts into easily understandable language, tailored to the needs of diverse stakeholders A proclivity for challenging the status quo, consistently seeking opportunities for improvement and offering innovative solutions Innately proactive and self-driven, demonstrating a strong initiative and eagerness to take charge of responsibilities and drive projects forward Additional Information The Maccas Difference A state-of-the-art on-site gym at our Thornleigh office Enjoy Birthday and Volunteer leave Immerse yourself in a lively and vibrant culture enriched with local events Access hundreds of retail discounts, including special offers at Macca's Embrace a highly flexible work environment that suits your lifestyle Prioritise your wellbeing with initiatives, including a 24/7 wellbeing partner for both you and your immediate family Unplug and rejuvenate with a fifth week of annual leave Ignite your professional growth with continuous development opportunities that align with your career aspirations and passions. As an equal opportunity employer, we strongly encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, ethnicities, cultures, and experiences. We strive to make every moment through the recruitment process a feel-good moment for everyone. If you’re a strategic thinker with an eye for detail, possessing the expertise and drive to influence financial excellence apply now! At Dexus, every day we come to work ready to push past our personal comfort zones, secure in the knowledge that we will always be supported to try new things, to learn, to improve – to realise our full potential. As a Finance Analyst within the Transactions & Reporting team at Dexus, you’ll help to lead and develop the real assets that power our business. You’ll be encouraged to innovate as part of an ambitious team, sharing your vision for the future of business communities and rallying the people around you to achieve it. You’ll witness your ideas coming to life and play a vital role in the positive impact we have on our customers, all while having your own personal and professional potential supported through a range of employee benefits and programs. How you will make an impact As Finance Analyst, your responsibilities will be varied ranging from advising on appropriate application of financial reporting to specific transactions, deliver insightful Board reporting based on an in-depth knowledge of the Group’s activities and coordinating the half year and year end audits to ensure deadlines are met. The Transactions and Reporting team sits within the broader Finance team. This role will participate in building pro-active relationships with Finance, a variety of Dexus Business Units and external auditors. Other responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Deliver practical, relevant and commercial financial accounting solutions that enable Dexus to achieve strategic and financial objectives Technical research; assessing the impact of new accounting standards and assisting in their implementation for Dexus Preparation of Board papers, including communication of technical accounting matters, audit fees etc. About You We are looking for a highly driven, agile and motivated individual with a demonstrated understanding of statutory reporting and/or transaction experience ideally within a Big 4 / Chartered, Audit or ASX listed property environment. Your ability to explain complex matters clearly and succinctly to stakeholders at varying levels of seniority is highly valuable. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 1-2 years post-qualification experience in a reporting/technical finance role. Prior experience in report writing and exposure to Yardi or Workiva systems will be advantageous. In addition to strong problem-solving and communication skills, a natural curiosity, willingness to take initiative and learn will see you thrive in this role. We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply for roles at Dexus, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, and people of all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application. We will partner with you to identify the best way to assist you through our recruitment process. Ready to help create the future? Apply now or visit dexus.com/careers We’re one of Australia’s leading real assets groups, actively managing a real estate and infrastructure portfolio valued at over $60 billion. From our leaders to our learners, we see real assets as our foundation of possibility, and embrace the positive impacts our work has on our investors, communities, and the futures we’re creating for them. At Dexus we value diversity and inclusion across our organisation and are proud to have our Workplace Gender Equality Accreditation, which recognises employers that are leaders in gender equality. We also provide a breadth of flexible work arrangements for all employees within our workplace and offer wellbeing support, professional development and great benefits to ensure that all of our people are engaged and feel empowered to realise their full potential. As an employee of Dexus, you will have access to and benefit from: Flexible working – such as a hybrid work model to enhance your work/life balance Benefits such as a Wellbeing Allowance, five additional annual leave ‘Dexus’ days and our Safe and Well program Professional development and memberships, as well as study assistance We value our employee’s experience with us and are proud to have: TRIBE, our established LGBTI+ Dexus network FLIP, our Future Leaders in Property program which provides exposure for young women to the property industry A partnership with Parents@Work, providing our parents and carers with coaching, education sessions and online learning Opportunities for our female leaders to attend Chief Executive Women (CEW) leaders’ program Join Dexus and have your potential realised.Show moreReport

job_description: Senior Business Analyst-Business&Systems Integration, Stakeholder management Organisation/Entity: Transport For NSW Job category: Research and Analysis Job location: Redfern, NSW, AU, 2016 Job reference number: 89925 Employment type: Fixed Term Full-Time Salary range: $147865.0-$165608.0 You’re agile, keen and open to meaningful work and opportunities that come your way.  This is your opportunity to broaden your experience and perspectives, step out of the confines of a standard project role and expand your scope to work with an interconnected ecosystem of industry professionals. Ensuring green status in all Statutory or Internal audits. Embrace multicultural environment with diverse ways of working Mental Agility: You can think critically to penetrate complex problems and expand the possibilities by making fresh connections. You think strategically whilst being execution focused and bring creativity to the challenges you’re presented with. You will have an attitude of constant learning and improving. Inquisitiveness/ curiosity around new media, digital, technology and social trends and possessing an attitude to experiment or innovate in these areas. People Agility: You bring a deep ability to understand and relate to people and navigate through tough situations to harness and multiply collective performance. You create strong positive first impressions and build those into great relationships. Self-Awareness: You have high levels of self-awareness, are reflective and know yourself well, understanding both your own strengths and weaknesses and your impact on others. Results Agility: You demonstrate consistent delivery of results in first-time situations by inspiring teams, exhibiting a presence that builds confidence in yourself and others. You operate at pace, can multi-skill effectively and are at ease in leading projects. You will be highly performance driven, commercially and financially astute. Change Agility: You have a deep natural curiosity, desire to experiment and ability to effectively deal with the heat of change. You have a growth and learning mindset: ready to test, stumble, learn and apply from experience. Highly comfortable with change and ambiguity Your chance to be Fearless is here! We mirror the rich diversity of our consumers by welcoming talented people from a variety of backgrounds, cultures, communities, and experiences to our Company. As a certified Great Place to Work, find out why bringing together different mindsets and perspectives powers our business. If you share our passion, you should consider joining our Family!  Our culture We share the passion and entrepreneurial flair of our founder and are guided by our three culture pillars - Fearless, Family and Founders, they inspire our Primos to be the best they can be and drive us forward in all we do. The International Institute of Data & Analytics (IDA) is a not-for-profit hi-tech organization with foci on data science and big data analytics innovation, education and training, and commercialization and services. IDA offers unique experiences and engagement models for bridging the gaps between academia and business, enabling industry and government `easy to do business with’ leading scientists and specialists in data & analytics, and building a platform for engagements and collaborations between outstanding researchers, practitioners and educators.  In data science and big data analytics, the IDA creates enablers for:  Leading the field of data science and analytics innovation, training and services by building think-tank and thought leadership, and next-generation of data scientists and professionals; transforming excellent research and innovation outcomes to actionable data science and analytics systems, tools, services and training for industry innovation and transformation; and building a flexible and engaging culture and platform to connect local, regional and global resources in data & analytics research and business towards developing world-class centre of excellence and research networks.  You shall find the IDA team very self-motivated, high standard and forward thinking focused, and highly hands-on.  Responsibilities  Collaborate with our clients and internal stakeholders to understand and document their business requirements, needs and objectives toward delivering project plans and business plans. Comprehensive understanding of data structures, and extract required data for analysis according to business requirements. Architect, develop and automate data analytics models and solutions. Develop analytics solutions, including data extraction, pre-processing, modeling, deployment, evaluation and maintenance. Iteratively prototype and productise analytical models and solutions per commercial standard and for production and commercialization. Make business recommendations in terms of cost-benefit, forecasting and impact analysis by effective presentations of data-driven findings to clients and stakeholders, and provide insights to clients. Document and communicate all relevant work and work outcomes. Lead and mentor junior data analysts/scientists in a closely collaborative data science project team.  Qualifications  Solid background, knowledge and capabilities in statistics, mathematics, computer science, informatics, computing, or closely relevant scientific field. At least three years of data-driven analytics hands-on experience with deep know-how of predictive modeling, machine learning and data mining, and relevant modeling approaches and algorithms. Demonstrated capabilities to prototype and productise statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data-driven solutions to problems in new domains. Demonstrated advanced knowledge of SQL (data extraction and manipulation), expertise in SAS programming, and software development skills in one to several scripting languages (Python/R). Demonstrated capabilities to communicate and engage with and manage relationships across a range of stakeholder groups and technical project teams. Demonstrated capabilities to work effectively as a member and leader of a data science project team to provide the high level specifications, management and communications. Demonstrated experience for independent problem-solving and self-motivated innovation, education and services.  Contact: Jinjiu.Li@idawise.comShow moreReport

The Country Fire Authority (CFA) is one of the world's largest, and most highly regarded, community-based emergency services organisations. We are proud of the work we do in protecting lives and property, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. CFA strives to be a values-based organisation and an organisation of choice for volunteers and employees, where people with a variety of skills, experiences and backgrounds all add value through the roles they perform.  About the Role: The Business Intelligence team plays a critical role in ensuring the safety of Victorian communities by transforming data into actionable insights. They provide high-quality, visible data and information to various stakeholders, including community programs, project leaders, brigades, media, emergency sector agencies, the Board, and the Minister's Office. As a Senior Data Analyst, you are responsible for collecting, analysing, and presenting data related to fire prevention, preparedness, response, and recovery Your role primarily focuses on spatial analysis and data visualisation using primarily ESRI platforms, while supporting other disciplines such as risk management and corporate reporting to deliver valuable, top quality data and mapping visualisations that aid decision makers. Ultimately, your work aligns with strategic objectives to enhance the decision-making process. This role manages decision support tools throughout their lifecycle, maintains a knowledge repository, addresses service requests, and applies advanced spatial and data analysis. It also involves continuous innovation, specialisation in key disciplines, vendor management, and training provision. Additionally, the role includes various data-related duties and contributing to mapping activities while adhering to standards.  About You:  Relevant qualification with well-developed experience in the methods, techniques and tools for trusted data analyses that benefit the customers of an organisation. Demonstrated knowledge and experience in the use of the ESRI suite of technologies such as ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Enterprise, Web mapping applications such as ArcGIS Online or VertiGIS applications for the collection and presentation of data. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with proven ability to optimise delivery outcomes and solve dependencies across stakeholder groups to meet quarterly milestones. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to manage stakeholder and vendor relationships at senior levels and translate complex technical matters into lay terms. Demonstrated authority as a trusted specialist that informs proposals, counsels decision makers and aligns stakeholders to product objectives.  Your application: When applying for a position with CFA, the key to progressing in the selection process is the quality of your application. Your application must demonstrate that you have the qualifications, experience, key attributes and skills required for the position.  Your application should include:  Cover letter Resume  Submitting your application: When you click the 'apply' button you will be taken to the online application form. Here you will be asked to provide personal and contact details and respond to employment-related questions.  Pre-employment checks:Offers of employment will only be made to candidates who:  Successfully complete a National Police History Check and Working with Children Check  CFA is committed to creating and maintaining a diverse, inclusive, and safe volunteer and work environment. Our aim is to have a volunteer and paid workforce that reflects the community it serves. First Nations people, women, people of all ages, with disabilities and culturally and linguistically diverse people are encouraged to apply. Applications close: 11:59pm 19th November 2023 If at any stage of the recruitment and selection process you require an alternative format to the application material or reasonable adjustment to the interview arrangements, please don't hesitate to contact the person listed on the ad or alternatively, email HR.Recruitment@cfa.vic.gov.au  The Country Fire Authority (CFA) values your privacy. Analyst Geoscientific Data Management – Perth based Work for a global mining company Opportunity to be part of a multi-disciplinary geoscience team delivering the resources of the future Perth based permanent part-time or full-time role with flexible work arrangements About the role Finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs. Rio Tinto Iron Ore’s Resource Development provides support and sustains our Pilbara Mine Operations through delivery of orebody knowledge that ensures resources are developed in time, future value opportunities are identified and developed, and tenure remains secure. The team are seeking an Analyst Geoscientific Data Management who will implement, maintain and administer data and information systems and contribute to the delivery of high quality, timely data to support wider Rio Tinto Iron Ore operations. Critical systems managed within the team include ProTrak, acQuire, Envirosys and Imago. This is a great opportunity for someone with a geology background to get into data analytics and applications and work in an office environment, or a data specialist who will thrive with developing geoscience and mining knowledge. Reporting to the Specialist Geoscientific Data this role will: Provide operational support and troubleshooting to ensure geoscientific data is current, accurate and accessible Ensure data and information management practices are undertaken in accordance with standards and procedures Advise and assist teams on best use/capabilities of databases and related systems Provide training to enable effective use of data management processes and systems Maintain a current knowledge of database, systems and related technology Support the implementation of improvement initiatives Contribute to communication, planning, implementation and review of processes Assist with implementing best practice and fit-for-purpose data and information systems, processes, practices and solutions. We’ll support and empower you to challenge yourself, learn from others, share your own ideas freely and achieve excellence in technical and leadership outcomes. You’ll get to work with key stakeholders across Operations and Technical support. Your development is important and we will support you to further build your skills and knowledge through a structured mix of experience, exposure, and education opportunities. Where you’ll be working This position will work out of the Rio Tinto Central Park building offices in the Perth CBD with flexibility to be offered on a permanent part-time or full-time basis. Occasional working from home days and ad hoc travel to site in the Pilbara region of Western Australia will form a rewarding part of the role. About you The ideal applicant will have: Proficient computer systems skills and strong data literacy Inquisitive continuous learning style with an interest in data analytics Skills in Geoscientific Data Management systems – i.e. acQuire or Envirosys Demonstrated experience working with databases, TSQL or other programming Previous experience and/or well-developed knowledge of the mining industry Tertiary qualification in Computer Science or Geoscience preferred In addition, you will have a passion for business improvement, innovation and technical excellence. What we offer A work environment where safety is always the number one priority Flexible working from home arrangements as per operational requirements 18 weeks of gender-neutral and equal paid parental leave, with continued superannuation contributions whilst employees are on unpaid or half paid parental leave A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family Attractive share ownership plan Company provided insurance cover Extensive salary sacrifice & salary packaging options Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical wellbeing support Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave) Exclusive employee discounts (banking, accommodation, cars, retail and more); and Local relocation packages offered for Australian residents only About Rio Tinto Rio Tinto is a leading global mining and materials company. We operate in 35 countries where we produce iron ore, copper, aluminium, critical minerals and other materials needed for the global energy transition and for people, communities, and nations to thrive. We have been mining for 150 years and operate with knowledge built up across generations and continents. Our purpose is finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs – striving for innovation and continuous improvement to produce materials with low emissions and to the right environmental, social and governance standards. But we can’t do it on our own, so we’re focused on creating partnerships to solve problems, create win-win and meet opportunities. In the Pilbara region of Western Australia, we own a world-class, integrated network of 17 mines, four independent port terminals, a rail network spanning nearly 2,000 kilometres and related infrastructure – all designed to respond rapidly to changes in demand. We are one of the world’s leading producers and exporters of iron ore. Every Voice Matters At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, the LGBTI+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds. Applications close on 17 Nov 2023 (Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove advertised roles prior to this date)Show moreReport

job_title: Senior Data Management Analyst | Group Treasury
job_description: Join our Group Treasury business, in Capital Data Management in this newly created role. You will join an existing team of Data professionals within the Group Treasury division focused on driving advanced data management capabilities to the growing importance of data as a strategic asset.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  As a Data Management Analyst/Manager, you will utilise your experience in data management, data quality and governance to support the delivery of data management best practices across Group Treasury. Partnering with all of Macquarie’s business divisions you will help implement and deliver the Group Treasury data management strategy.  What you offer  Knowledge of APRA Capital standards and reporting processes Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to reconcile complex issues. Strong communication skills and the ability to build relationships with stakeholders at all levels Strong attention to detail and the ability to prioritise responsibilities in a rapidly changing environment Ability to work both collaboratively and independently.  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing  About the Financial Management Group In our Financial Management Group you will work in the financial hub of Macquarie, driving real change for our businesses. You will be part of a team that plays an important role building relationships with our regulators, partners, communities and shareholders - all of which play a key role in upholding Macquarie's brand.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.  If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment. Financial Reporting Analyst | ASAP start : 4 - 6 month contract | VIC Government Agency | Melbourne CBD  Talent Street is currently seeking a Financial Reporting Analyst that specializes in financial tracking and analysis. Much of the reporting structure has already been established and so, the incumbent of this position will be tasked with the following:  Financial tracking  Liaise with finance teams to receive and provide appropriate financial data.  Consume financial updates and spend reporting, and updates actuals into the financial tracking spreadsheet.  Work with managers to understand and agree on financial forecast data in the financial tracking spreadsheet.  Perform analysis on monthly financial position then prepare and present a report on insights to senior IT leadership.  Assist with the representation of this and related items into regular reporting, including the bi-monthly Supply & Demand Forum (SDF) Budget planning  Liaise with the central finance team to understand and coordinate key timings for the budget-setting process.  Work with key IT managers to understand and incorporate new and changed budget items for the next financial year.  Organize and present a draft budget to senior IT leadership, along with advice and insights on areas that may need to be managed.  Complete the final budget for submission.  Assist with the representation of this and related items into regular reporting, including the bi-monthly Supply & Demand Forum (SDF) Contract tracking  Coordinate with contract owners on the status of upcoming contract renewals, recording and reporting on updates.  Assist contract owners in modelling future costs for new/renewing contracts.  Assists contract owners/managers in executing contracts.  Assist with the representation of this and related items into regular reporting, including the bi-monthly Supply & Demand Forum (SDF)  Work within the team on Contract tracking automation work. Capacity planning  Liaise with Project/Work Owners to ensure people requirements are regularly entered and up-to-date in the Capacity Planning tool.  Liaise with Resource Owners to ensure capacity allocations are regularly entered and up-to-date in the Capacity Planning tool.  Facilitate regular meetings to ensure no capacity conflicts exist, and that any conflicts are identified and actions are captured.  Assist with the representation of this and related items into regular reporting, including the bi-monthly Supply & Demand Forum (SDF)  Strong Excel skills is a must, as is your ability to liaise with peers and across teams, including finance teams and your ability to present data to senior IT management.  For further information please apply or contact Phalla at pkeo@talentstreet.com.auShow moreReport

Experience in stakeholder management across multiple functions Ability to influence stakeholders without direct line of authority Demonstrated ability to deal with ambiguous problems comfortably Supported commercial decision making through the delivery of accurate insights Experience in dealing with large datasets, preferably exposed to budgeting and forecasting processes SAP and TM1 knowledge desirable Take your next step into something bigger, apply now With us it’s not about the discounts (although you do get those), it’s about joining a team where your wellbeing and professional development is invested in and celebrating your contributions is the norm. And because everyone leads unique lives, we offer flexible work including work from home, additional leave and parental leave entitlements. We’re continuing to build a gender equitable team, and a culture that’s just as diverse, inclusive and welcoming as the communities we serve. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures (including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples), abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities. We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support candidates with disability. Find out more in the ‘Our Recruitment Process’ section of our careers site. Let's talk about nib The nib Group has a mission and vision of people enjoying better health. Through our success, we aspire to more prosperous and sustainable communities, not only the creation of enterprise value. nib is a trusted health partner, helping members and travellers make more informed healthcare decisions, transact with healthcare systems and generally live healthier lives. We’re looking for people who share this passion and want to be a part of a team that has the appetite and ambition to be extraordinary. Extraordinary comes in different perspectives and experiences. We’re committed to an environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to be their authentic selves, every day. nib offers a hybrid work location model that is designed to support flexibility. Let's talk about this role Reporting to the Data Product Manager, as a Technical Business Analyst, you will be responsible for analysing business requirements and scoping the criteria for the development of appropriate data products to satisfy the business user’s requirements. Key to this role is managing the priorities within our squads and communicating with the business stakeholders. Other responsibilities of this role include: Proactive problem solving and strong attention to detail Maintain and prioritise the team backlog in collaboration with the product manager and other team members Act as a Technical Product Owner in the squad based delivery model. Facilitate agile ceremonies Formulate and maintain technical specifications and user stories including detailed acceptance criteria Let's talk about you With prior experience in a Technical Business Analyst role, you consider yourself someone who can take a high-level business concept and have the ability to scope the technical requirements for a data delivery team. To be effective, you will also have: Experience as a Technical Business Analyst in a delivery team High-level written and verbal communication skills to assist with effective stakeholder management A track record of taking ownership, through transparent communication, prioritisation, and ability to meet deadlines Excellent collaboration skills in cross functional teams with the ability to communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities A broad enterprise-wide view and understanding of business processes and drivers having significant work experience within large – medium size business corporations. Previous experience with SQL scripting is desirable Tertiary qualifications and/or relevant experience Industry specific knowledge and experience is desirable At nib, we recognise that some people may only apply when their education, skills and/or experiences are identical to what an employer is looking for in a candidate. We're always on the lookout for curious individuals who will add to the culture at nib Group - so if this role resonates with you, please apply! For more information about tech at nib, please take check out our tech careers page: https://www.nib.com.au/careers/tech Let's talk about working at nib  Our hybrid working approach means our employees work outside of the office for the majority of the time. Our hubs offer workspaces to connect and collaborate for events, meetings, or activities. To help our employees embrace working outside of the office, we provide financial support to set up and maintain their home workspace. nib's approach to flexibility is focused on personalisation and giving our employees choice - not only in where they work, but also when and how.  Other benefits to support you at work (and play) include: Generous discounts on nib health and travel insurance products including 50% discount on employee health insurance The opportunity to give back to the community through paid leave for volunteering through nib Foundation Support your better health - whatever that looks for you - through our nib Well Program and corporate fitness discounts Access to our employee share plans, short-term incentive program and life and salary continuance insurance benefits Benefits to support our diverse workforce with 18 weeks paid parental leave for all new parents regardless of carer status, 5 days paid cultural leave for First Nations peoples and 4 weeks paid gender affirmation leave for trans, gender diverse and intersex employees The fine print All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check (including criminal history and bankruptcy check) prior to commencement of employment.
