Job Description Location: Melbourne | CBD Job type: Full time Organisation: Department of Government Services Salary: $105,479 - $127,621 Occupation: Technology Reference: VG/1759758 The Victorian Government Cyber Incident Response Service (CIRS) is seeking a talented and self-motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our team.  CIRS sits within the Department of Government Services. It provides organisations with access to expert cyber incident response and coordination services. This includes technical, forensics and communications specialists. These experts assist with reducing the scope, impact and severity of cyber incidents as they impact the Victorian Government.  The Senior Data Analyst operates within the Cyber Defence Centre (CDC) and is a key member of the CIRSteam. The position is responsible for the leadership, innovation, design, development and delivery of cyber threat and cyber risk insights and analytic products that are produced for Victorian Government stakeholders.  About you  As our ideal candidate, you will have:  Demonstrated experience in analytics and business intelligence web and product development and operational support through code (software engineering) and BI products/tooling.  Well-developed communication skills including workshop participation, product demonstration, requirements and design documentation, presentation skills.  Demonstrated experience in analysing issues from different perspective, identifying and proposing workable solutions, implementing solutions and evaluating effectiveness and adjusting actions as required.  Demonstrated experience establishing and maintaining relationships with people at all levels and from different backgrounds and organisations to achieve outcomes and manage risks.  Mandatory requirement  Ability to successfully acquire and maintain a NEGATIVE VETTING 2 level security clearance in Australia (requires Australian citizenship).  The closing date for this position is 19 November 2023.  Current VPS employees are strongly encouraged to apply via the Jobs and Skills Exchange (JSE) platform.  How to apply  Apply before the advertised closing date. All applications should include:  a resume; and a cover letter which addresses the key selection criteria (within three pages).  This position is only open to applicants with relevant rights to work in Australia.  Other relevant information  The department is committed to providing and maintaining a working environment which is safe and without risk to the health of its employees and clients and consistent with the department's obligations under the Occupational Health and Safety Act 2004 (OH&S Act), to support this DPC has a COVID-19 Vaccination policy which strongly recommends all DPC employees be fully vaccinated. Work type: Permanent Full time Region: NSW- Sydney CBD  Further your career as a quant analyst within a cutting-edge front office team that cares about culture  It’s more than a career at NAB. It’s about more opportunity, more moments to make a difference and more focus on you.  You make NAB. You get it done for our customers and our communities. You’re laying the foundations for NAB’s future success. Together we’ll grow, excel for our customers, and make this a workplace to be proud of.  It’s a good time to see what more you can find at NAB as a Quantitative Analyst  A new opportunity has become available within NAB’s highly respected front office Quant Research Analytics team, within our Markets business. The role exists in a dynamic and collegiate team of quant analysts, engineers and developers engaged in researching, designing, building, and supporting core infrastructure that is utilised globally and extensively by the bank across Trading, Sales and Structuring activities.  The roles and responsibilities of the team have recently expanded, resulting in a new position created to assist with the delivery of new initiatives, coupled with the ongoing development and support of existing projects. This is a rare opportunity to learn and grow in an exciting front office trading environment.  You will be enabled and empowered to be your best self with long term opportunities for further growth and development to strengthen your expertise within a team that cares about culture and excellence, and who are ready to celebrate your growth and achievements.  DESIREABLE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS  Quantitative skills:  Financial Markets knowledge and experience working with one or more asset class (Rates, FX, XVA etc) Derivative pricing and risk management models Exposure to stochastic processes and associated techniques A drive to learn new concepts, develop original ideas and adapt these to practical applications.  Coding skills:  C# coding development experience (ideally 3+ years) Exposure to professional coding practices (source control, unit testing, peer review, JIRA etc) A passion for good clean design with a disciplined and careful approach to software development An appreciation for the importance of quality dialog with stakeholders and colleagues during the coding process  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills:  Clarity in both written and spoken communication Ability to listen Ability to process complexity and boil down to simple, clear terms Enjoys working in a team environment – collaboratively, respectfully, sharing of ideas, effort and success  Other useful skills but not required:  Python Data science  Experience and Education:  3+ years’ experience, ideally within financial markets, as part of a Quantitative Analytics team Experience delivering and supporting high-quality tools and applications in continuing consultation with stakeholders A work history that demonstrates the ability to work constructively and collaboratively within a larger inter-disciplinary team Undergraduate degree level or above in a numerate discipline (Maths, Physics, Engineering etc.)  A diverse and inclusive workplace works better for everyone. At NAB, we’re intent on building a culture we can all be proud of. One based on trust and respect. An uplifting environment where every single one of us feels appreciated and empowered to be our true, authentic selves. A diverse and inclusive workplace where our differences are celebrated, and our contributions are valued. It’s a huge part of what makes NAB such a special place to be.  Choose NAB to accelerate your Quant career:  If you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. job_title: Product Data Scientist - TikTok Data Analysis - Australia
job_description: Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.  Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.  About the Team The Product Data Analytics Team analyses a combination of product usage and product performance data to derive meaningful insights that would serve as a guide to better product and decision making for our business leaders. The team will work through different business scenarios including improving Live app Experiences, Host Operation, User experiences. In addition, it is important to manage the data life cycle to ensure problems are quantitatively measured to propose logical solutions.  Responsibilities:  Responsible for the data analytics work in international LIVE business, including but not limited to live gifts, host interaction, strategies, enhancing the live streaming revenue. Identify and analyse key factors driving the growth of international LIVE, and propose enhancement plans with logical data support Responsible for the design and analysis of A/B experiments, product iteration impact evaluation, marketing campaign analysis, key metrics trend analysis, etc Work with cross functional partners like Product Managers, Operations, R&D for product optimisation plans and boost business growth Perform market activity analysis and any other analytics that would help guide product and business in decision making.  Qualifications 1. Bachelor degree or above in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or other related majors; 2. At least 3 years of experiences and above; Experience in supporting analytical work of internet or large scale C2C products is preferred; 3. Proficient in SQL, skilled use of visualisation tools 4. Experience in data extraction, analysis and visualisation in a complex data environment, and have experiences in data landing to the business 5. Excellent communication skills with ability to communicate conclusions effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences, and good analysis report writing ability; 6. Strong learning ability and curiosity driven mindset, independent and possess collaborative problem solving skills  TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.  In the spirit of reconciliation, TikTok acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their Elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.Show moreReport
